loans.name: Margeolina

texts.en:
Margeolina is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Margeolina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Margeolina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Margeolina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Margeolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is requesting a new loan to buy better-quality sewing materials and fabric to satisfy her customers. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better-quality sewing materials and fabric to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Sisa

texts.en:
Sisa is 50 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Sisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sisa has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Sisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Raquela

texts.en:
Raquela is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Raquela is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Raquela has a food vending business in the Philippines. Raquela requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Raquela has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Raquela would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Dolores has a general store business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Dolores has been in this business for three years. In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es:
José, de 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que la escuela estaba demasiado lejos y por el nivel de pobreza que tenía, tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño, está casado y tiene 3 hijos.

José, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, porque no tuvo la oportunidad de prepararse para tener un mejor trabajo.

José, necesita el dinero para comprar lámina para el techo de su casa, porque se acerca el invierno y las paredes de su casa son de adobe y corre el riesgo que se caigan.

José, sueña con viajar al extranjero para trabajar en un lugar donde le paguen mejor, para poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ya que por mucho tiempo ha trabajado y es poco lo que ha logrado conseguir.
texts.en:
José, is 59 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school, as the school was too far away, and because of his poverty, he had to work from a very young age. He is married and has three children.

José has always been a farmer, because he did not have the opportunity to be educated in order to have a better job.

José need some money in order to buy sheet metal for the roof of his home, because winter is approaching and the walls of his home are adobe and he runs the risk of them falling down.

José dreams of traveling outside the country in order to work somewhere where are they will pay him better so that he can provide a better future for his  children, as he has worked for a long time and has managed to earn little.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal for the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. Jovelyn is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jovelyn has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal products sale business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Analyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  purchase more personal products such as body lotion, perfume, umbrellas and personal collection.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products such as body lotion, perfume, umbrellas and personal collection

loans.name: Janzen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janzen works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Janzen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Janzen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 38 years old and married with three children.

Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, sugar and other personal care products.

Jean has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jean aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, sugar and other personal care products

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, sugar and other personal care products.

Editha has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Editha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, sugar and other personal care products

loans.name: Mery Cris

texts.en:
Mery Cris is 24 years old and married with two children. Mery Cris works very hard to provide for them.

Mery Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Mery Cris has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Evelyn has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell like dressed chicken, hot dogs, meat and other frozen foods.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell like dressed chicken, hot dogs, meat and other frozen foods

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is widowed and has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 42 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Mary Jane has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jane has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 43 летняя жительница не большого района Яван. Яван отличается своей неповторимой природой и климатом от других районов. Гулбахор замужем и имеет одного сына и внука. Ее муж с сыном работают в Российской Федерации. Гулбахор с невесткой и внуком живут на Родине и занимаются животноводством. На данный момент переводы денег от мужа и сына сократились, и Гулбахор хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность и увеличить доход, чтобы покрыть расходы семьи. С такими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. На заемные деньги она приобретет пару голов скотов.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a 43-year-old woman from the small region of Yavan. Yavan is known for its unique countryside and climate compared to other regions. Gulbahor is married and has one son and grandson. Her husband and son are working in the Russian Federation. Gulbahor, her son's wife, and her grandson live in their native country and do farm work. 

Currently, the money sent by her husband and son has diminished, and Gulbahor wants to expand her cattle husbandry business and increase her income to cover the family's expenses. With this in mind, she has applied for a loan. With the money she receives, she will buy a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Zulfi

texts.ru: Зулфи молодая, добрая, общительная и гостеприимная девушка из городка Куляб. Народ Куляба славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства и чувство юмора. Зулфи замужем и имеет двухлетнего сыночка. Ее муж строитель. Зулфи дома занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды. Она старается помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Она хочет создать хорошие условия работы. На часть заемных денег она намерена приобрети новую швейную машинку, на остальную часть она собирается отремонтировать дом. Она верит, что ей не откажут в кредите и заранее выражает благодарность.
texts.en:
Zulfi is a young woman from the little town of Kulob. She is kind, outgoing and hospitable. The people of Kulob are known for their hospitality and sense of humor. Zulfi is married and has a two-year old son. Her husband is a construction worker. Zulfi sews traditional women's outfits out of her home. She works hard to help her husband support their family. She would like to create proper work conditions. 

Zulfi plans to use part of her loan to buy a new sewing machine and use the rest to renovate her house. She trusts that her request will not be denied and expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and renovate her house.

loans.name: Jinigul

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Чинигул. Она жительница района Кубодиен. Чинигул разведена с мужем, и она живет сыном. У нее два сына. Старший сын женат, и он живет отдельно. Младший сын  работает управляющим в компании мегафон. Чинигул прекрасная женщина. Она в районе хочет заниматься купли продажей фисташки, орехи и миндаль. Она планирует покупать  больше миндаль и фисташки и очистит кожуру, и продать их на рынке. Очищенные  фисташки и миндаль стоить дорога, а не очищенные дешевле. С большими надеждами  Чинигул обратилась к Вам за кредитом, чтобы открыт свой бизнес. За счет кредита  она перевозить больше фисташки и миндаль, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en:
This woman is named Jinigul, and she lives in the Qubadiyon region. Jinigul is divorced from her husband, and she lives with her son. She has two sons. The older son is married, and he lives alone. The younger son works as a manager at MegaFon [a mobile phone company]. 

Jinigul is an excellent woman. She wants to work in the region by buying pistachios, nuts, and almonds for resale. She plans to buy many almonds and pistachios, shell them, and resell them at the market. Shelled pistachios and almonds are expensive, and ones with their shells are cheaper. With high hopes, Jinigul has approached you for a loan to open her business. With the loan amount she will be able to transport many pistachios and almonds to start her business.

loans.use: to buy pistachios and almonds to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling farm inputs

loans.name: Sony Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, who is in her mid 30s, is single with three sons; all of them are still in school. She has been running a retail shop for seven years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Beatrice's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to have a bar business, but now has left that business and has moved to a retail shop business and is doing fine.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase the shop inventory to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of making her shop big.

Beatrice will share this loan with her loan group, Sony, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  increase the shop inventory to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 56-year-old farmer based in Bosamaro Village in the Nyamira region of Kenya. She started farming 35 years ago on a 3-acre piece of land that she owns in the area. 

With the help of her children, Mary grows maize and vegetables and raises dairy animals and poultry. Mary is seeking a poultry loan to grow the number of chickens she keeps on her farm. This investment is likely to pay off within a very short time because eggs are collected regularly and fed to the ever-growing demand in the market. 

Income from the investment will help her look after her family's needs and pay for her four children's education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Proferia

texts.en:
Proferia is 59 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Proferia has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Proferia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

Proferia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Proferia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Lau's Group

texts.en:
Lau is a 57-year-old married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years, she has been running a babysitting business caring for the children of working parents in her community. Lau is the Group leader of a five-member loan group living in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is in the centre wearing a white jacket. All of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Lau would like a loan to pay for the education costs of her children. She hopes this will provide her children with better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her children.

loans.name: Lembah Rinjani Group

texts.en:
These are the members of “Lembah Rinjani” Group who is posing in front of a cow cage. The Group is led by the 50 year-old farmer Mahrum, who is standing in the front right, pointing his two thumbs up and wear a white religious fez at his head. The other farmers in the group are Ipin, Kamrun, Uki, Halil, Mahrip, Santun, Muh, and Azwan. Because Halil and Mahrip were unable to attend at photo-taking process, they were represented by Inak Ati (Halil's wife) and Zubaidah (Mahrip's wife). Both of these women have agreed to be displayed on Kiva. All of them live in a small village in East Lombok District, Lombok Island, Indonesia. Mahrum has a family with four children. He also is a figure of religious and member of community society in his village. 

Mahrum has high hopes for his family and he strives to improve his economic conditions. In 2006, after he returned from Malaysia, he was concerned to see many of the poor farmers in his village. He run a small scale vegetable farming and established a farmer group. His business runs well. Two years ago, he bought some beef-cattle which he fattened for resale. However, he was troubled with the high price of chemical fertilizers. He also concerned to see the cow dung was wasted without further processing and it started to pollute the surrounding neighborhood.

After socialized by YRE and Yayasan Mitra Membangun Masyarakat Sejahtera/YM3S (a local foundation – biogas construction partner of Yayasan Rumah Energi) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Mahrum saw the biogas program is a solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants or sell it to increase revenue. Mahrum feel enthusiastic to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible.

He have an optimism that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas and also establish bio-slurry related business to create a new job opportunity to his surrounding neighborhood.

loans.use: To build Bio-digester and utilization of biogas residue (Bio-Slurry) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nena has a general store business in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Nena has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 31 years old and has four children who are in school.

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, bread, etc. to sell in her store.

Vilma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, and bread to sell in her store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 63 years old and married with 10 children. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nieva dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to resell.

loans.name: Salimatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé 27 Décembre 2010 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe compte actuellement 09 cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois presque 05 années de compagnonnage. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Salimatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de 07 enfants : 05 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans de glace, d’eau fraiche et de crème glacée. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  04 sacs de sucre de 50 kg à 22000f le sac, 02 bassines de 25 litre  d’oseille pour les crèmes glacées  à 4000 f la bassine, 03 bassines  de pain de singe à 2000f la bassine toujours pour les crèmes glacées des sachets et d’autres condiments et paie un transport de 2500 f pour ensuite le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, en plus de rendre pérenne l’activité, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales plus particulièrement dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants,  les soins médicaux et acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Created 27 December 2010 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" loan association, this group currently has accomplished nine cycles in the "banc villageois" program after almost five years of membership. Group members are all from the same village and share strong bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is small retail trade.

Mrs Salimatou (standing on the far right and raising her hand), is the group's featured borrower. She is a 37-year-old married mother of seven children, five boys and two girls. She is an active retailer of ice, fresh water and ice cream, and has good experience in this field.

She intends use the new loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of sugar at 22,000 francs a bag, two 25-liter basins of sorrel for ice cream at 4,000 francs a basin, three basins of baobab fruit at 2,000 francs a basin, also used in ice cream, plastic bags of fresh water, other condiments. She pays 2,500 francs for transportation fees and then sells retail in her neighborhood.

In addition to making the business sustainable, she intends to use the profits to support her husband in managing family expenditures, especially regarding her children's education and health care, and eventually buy a house.

loans.use: buy four 50-kilo bags of sugar at 22,000 francs a bag, sorrel for ice cream at 4,000 francs the basin, baobab fruit at 2,000 francs a basin, also used in ice cream.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from raising livestock.

Letty dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 46 years old, married and has seven children. 

Dominga is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dominga has been farming vegetables for two years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 43 years old and has eight children.  Elma is married and has five children who are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and married with four children. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Suman

texts.ru: Суман молодая девушка из городка Куляб. Ей всего 19 лет. Она живет вместе с мамой. Маме 60 лет, она пенсионерка. Суман покрывает расходы благодаря ее швейной деятельности. Суман дома принимает заказы на шитье. Она любит свою работу. Ей нравится придумывать новые фасоны и предоставлять клиентам. Несмотря на свой возраст, она уже имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Суман решила отремонтировать дом, но ей не хватает не большой суммы, чтобы купить стройматериалы и она приняла решение обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Suman is a young woman from the city of Kulob.  She is only 19 years old and lives with her mom.  Her mother is 60 and retired.  Suman covers the family's expenses thanks to her sewing activity.  She takes orders and works from home.  She loves her work.  She likes to come up with new design ideas and to provide a good service to her customers.  In spite of her age, she already has some regular customers.  Suman has decided to renovate her house, but she still needs a small sum of money in order to buy some construction materials.  For this reason, she has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Hery

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste est un homme dynamique de 31 ans qui vit avec sa femme et ses 2 enfants dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe. Ce passionné de musique exerce une activité de vente de sandales au grand marché de la ville. Avec la naissance de ses enfants, Jean baptiste a dû prendre ses responsabilités et cela fait bientôt 8 ans qu’il a démarré sa propre affaire.

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 4 ans. Les différents prêts lui ont permis d’augmenter son stock mais également de diversifier ses produits en proposant maintenant d’autres types de chaussures (mocassins, tennis). Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va donc racheter de nouvelles chaussures. 

Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il a déjà réussi à acheter quelques équipements pour son foyer (un lecteur et une télévision) qui lui ont permis d’améliorer le quotidien et la qualité de vie de sa famille. Il espère un jour pouvoir construire sa propre maison tout en continuant à garantir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a dynamic, 31-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in the urban area of Antsirabe.  He is passionately interested in music and sells sandals at the main town market.  With the birth of his children eight years ago, Jean Baptiste responded to his new responsibilities and opened his own business.

He has now been working with the field partner, Vahatra, for four years, and has used his various loans to increase his stock holding and offer a wider range of shoes including mocassins and trainers.  This new loan will also be used to buy more shoes.

Jean Baptiste has spent his profits on various items for his household (including a dvd player and television) which have increased the quality of life of his family.

In the future, Jean Baptiste would like to build his own house and continue to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of sandals for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama revendeuse de pagnes, d'huile rouge et bazins depuis 1995, Ama âgée de 42ans sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille. Elle a en charge un enfant de 15ans qui est scolarisé.
texts.en:
Ama has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), red oil and damask fabrics since 1995.  She is 42 years old and is responsible for one fifteen-year-old child who attends school.

This will be the third loan for Ama and she will use it to buy more stocks and meet the needs of her customers.  She would like to expand her business and provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), red oil and damask fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam vit avec son mari et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a ouvert une boutique des produits de beauté et prêt à porter en 2008. Manquant de fonds pour renforcer son activité, elle fait un cinquiéme crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite épanouir sa famille et faire de bons chiffres d'affaires.
texts.en:
Enyonam lives with her husband and their three children in Lomé.  In order to help her husband provide for the needs of their family, Enyonam began selling beauty products and ready-to-wear clothing in 2008.  However, she does not have sufficient funds to improve her business so she has requested a fifth loan from the field partner.

Enyonam's goals for the future are to improve the living conditions of her family and run a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dendina

texts.en:
Dendina is 52 years old and is married with nine children. With three children in school, Dendina works very hard to provide for them.

Dendina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, Dendina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 45 years old and is married with five children. With three children in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, sardines, diapers, noodles and other groceries. Letecia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.
 
In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Neonette

texts.en:
Neonette is 51 years old and is married with eight children. With seven children in school, Neonette works very hard to provide for them.

Neonette runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Neonette would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lerina

texts.en:
Lerina is 43 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Lerina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Lerina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Lerina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Marietta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 37 years old and is married with five children. With four children in school, Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, school supplies and other groceries. Carmen has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pig. Emilia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 38-year-old married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marites has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. Marites requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack food, seasonings and other groceries.

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack food, seasonings and other groceries.

loans.name: Alirio Rafael

texts.es:
Alirio es un hombre trabajar, honesto, honrado, tiene gran cariño y aprecio por su familia, siempre trata de apoyarlos y brindarles su atención, se dedica a fabricar calzado en la comodidad de su hogar, en uno de los cuartos tiene instalado un taller de fabricación, produciendo línea propia y también hace producciones para empresa o personas naturales.

Es padre de 3 hijos menores de edad, teniendo dos mujeres de 16 y 8 y el menor un campeón de 5 años de edad, que no solo son sus hijos, son su luz, su motivo de seguir adelante, por ellos trabaja fuertemente, trata de ser mejor empresario cada día y darles una buena calidad de vida.

Inicio a ser independiente hace poco, en el 2014 fue cuando decidió buscar su propio camino y dejo la empresa donde laboraba antes que era de su madre quien le enseño todo lo que sabe de calzado.

Como inicio hace poco no cuenta con mucho capital de trabajo y le hace falta materiales, por ello solicita un apoyo económico para solventar estas necesidades, con el préstamo desea comprar cuero, suelas, cordones, plantillas y algunos accesorios que hacen especiales su calzado.
texts.en:
Alirio is hard-working, honest, and honourable. He really loves and looks after his family, and always tries to support them and give them his time and attention. Alirio makes a living producing footwear in the comfort of his own home. He has a workshop in one of the rooms of his home. There, he produces his own line of shoes, and produces for private buyers and businesses.

Alirio is father to three children: two daughters, 16 and 8 years old, and one son, 5 years old. These three are not just Alirio’s children, however; they are his light, his motivation to do better. He works hard for them, and tries to be a better businessman every day and give them a higher quality of life.

Alirio became an independent trader only recently. In 2014 he decided to look for his own path in life and left the business where he was working. Alirio learned the footwear trade from his mother.

Having only recently started his business, Alirio does not have a lot of working capital and he needs certain materials. He is therefore applying for financial support in order to resolve this issue and will use this loan to buy leather, soles, insoles, laces and other items that make his footwear so special.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, insoles and laces to make footwear.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi habite à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à sa charge. Afi est une femme mariée et âgée de 55 ans. Pour contribuer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille, Afi vend des pagnes pour trouver un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Afi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois. Afi demande ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour favoriser un bon épanouissement à ses enfants
texts.en:
Afi lives in Adidogome with three children under her care. She is a 55-year-old married woman.

To contribute towards the family's daily expenses, Afi sells pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) to generate sufficient income for food. Afi resupplies four times a month.

Afi is requesting this loan to buy lengths of pagnes from which she can draw profit, to promote her children's favorable development.

loans.use: buy eight lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme veuve qui est âgée de 34 ans et vit à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à sa charge. Elisabeth est une couturière qui vend des habits fait de pagnes à ses clients d’avoir le bénéfice afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elisabeth s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour  commander des pièces de pagne, Elisabeth demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour réaliser ses attentes et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 34-year-old widow living in Adidogome with three dependent children.

Elisabeth is a seamstress who sells clothes made from pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) to her customers, to generate sufficient earnings to provide for her children. Elisabeth resupplies once a month at the market.

Elizabeth is requesting this loan to finance her purchase of lengths of pagne fabric, so she can have a good profit margin, achieve her expectations and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy five lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Olvin Arturo

texts.es:
Olvin es un agricultor de 21 años que se dedica junto con su padre a la producción de Café orgánico y miel orgánica a Olvin le gustaría diversificar sus ingresos lo cual permitiría tener mayores oportunidades para superarse actualmente Olvin tiene como meta ahorrar para poder tener un principio económico al momento de formar su hogar.
Olvin solicita un crédito para construir un invernadero donde piensa cosechar tomate 100% orgánico para vender en mercados locales por medio de COCAFCAL, a Olvin le gusta la idea de producir productos orgánicos ya que él tiene un gran amor por el medio ambiente y la naturaleza.
La producción de productos hortícolas orgánicos es algo novedoso en la región ya que las condiciones son buenas para la producción y el mercadeo,  además por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual Olvin es socio él puede optar a vender sus tomates a mejores precios. 
Un préstamo ayudaría a Olvin a tener los ingresos necesarios para ahorra y así tener la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Olvin is 21 years old and a farmer. He works with his father producing organic coffee and honey. Olvin would like to diversify his sources of income, giving him more opportunities to get ahead in life. Olvin’s current goal is to save money so that he has savings when he starts his own family.

Olvin is applying for a loan through COCAFCAL in order to build a winter pasture where he plans to grow tomatoes that are 100% organic. He can then sell the tomatoes at local markets. Olvin likes producing organic products as he really loves the environment and nature.

Producing organic vegetables is new to Olvin’s local region. Conditions are good here for producing and marketing organic products. In addition, through COCAFCAL, which Olvin is a member of, he can choose to sell his tomatoes at a better price.

This loan would help Olvin to earn the necessary income to save up and do better in life.

loans.use: to buy materials, including wood, protective blanket, bags made with coconut fibre and tomato plants, to build a winter pasture.

loans.name: Benkakan Group

texts.fr:
La dame au bout avec le bélier en main est Kotenté.
Kotenté vit dans une commune rurale au mali, mariée âgée de 35 ans, analphabète mère de 8 enfants dont 2  scolarisés. Ses enfants sont âgés de 1 à 15 ans, son mari est cultivateur, elle même fait l’embouche ovines.
  Elle rêve du  bien-être de ses enfants, en santé, nourriture suffisante et préparer leur avenir.
Ko tenté est ambitieuse et motivée pour l’épanouissement de sa famille, raison pour laquelle elle fait   recourt au RMCR. Avec ce prêt de 100 000Fcfa elle va acheter des béliers pour les engraissés afin de réaliser des profits pour les besoins de sa famille. Kotenté s’approvisionne au marché local  et  y revend ses produits au comptant, elle affirme n’avoir  aucun problème dans l’exercice de ses activités.
Elle à 4 ans d’expériences. L’activité est  rentable raison pour  laquelle elle l’exerce. Les revenus de son embouche lui permettent de faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kotenté is on the far right in the photo, with a goat.  She lives in a rural community in Mali and is 35 years old.  Kotenté is married and has eight children, two of whom attend school.  Her children are aged between one and fifteen years old.  She is unable to read or write and is married to a farmer.

Kotenté raises goats for a living and is an ambitious woman who wants to provide for the well-being of her children, their healthcare, good food and a secure future.  In order to improve conditions for her family, she works with the field partner RMCR.  Her 100,000 franc CFA loan will buy goats from the local market which Kotenté will fatten up before selling again, for cash, at the local market.  

Kotenté has four years' experience in her profitable business and has never had any major problems with it.

Her profits will be used to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy goats for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 44 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, seasonings and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children. She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, oil and other seasonings.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, oil and other seasonings.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 52-year-old married woman with eleven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 41 years old and is married with four children, who are all in school. Chona works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, snack foods and other groceries. Chona has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries.

In the future, Chona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of ten children, Felomina works hard to support her family.

She has a spice selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Felomina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of spices to sell in her stall.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.fr: Katsuva est une commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédit «Agape», âgée de 46 ans, veuve, mère de 9 enfants  dont 3 scolarisés, 3 n’étudient plus et 3 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson locale communément  appelée Mandale dans une buvette à domicile dans un quartier environnant la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des ingrédients de fabrication (maïs, manioc, sorgho, soja, etc.). Ainsi, il souhaite  renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Katsuva is a trader and member of the loan group 'Agape'.  She is 46 years old, widowed and mother to nine children.  Three of her children still attend school, three have left school and three are married.

Katsuva has been selling Mandale (a local drink) in a district in the suburbs of the town for twenty years. She has requested this loan from the field partner Hekima in order to expand her business.  She will buy ingredients (maize, cassava, sorghum, soya, etc).  Katsuva hopes to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.

She is grateful to Hekima for the support that they offer to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (maize, cassava, sorghum, soya, etc) to make soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Sr.de Torrechayoc De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco “SR.DE TORRECHAYOC  DE YANAHUARA” .  
La socia Yanet tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, arroz entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the bank “SR.DE TORRECHAYOC  DE YANAHUARA” .  

The member called Yanet is 41 years old and is in a common law marriage. Yanet divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store. She has run this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. The effort that she puts in to her business is how she has been able to provide for her family.  

Yanet is asking for a loan to buy fizzy drinks and rice among other things. 

The group's members are grateful for the loan and promise to complete their established payments

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks and rice among other things.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina vive junto a sus 04 hijos y esposo en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola en los diferentes cultivos de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Cuenta con experiencia en su negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de herramientas para su negocio así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Agustina espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que va a permitirle incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina lives with her four children and husband in her own house in the district of Zaña.  The community where she lives is peaceful and the local people work in agriculture and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

Agusting works as a farm hand on different farms.  She also raises and sells animals and has experience in the business and steady customers who give very good personal and work references about her.  The loan will be used to buy tools for her business and to provide maintenance for the worn out ones she currently has.  Agustina hopes to be able to provide better customer service by doing this, allowing her to increase her level of income and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for maintenance of the tools she has.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 25 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Akossiwa vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique. Akossiwa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de spaghettis et de détergents afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Akossiwa désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 25-year-old married woman who lives and works in the Adidogomé neighborhood.  She sells staple food products in a shop.  She stocks up at the market three times per month.  She is taking this loan to order boxes of spaghetti and detergent, and to increase her sales and her profits.  Akossiwa is relying on her profits to help her husband cover the family's expenses and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of spaghetti and six boxes of detergent.

loans.name: Carlos Orlando

texts.es:
Carlos, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y estudio 3 meses electricidad en fomilenio; está soltero y vive solo con su mamá.

Carlos, trabaja desde hace 3 años como técnico de instalaciones eléctricas, después de terminar el bachillerato, a su comunidad llego la oportunidad de inscribirse en ese taller para aprender el oficio, puso mucho empeño y luego uno de los ingenieros, le dio la oportunidad para que impartiera el curso de electricidad 
y desde hace 3 años trabaja con él.- Antes, trabajaba como jornalero, sembrando maíz y frijol.

Carlos, con el préstamo comprará herramientas básicas para su trabajo, porque el equipo con el que trabaja, es de su jefe y cuando salen trabajos extras con familiares y conocidos, no cuenta con el equipo para realizarlos.

El sueña con tener casa propia, un vehículo para andar sus herramientas y el equipo de trabajo más seguro, además desea apoyar en todo a su mamá.
texts.en:
Carlos, 23, received a high school education and studied a three-month electricity course through Fomilenio.  He is single and lives with his mother.

For three years Carlos has been working as an electrical installation technician.  After finishing high school he had the opportunity in his community to sign up for a workshop to learn his trade.  One of the engineers gave him the opportunity to take an electricity course and he worked hard.  He has been working for him for three years now.  Carlos used to work as a farm hand, planting corn and beans.

Carlos will use the loan to buy basic tools for his work because the ones he has belongs to his boss.  When they go out to do extra jobs for their relatives and acquaintances, he does not have his own tools to work with.

His dream is to have his own house, a vehicle to carry his tools and safer working equipment.  He also wants to support his mother in all that he can.

loans.use: To buy basic tools for his work.

loans.name: Wurobarika Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Wurobarika vient de finir son premier avec kiva. Les remboursements ont été fait sans problème. Marie, responsable du groupe et les autres membres remercient kiva et tous les prêteurs. le prêt a été utile à Marie car, elle a pu acheter les légumes vendre et le bénéfice lui a permis de soutenir sa famille. Marie aimerait avoir un nouveau prêt pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de soigner ses enfants en cas de maladie, de les habiller et aussi de faire une épargne.
texts.en: The Wurobarika group just repaid its first loan with Kiva.  They had no problem at all with repayments.  The group's leader, Marie, as well as the other members of the group, are thankful to Kiva and all their lenders.  This first loan was useful to Marie as it allowed her to buy some vegetables and resell them.  With her profits she was able to support her family.  Marie would like to take a new loan in order to pursue her activity.  The profits she'll make from the resale of her produce will allow her to get treatment for her children if they become ill, to buy them clothes, and to save some money.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (zucchini, cucumber, tomatoes...) for resale.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Mana est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans. Mana vit avec ses deux enfants dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Mana vend des paniers pour ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Mana achète ses provisions une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers, Mana nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mana is a 49-year-old married woman.  She lives with her two children in the Adidogomé neighborhood.  She sells baskets to her customers who really appreciate her business.  Mana stocks up at the market once a month.  She is taking this loan to buy baskets and make a good profit margin, which will allow her to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 250 baskets.

loans.name: Wend-Pouiré Group

texts.fr: Korotimi, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. cette brave dame fait la restauration. Elle a besoin du prêt pour acheter du riz et des condiments pour préparer pour vendre. Korotimi et les autres membres du groupe sont des femmes dynamiques qui se battent au quotidien pour assurer l'avenir de leurs enfants. Ce groupe respecte ses engagements.Après ses ventes, Korotimi aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra d'aider son époux dans la gestion de leur famille et aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Korotimi is the representative of this group.  She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  This courageous woman is involved in the preparation of meals.  She is taking this loan to buy rice and condiments to cook dishes and resell them.  Korotini and the other members of the group are dynamic women who work very hard on a daily basis to provide a bright future for their children.  The group meets its commitments.  Thanks to the resale of her prepared dishes, Korotimi will make a profit which will allow her to help her husband manage the family's budget.  Her profits will also help her to continue her activity.

loans.use: to buy food products such as tomatoes, onions, peppers and rice to cook and sell dishes.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 22 años de edad y vive en compañía de su madre, quien es la personas que día a día le ha apoyado en sus estudios y en las actividades que emprende.
Obtuvo su titulo de secundaria como bachiller en Ciencias y letras, domina el idioma inglés, actualmente se encuentra cursando la carrera de licenciatura en finanzas logrando cursar el 50% de sus estudios, faltándole solamente 29 clases para lograr cumplir su meta universitaria, desea continuar preparándose de manera profesional para poder ser competitivo en el ambiente laboral y lograr mejores oportunidades.

Su principal motivación siempre ha sido su familia de la cual se siente muy orgulloso de formar parte.
Mediante su preparación personal y profesional, José Carlos desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país a través de su dedicación, entusiasmo a emprender, a crear nuevas alternativas para los jóvenes quienes considera que son un sector de la población que debe ser mas apoyado.

Considera que Honduras es un país completamente generoso, con un alto potencial para emprender y salir adelante y pretende ser un joven que luche por mejorar las condiciones de su pueblo. Espera vivir en un país lleno de paz, oportunidades y con iniciativas.
texts.en:
José Carlos is 22 years old. He lives with his mother who has been supporting him in terms of his studies and activities. 

He achieved his high school diploma in Arts and Science and is fluent in English. He is currently doing a degree in economics and has already completed 50% of his studies and only has 29 classes left to attend before finishing his degree. He wants to continue his studies to prepare himself professionally so as to be a more attractive candidate in the jobs market and so that he can obtain better jobs. 

His main motivation has always been his family of which he is proud to be a part of. 

Through personal and professional preparation, José Carlos wants to help his country develop by enthusiastically dedicating himself to creating new alternative opportunities for youngsters who he believes make up the sector of the population that should receive the most support.

He sees Honduras as a entirely generous country that has vast potential to progress. This young man intends to fight to improve the conditions that his people live in. In the future he hopes to live in a peaceful country with lots of opportunities.

loans.use: to finish his studies at university and receive his degree in economics.

loans.name: Los Solidarios Group

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Karelin continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como colonias y perfumes.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de elaboración de panes, salón de belleza, negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Karelin continues selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, etc.  She is grateful to lenders taking part in her dream through this loan and is committed to paying it back on time.  She still sells to friends, relatives and customers.  Karelin is a responsible, hard-working person who earns a living this way to support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise such as colognes and perfumes.

The other members have businesses such as baking bread, a beauty salon, jewelry sales, a grocery store and food sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as colognes and perfumes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Yuncaypata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

La socia Tisalia sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales como  chanchos, cuyes y pollos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de pollos y alimentos entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores.
Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” at Asociación Arariwa. They live in the Cusco district, Cusco province of Peru.

Tisalia continues to work in the business of raising animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this for years and does well thanks to how hard she works every day. She is a responsible and dedicated person. This business is how she gets ahead with her family.

Tisalia is requesting a loan to buy chickens, animal feed, and other things.

The remaining members work raising livestock, in agriculture, selling food, and raising small farm animals. They want to thank all of those who make part of this dream through this means, and promise to pay the installments according to plan.

The woman whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank. The member in the small picture asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because she had to work.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and sodas, and to make soft drinks to sell at home.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 y 3 años de edad, pero solo los dos mayores estudian, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Julián, se dedica a la producción y venta de maíz, además trabaja medio turno como empleado en una Alcaldía desde hace 5 años; su esposa le ayuda a preparar el grano de la cosecha para su venta.

Julián, necesita el préstamo para comprar ladrillo, cemento y hierro, para ampliar su casa, ya que el que tiene no le va alcanzar y no quiere dejar incompleto el trabajo.

Julián, sueña con tener una casa más grande, debido a que sus hijos van creciendo y la casa ya les queda pequeña, quiere darles lo mejor a sus hijos para que tengan un buen desarrollo.
texts.en:
Julian, 50, has a third grade education.  He and his partner have three children, ages 9, 6 and 3, but only the two older ones attend school.  His partner takes care of the household.

Julian produces and sells corn, and also works as an employee of the mayor's office where he has been for five years.  His wife helps with the grain at harvest time to prepare it for sale.

The loan Julian needs is to buy bricks, cement and iron to add onto his house.  He does not have enough supplies and wants to finish the job.

Julian's dream is to have a larger house since his children are growing and there is not enough space.  He wants to give his children the best he can for their proper development.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and iron to add on to his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and sheeting to build a corridor on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the corridor on her house.

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene  42 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, cinco mayores y dos de 16  y 8 años de edad, los dos menores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Nelly con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de  Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, el actualmente necesita para comprar fertilizantes que los cultivos necesitan y así obtener una mejor cosecha.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes, fertilizantes e insecticidas para los cultivos. Lleva 5 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños se darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Activas meets fortnightly in the 24 de Mayo canton, Manabí province. This canton is known for its beautiful forests, its biodiversity, and its kind and hardworking people, who work in agriculture and animal farming. This is where Nelly, 42, lives. She is married and has seven children. Five of them are adults. Two are 16 and 8 years old and go to high school and elementary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Nelly wanted to earn some money on her own and help her husband with the home expenses. She sells clothes and Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door when she is free, and at home, where her most loyal customers visit her. She sells on credit and collects the money weekly.

Nelly will give part of this loan to her husband, who grows vegetables and raises animals. He needs to buy fertilizers for his plantations, in order to have a better harvest.

Nelly will use this loan to buy clothes, creams and perfumes, and fertilizers and insecticides for the plantations. She has been a member of this communal bank for five years and she likes to be one because these loans help members to get ahead. Her dream is to be able to give her family all the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, creams and perfumes, and fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for the store in his house.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 56 años de edad, hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro  hijos 3 mayores y una de 17  años  de edad la cual está por ingresar en universidad y aun depende de ella, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa pero de forma independiente.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar y mucho mas después de la muerte de su esposo pues tiene que afrontar los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene un comedor el cual día a día  prepara deliciosos almuerzos y meriendas que son del agrado de sus distinguida clientela, ella varia el menú para que sus clientes siempre tengan variedad en sus platos y estén a gusto con lo que ella prepara, además que lo que ella prepara lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 4 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida y darle lo necesario a su hija. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan la fundación y las personas que hacen posible que ella reciba su crédito.  Sus sueños son que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Activas meets fortnightly in the 24 de Mayo canton, Manabí province. This canton is known for its beautiful forests, its biodiversity, and its kind and hardworking people, who work in agriculture and animal farming. This is where Rosa, 56, lives. Her life partner died some years ago and she became a widow. However, from this relationship she had three children; three of them are adults and one daughter is 17 and is about to start studying at the university. All of them still live with her, but only her 17-year-old daughter depends on her.

Rosa has had to work hard, especially after her husband died, because she has to cover the home expenses. She owns a restaurant, where she prepares delicious lunches and meals every day. Her distinguished customers like her food. She constantly changes her menu, so that they can have more alternatives and enjoy what she prepares. She loves to prepare food, and has been doing for four years, which has helped her to make a living and give her daughter everything she needs.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food. She has been a member of the communal bank since it started and she likes to be a member because of the help she receives from the foundation and the people that make it possible. Her dream is to see her daughter become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Deysi Maribel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas. 
En este lugar vive la señora Deysi, tiene  41 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 22, 19  y 10 años de edad, los dos menores  aun viven con ellos y la menor estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica al comercio.
Doña Deysi es una mujer muy buena y responsable que para ayudarle a su marido realiza los créditos, el tiene un deposito de madera y también taller de artesanía, él se va a los campos en un camión que alquila y compra una gran cantidad y variedad de madera la misma que le sirven para elaborar todo tipo de muebles y puertas que sus clientes le piden, el allí mismo también les vende a otros artesanos que necesitan madera para poder trabajar, les vende a buen precio y esto le deja muy buenos ingresos, lleva 6 años dedicado a eta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento de su familia
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar madera, pinturas y otros materiales que el utiliza. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.  Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Grupo de Credito Mujeres Activas" (Active Women's Credit Group) meets every fortnight in the canton "24 de Mayo" in the Manabí province. This province is known for its beautiful landscapes, woods, variety of fauna and its friendly and hardworking inhabitants working in agriculture and raising livestock.

In this canton lives Señora Deysi, 41. She is married and has three children who are 22, 19 and 10. The two youngest still live with their parents, and the youngest is studying in school. Deysi's husband is a businessman.

Doña Deysi is a very nice and responsible woman who is taking out this loan in order to help her husband. He has a wood store and an artesanal workshop. He goes into the countryside in a hired lorry to buy large quantities and varieties of wood which he uses to make all kinds of furniture and doors his customers order. He also sells wood to other artists who need wood to be able to work. He sells it at a good price and this brings him a very good income. He has been doing this for 6 years and has supported his family with it.

This loan will be used to buy wood, paints and other materials he uses. Deysi has been involved with the communal bank for 3 years and she likes the help it offers with the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints and other materials.

loans.name: Zulmira

texts.pt:
Senhora Zulmira tem 49 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais sustenta uma filha frequentando o ensino técnico profissional de contabilidade, é avicultora, vive em casa própria e sustenta 3 sobrinhos órfãos, e um neto.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, vacinas, vitaminas para a criação de frangos.
No futuro pretende construir aviários grandes visto que agora, trabalha com poucas quantidades de frangos devido ao espaço que é pequeno.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Mrs Zulmira is 49 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She supports one daughter who is going to college to study accountancy; she's a poultry farmer, lives in a house she owns and also supports 3 orphan nephews and a grandson.

This loan will be used to buy chicks, rations, vaccines, vitamins and breeding chickens.

In future she plans to build big aviaries seeing as at the moment she works with small numbers of chickens as she only has a small space.

Her biggest challenge is to pay off her loan on time in order to guarantee future loans.

loans.use: buy chicks, rations, vaccines, vitamins and breeding chickens.

loans.name: Jacinta Eva

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene  64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron  los cuatro que aun tiene son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es agricultor.
Doña Jacinta es una mujer que hace todo lo posible para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, tiene un corral en al cual cría chanchos y pollos, gracias a esto ella logra obtener sus ingresos que le sirven para salir adelante, parte del crédito es para que su marido lo utilice en los cultivos que ellos tienen en su finca, siembran maíz, maní y verduras y necesitan del crédito para los trabajos de limpieza y fertilización de los cultivos además de ciertos insecticidas para las plagas para obtener una muy buena producción. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento para los animales, fertilizantes e insecticidas para los cultivos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para ellos. Sus sueños son mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas" (Active Women's Credit Group) meets every fortnight in the canton "24 de Mayp" in the province of Manabí. This province is known for its beautiful landscapes, woods, variety of fauna and its friendly and hardworking inhabitants who work in agriculture or raising livestock.

In this canton lives Señora Jacinta, 64. She is married and had 6 children, but two have passed away. The four she still has are adults and independent. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Jacinta is a woman who does everything possible so that her family has everything they need to live. She works raising animals, and she has a corral where she raises pigs and chickens. Thanks to this she manages to earn an income which they use to get ahead. Part of the loan will be for her husband to use for the crops they have on their farm.
