They sow corn, peanuts and vegetables, and they need the loan for cleaning and fertilising the crops as well as for certain pesticides for infestations so that they will have a very good harvest.

This loan will also be used to buy feed for the animals, fertilisers and pesticides for the crops. Jacinta has been involved with the group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are really necessary for them. Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilisers and pesticides.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 25 years old, a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Joan has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Joan has been in this business for two years. In the future, Joan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 38 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Ritchel works very hard to provide for them.

Ritchel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ritchel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old and married with three children. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en:
Hennie is 48 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Hennie works very hard to provide for them.

Hennie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hennie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Hennie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! The above picture presents Doreen, a mother of two, who has been practicing agriculture for the last 20 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village.

She lives together with her two children in the Chuka area of Kenya, which is known for maize plantations for export. Doreen's primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling her harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. She also keeps a dairy cow.

Availability of labor is a major challenge for Doreen. Before joining Juhudi, Doreen could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Zawadi (present). Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva.

Doreen is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Doreen will purchase more effective modern tools that will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Doreen waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Luisa Maribel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Activas. 
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos, tres mayores y seis de 17, 15, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Luisa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante junto a su familia, ella en sociedad con familiares se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, maní y yuca,  ellos también compran yuca a otros agricultores de la zona y entregar a comerciantes que preparan deliciosas tortillas y que es la fuente de ingresos de esas familias, ellos compran a un precio razonable y entregan a otro precio con lo cual se ganan sus ingresos  con los cuales salen adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes y yuca para la venta. Lleva 9 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le  gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the district "24 de mayo" in the province of Manabí (which is known for its beautiful scenery, forests, and varied fauna, as well as kind, dedicated, hard-working agricultural people), there is a communal banking group called "Credit for Active Women" that meets every two weeks. 

Luisa lives in this place.  She is 41 years old and lives with her life partner, with whom she has 9 children.  Three of them are grown and the other six are ages 17, 15, 14, 12, and 10.  The two oldest study in school.  Her husband is a farmer.  

Luisa is a woman who likes to work in order to help her family get ahead.  She works with family members in agriculture.  They plant corn, peanuts and yucca.  They also buy yucca from other farmers in the area and sell it to business people who make delicious tortillas.  This is the source of family income.  They buy at a reasonable price and are able to resell in order to gain income to help themselves get ahead.

Luisa will use her loan to buy fertilizer and yucca for sale.  She has been with the communal banking group for 9 years and she likes the help she receives.  Her dream is to have a good harvest and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and yucca.

loans.name: Divas Group

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 9 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Mutualista’ un área central que agrupa a universidades, colegios, oficinas públicas, privadas, etc., de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Rita es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos marrones, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio ( la segunda de la izquierda, viste polera negra y pantalón amarillo). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, venta de teléfonos celulares, servicio de té, venta de vajillas y pintura automotriz, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de las marcas; cyzone, l’bel, esika  y otros, actividad que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta y también de forma ambulante a clientes continuos. Los productos con mayor demanda son; perfumes, cremas anti edad, lápiz labial,  aretes, mascara para pestañas, tratamientos faciales, etc. “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y cuidar a mi familia, cuento con un puesto de venta fijo donde expongo los productos, los aretes se venden solos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ella es conocida y por eso todos los clientes la conocen, la desventaja es el poco capital con el que cuenta para obtener nuevos productos. Su sueño es distribuir cosméticos a nivel nacional, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Rita solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en: Rita is a 30 year old woman. She is married and has 3 children, who are 2, 9 and 13 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics by catalog. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, constant, responsible and hardworking. She has her business in the area of "Mutualista", a central area that groups colleges, high schools, public and private offices, etc. It is a region of warm tropical weather with temperatures varying from 21-35 degrees Celsius. Rita is of dark skin, long brown hair that she wears tied, brown eyes and stocky. Her native language is Guarani that she speaks with her family; she speaks Spanish as general culture and for commerce. (On the picture, she is the second to the left, wearing a black t-shirt and yellow pants). She lives with her husband who works, and with her children: the 2 oldest go to school, the youngest one is not of school age yet. They live in a rented room, built in brick and cement, with corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity and sewerage. Her wishes to expand her business made her bring together a group of people with businesses such as: sale of chicken meat, sale of flowers, sale of cell phones, tea services, sale of dishes, and auto paint, in order to request a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling cosmetics from brand names such as; cyzone, l’bel, esika and others. She works from a set stand and also as a street vendor to regular customers. The products of greater demand are: perfumes, anti-age creams, lipstick, earrings, eyelash mascara, facial treatments, etc. "I started my business because I needed to work and take care of my family. I have a set sale stand where I exhibit my products. The earrings sell by themselves...". she comments. The advantage of her business is that she is well known, and because of this all her customers know her. The disadvantage is the little capital she has to get new products. Her dream is to distribute cosmetics at a national level. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of a stock of seasonal cosmetics at wholesale prices in order to satisfy the needs of her customers. This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has been working in this business. For these reasons Rita is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics at wholesale prices in order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and use the benefits to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale prices in order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and use the benefits to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Barbys Group

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos, y su negocio es la panadería tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, independiente, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por ser el eje de producción de la ciudad, donde microempresarios de áreas como; la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan manufactura foranea para que se comercialice en los principales mercados locales, es el barrio más poblado del lugar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.
Lidia es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo hasta los hombros, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie a la derecha, viste blusa rosada). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional , actividad que inició desde su casa, realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de cuñapes (bollos de harina de arroz con queso), Roscas de maíz, Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso) y Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y ensartado en un palito para luego cocinarse al horno) que llevan ingredientes fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la panadería. “tengo un pequeño horno que lo uso a diario, y hornea deliciosos panes y masitas…”comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la costumbre de la gente por las masas tradicionales y caseras, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de ingredientes, como; harina, queso, manteca, leche, etc. Su sueño es ahorrar para abrir una panadería grande y completa, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de harina e insumos necesarios para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por quintal y otros ingredientes por mayor para hornear variedades de panes tradicionales.
texts.en: Lidia is a 39 year old woman. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is a traditional bakery. She is a good, generous, independent, responsible and hardworking mother. She has her business in the area of ‘plan 3000’ which is characterized for being the production center of the city, where there are small business people in areas such as: sewing, design and handicrafts. They imitate foreign manufacture so that it is sold in the main local markets. It is the most populated neighborhood in the area. The weather here is warm and tropical, with temperatures varying during the day between 21-34 degrees Celsius. Lidia is of brown skin, long brown hair up to her shoulders, brown eyes, medium height, stocky. Her native language is Guarani which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and for the business. On the picture she is standing on the right side, wearing a pink blouse). She shares her life with her husband who works, and with her children who go to school. They live in their own house, built in brick and cement with corrugated iron roof, running water, electricity and sewerage. Her business is to bake traditional bread, an activity she started from her house with a minimal investment by selling cuñapes (buns made of rice flour with cheese), Corn "roscas" (doughnuts), Wheat Cakes (hard buns made of wheat flour), Rice "empanadas" (baked pastry with rice and cheese) and Zonzo (cassava puree mixed with cheese and put in a stick that later gets baked in the oven). All of these use easy ingredients that are found in the market. As soon as she recovered her capital, she invested it in the bakery. "I have a small oven that I use every day and that bakes delicious breads and buns...", she comments. The advantage of her business is the people's habit of eating traditional and homemade breads; the disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, lard, milk, etc. Her dream is to save money in order to open a big and complete bakery. She wants to buy flour and necessary inputs at wholesale prices for her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been working in this job. These are the reasons why Lidia is requesting a loan to buy flour in quintals and other ingredients at wholesale prices in order to bake a variety of traditional breads.

loans.use: to buy flour in quintals and other ingredients at wholesale prices to bake a variety of traditional breads.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is thankful that he was granted a 8,000 PHP loan that he used for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for new tires, maintenance,  and vehicle registration. His income from his transportation business will definitely cover his family's everyday needs and educational expenses of his  children. He  thanks God and you in advance for the finances that will be given him.

Ruel hopes to buy one more jeepney for his transport business. He dreams for his children to get a college education. He faithfully meets weekly with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and  draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Angelena

texts.en:
Angelena is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy  rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and frozen foods. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and increase her earnings. Her income from her store provides a stable source for her family's basic needs and children's education. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Angelena dreams of starting a general store in a commercial area. She aims to give her children the best education and a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 61-year-old married woman with five children; three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business for 10 years. Helen requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sea food to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Monita

texts.en:
Monita is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business for 3 years. 

She requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Monita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 57-year-old married  woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Aida has had a clothing retail business for 2 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy clothes to resell.

In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy  clothes.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a 46-year-old married woman with five children; three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercedes has had a nipa roofing business for 4 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her  business.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for nipa roofing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new collections for his clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his new electronic workshop.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35-year-old married man from the city of Deir el balah. He lives with his wife in a very simple house. Fadi works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income which barely covers all the family needs. 

Fadi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a solar system to heat water for his home. Fadi will be able to provide hot water for his family without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to heat water for his home.

loans.name: Ciguenas Group

texts.es:
Glenda es una mujer de 30 años, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por el origen de sus habitantes; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, que se ubicaron al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todo el país se adueñaron del lugar y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Glenda es de tez trigueña, cabello rojizo largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos electrodomésticos, como; cafeteras, planchas, hornillas, caldera eléctrica, licuadoras, tostadoras, y otros. Actividad que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta durante el día de martes a domingo, los lunes descansa y organiza su casa, su familia y su trabajo. “los electrodomésticos que vendo son básicos de cocina, su costo es accesible y mis clientes son continuos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los electrodomésticos son de precios módicos y fáciles de transportar, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para surtir su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda fija bajo techo de electrodomésticos, ella desea surtir su negocio con productos nuevos y de bajo costo. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Glenda solicita un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos de bajo costo para surtir su negocio y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Glenda is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her life partner and has a 3-year-old child. Her business is selling small home appliances. 

She is a good mother, generous, patient, dependable, responsible and very hard-working. She operates her business in the "Plan 3000" area, which is known for the origin of its inhabitants: Aymará, Quechua and Guaraní people who settled in the southern part of the city. Migrants from all over the country have made their homes in this area and developed an active center of commerce. The area has a warm tropical climate with daytime temperatures varying between 21 and 35 degrees Centigrade.

Glenda has olive skin, long red hair which she wears in a ponytail, and dark eyes. She is small in stature and has a slender build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in the broader culture and in her business. She shares her life with her partner, who is employed, and with her son, who is not yet of school age. They live in a room of their own built of brick and cement, with a metal roof. They have water, sewer and electricity connections. 

Her business is selling small home appliances such as coffee makers, irons, toaster ovens, electric kettles, blenders, toasters, and others. She works at a permanent sales stand during the day, from Tuesday through Sunday. On Mondays, she takes a day off and organizes her house, her family and her work. "The appliances I sell are basic ones for the kitchen, their price is affordable, and my customers are loyal," she comments. The advantage of her business is that small appliances are modest in price and easy to transport. The disadvantage is her lack of investment capital to stock her business. Her dream is to open an appliance store with its own building. She would like to stock her business with new, low-cost products. This is her seventh loan sequence with the institution during the six years she has dedicated to this business. 

For these reasons, Glenda is requesting a loan to buy low-cost small appliances to stock her business and to open a store.

loans.use: to buy low-cost small appliances to stock her business and to open a store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is thankful for the 15,000 PHP loan extended to her which she used to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her transportation business. She works hard to support her family's  everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney. It is important that her jeepney is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her income from her transportation business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She thankis God and you in advance for the financial help.

Marilou hopes to maintain and increase her transportation service. She aims to send her children to school until college. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 35-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lervin who is a driver/mechanic. She manages their household while operating a business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Marilyn owns a jeepney service. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity)  jeepney, which are the most common and cheapest form of public transportation. The jeepneys are packed with passengers. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. The Filipinos are creative and use it for transportation.   The seats are now two meters longer, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used to transport people, goods, and even sometimes small animals. 

Marilyn requests 10,000 PHP to repair and maintain her jeepney. It is very important that her unit be in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her husband drives and takes cared of the vehicle. She thanks God for the safe trips and the financial help.

Marilyn hopes that their transportation service will continue to be successful and buy another unit in the near future. She prays for good health and the safety of her husband and their passengers. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the registration and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Fatima Christine

texts.en:
Fatima Christine is a 31-year-old married woman with one child who attends school.

Fatima Christine works hard to provide for her family, has run a general store for 3 years, and requests 8,000 PHP NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fatima Christine has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWT. She earns an income selling frozen foods.

Fatima Christine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 22 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Daisy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Jyoti Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en:
Manju (standing at center in the picture) is 23 years old and the youngest member of her 5-member group. She is the group’s leader and runs her own vegetable selling business in the district of Jhabua, Madhya Pradesh, in central India. 

Manju and her husband  earn 9,500 INR each month which almost feeds and clothes their family of 6. She has two toddlers and plans to provide them with a good education and life. She did not attend school  but understands how missing out on education can limit one’s life choices. Intent on a better life for her children, she diligently saves 1,500 INR (50% of her monthly income) towards their future. The rest, she uses to keep her family financially fit.

Determined to improve her income and savings for her children, Manju plans to grow her micro-enterprise by purchasing potatoes, onions, carrots, cabbages, and garlic in bulk at better rates from the main market. These vegetables are  in high  demand, and expanding her stock can help her double her monthly income. 

She needs financial support to implement her plan, and reached out to Manju V, Anjali, Asha, and Devbala, who also sell vegetables in their neighborhoods and have similar goals. They formed a group to apply for a joint enterprise development loan. The group requests 58,000 INR to purchase  stock. 

They are grateful for this opportunity and support to improve their livelihoods and provide better lives for their children and families.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, cabbages, and garlic.

loans.name: Om Shanti Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Alkaben is a 31-year-old group leader (shown in the center).  These micro entrepreneurs are from rural Dahod in Gujarat, a state in western India. 

She supplements her husband's income by selling garments to local customers and contributes 3,000 INR to their monthly income of 8,000 INR. 

Despite the fact that 8,000 IINR is a meager amount to cover living expenses for her family of four, Alkaben diligently saves her entire income for her children's education. She is from a poor family and  attended school through class 4.  She wants a better life for her children. Motivated by this singular goal, Alkaben wants to take advantage of the favorable market conditions and expand her garment selling micro-enterprise. 

She will purchase a variety of dresses, legging, tops, and kurtis to attract more customers, negotiate better wholesale rates for stock purchase, and improve her income. She needs financial assistance and cannot afford to dip into her savings for her children or take a loan from local private moneylenders who charge exploitative interest rates. 

She formed this joint liability group with local vegetable sellers Klilaben, Kantabern, and Mathuriben, and Shantaben. All five  share similar financial backgrounds and ambitions to grow their businesses and provide for their families. They seek a microloan of  60,000 INR to invest in growing their micro-enterprises.  Mathuriben expects to add an extra 2,000 INR each month after investing her share of this loan in inventory. This will almost double her savings. 

She and her group are grateful for your timely support and financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy dresses, leggings, tops, and kurtis.

loans.name: Ambe Sibina

texts.en:
She is single with five children living in a two-room house in Bamenda North West Region – Cameroon. She hates thinking the time she dropped out from school because of inadequate finance and other  problems in life, like the shocking death of her mother and brother, coupled with the sickness that has disturbed her for two years.
With her new loan requested she will use it to buy yams, cocoa yams, Irish, cabbages, and Egusi and also pay house rent.
She fervently believes her business will succeed because she is full of experience in her business not withstanding her optimism about her  business coupled with the fact that she has been in the business for long and is also located in a strategic position.
This loan will actively help the community so as to reduce costs such as transport costs.
The profit realized from this project will be use to educate her children, cater for her family needs, expand her business, purchase a piece of land, and also provide for medication.
She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rate, the trainings they give before disbursement of loans,she also benefist from social networks that is ideas exchanged through their weekly and monthly meetings not leaving out the fact that they do follow ups for proper utilization.

loans.use: to buy yams, cocoa yams, Irish, cabbages and Eggusi.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline is known as a friendly and charismatic mum by her neighbours. She is happily married and, together with her husband, blessed with an adorable family. 

She is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kericho, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, tea, kale, tomatoes and also, she keeps dairy cows. Seline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. 

Seline mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. 

Seline is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan, Seline is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Seline feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Seline will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increased income level. 

Seline is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Seline will improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future and uninterrupted learning. Kindly consider lending to Seline.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Jay Ambey Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Kampaben is a 37-year-old group leader (shown in the center) from Dahod, in rural Gujarat, which is in western India. 

She earns 3,000 INR each month selling vegetables.  This contributes 30% to her family's income of 9,000 INRS. This income covers the living costs for her family of six, which includes her four children: a toddler, two primary-school-aged children, and a teenager. 

Kampaben diligently saves 1,500 INR  each month for her children's education fund but  she knows she must save more. 

Her other group members (Kantaben, Jenaben, Shantaben, and Malkiben) have similar financial situations. All of their micro-enterprises have potential for growth that could almost double their incomes. They are unwilling to borrow from a local moneylender and get exploited by high interest rates.  Kampaben convinced her group members to form a joint liability group and apply for a microloan of 75,000 INR. 

Kampaben will buy bulk quantities of potatoes and cabbages, the preferred vegetables in her impoverished neighborhood for their low cost and longer shelf life. She will also stock up on tomatoes and chilies, which are frequently bought by her customers to make the fresh, nourishing curries that are an integral part of their meals. 

This investment will increase Kampaben's income up to 5000 INR a month and double her monthly savings for her children's future.  Kampaben and her group are grateful for your timely support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, and chilies.

loans.name: Shingal Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Mangiben (at center) is the owner of a small  shop in the rural Dahod district of Gujarat, and is the leader of this group of rural women entrepreneurs. She sells tea, oil, sugar, and snacks to people in the neighborhood. Tea and sugar have a longer shelf life and a fair demand, and snacks are the most frequently sold products, which leaves Mangiben with a fair scope to expand her business. 

However, she earns 2,500 INR a month, most of which she saves towards the education of her two teen-aged children. Her husband's income of 6,500 INR is used to cover living costs for their family of seven. This does not leave Mangiben with spare funds to increase her inventory. At the same time, she certainly needs to grow her business and income in order to ensure that her children continue their education and attend public college. She did not attend school  and wants her children to have the opportunities that a good education brings. 

Mangiben recruited similar-minded local small business owners and formed a joint liability group. They seek a microloan of 75,000 INR to fund the growth of their small rural businesses. Ggroup members Rasilaben and Lataben will expand their vegetable businesses, Kaliben will boost her accessories and costume jewelry business, and Anitaben will purchase inventory. 

Mangiben will purchase tea, sugar, and snacks. She stands to double her monthly earnings and children's education fund. Mangiben and her group are immensely grateful for your timely support and this chance to boost their livelihoods, which will provide a better future for their children.

loans.use: to buy tea, sugar, and  snacks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has six children and they live in a four-room house in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
She faced some problems in life and so this has hindered her a lot. These range from the deaths of her parents and ill health to the taste of poverty and poor sales.
                  
The new loan she has gone in for is to be used for the restaurant business to buy raw food items like rice, beans, corn, coco yams, cassava, vegetables such as tomatoes, okoro,onions, and Maggi, salt, bananas, spices, palm oil, groundnut oil, eggusi, njangsa, spaghetti, eggs, fresh fish, fresh meat and drinks like beer and beverages.

She is so optimistic that she will succeed because she has run the business for quite some time. She believes she cooks good food and that only God can make her succeed.
 
The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have delicious food at cheaper prices. She also trained a neighbor to offer a restaurant business.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the standards of family well being, provide for the children's school fees and medication, and pay for her rent.

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates. They also teach how to manage your capital in business for success. Borrowers also benefit from the ideas exchanged through their bimonthly and monthly meetings, coupled with social networking like sharing of great and sorrowful moments during the meetings.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, corn, coco yams, cassava, vegetables, tomatoes, palm oil, groundnut oil, eggusi, njangsa, spaghetti, eggs, meat and fresh fish, and drinks.

loans.name: Shanti Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en:
Kalpana (shown in the center) is the 31-year-old leader of this group of five vegetable vendors from rural Jhabua, in Madhya Pradesh, India. 

The income from her vegetable selling micro-enterprise contributes 20% of her family's monthly household income of 9,000 INR which is just enough for a family of six,  to meet living expenses. 

Diligent with her finances, Kalpana somehow saves1,000 INR  each month. Her parents had been unable to send her to school, and she does not want the same fate for her children. They will soon reach the age to enroll in kindergarten, and Kalpana knows she must earn and save  in order to ensure that her children go to school. 

Motivated by this singular goal, she rallied her friends, Ganga, Usha, Tarej, and Khusum, who also support their children and families by selling vegetables in their respective localities. They have jointly applied for an enterprise microloan of 50,000 INR to grow their small businesses. Kalpana will invest her share of the loan to buy potatoes, onions, garlic, carrots, and cabbage. These vegetables have a longer shelf life in comparison to greens or softer vegetables. Selling to more customers and negotiating better rates on bulk purchases will help Kalpana earn an extra 2,500 INR each month, a boost that will more than double her current meager income, and more than triple her monthly savings. 

The other group members stand to achieve similar significant boosts in business. Kalpana and her group are thankful for you timely loan, which will be an important source of support and a chance to better provide for their children's futures.

loans.use: to buy  potatoes, onions, garlic, carrots, and cabbage.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old married woman with four children.  Her husband is a farmer who plants bananas and potatoes as their primary source of income.  Erlinda become a member in Paglaum last 2010 and requests a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and compost.  

She hopes that this will increase their income so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru:
Ойгул серьезная и умная женщина. Она в районе занимается животноводством. Ойгул сейчас продвигает деятельность деда уже более 3 лет. Она выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Ойгул хорошо ухаживает о животных. Ойгул любит домашних животных. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этой деятельности обеспечивает ее семью. 
    Ойгул развелась с  мужем, и дочерей вырастила одна. Ей 56 лет. Она вместе дочери живет в районе Н. Хусрав. У нее две дочери, и им 16 и 28 лет. Они занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Ойгул хорошо воспитывает своих дочерей. Они тоже как Ойгул серьезные, умные и трудолюбивые. 
    Ойгул покупает скота и откармливает их 30-40 дней, и перепродает  на скотном рынке. Она хочет расширить животноводство. Ойгул с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Ваш кредит поможет ей достичь своих целей. В будущем она хочет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Oygul is a serious and intelligent woman of 56. She is divorced from her husband and raising her two daughters on her own. They live together in the N. Khusrav region. Her daughters are 16 and 28 and they work in agriculture. Oygul has raised them well and like her, they are serious, intelligent and hardworking.

Oygul works in animal husbandry, and for three years now has been continuing her grandfather's business. She raises livestock in her yard at home. She loves domestic animals and takes very good care of them. Her animal husbandry business has become her primary occupation, since revenue from it takes care of her family.

Oygul buys livestock and fattens them for 30 to 40 days before reselling them at the livestock market. She wants to expand her business and with great hope has turned to you for a loan. Your loan will help her achieve her goals. In the future she wants to increase her head count of livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock to expand her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has five children. She is from Sindangan and separated. Gemma is a diligent and determined mother when it comes to the welfare of her children.  

For a living, Gemma earns by making snacks that she sells herself and also on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. 

Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area. With the help and support of her children, Gemma smiles at the thought of completing her house and living a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production and be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 32 years old and lives in Masubong, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Myrna has been engaged in cosmetics and the RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business for three years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from doing this type of work; this amount is so helpful to meet her family needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional hollow blocks for the finishing of her ongoing house construction. Myrna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her cosmetics and RTW business and to have her own family.

loans.use: to buy additional hollow blocks for ongoing house construction

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en:
Jenette, 38, is married with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for nine years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already used loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 32 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children who are now at their school age. 

Johna has been engaged in managing a car radiator repair and welding shop together with her husband as the repairman and welder for five years already, and she earns good income each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional bronze rods, flux, copper, welding rods and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair and welding shop business. 

Johna has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Johna hopes to expand their business and improve the services as well to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper, welding rods and other accessories and materials for the radiator repair and welding shop business

loans.name: Jevie

texts.en:
Jevie is engaged in running a merchandise store. He has been operating his business for seven years and earns a monthly net income of 4,000 PHP. Jevie is 31 years old, married and is from the village of Disud, Sindanagan. Jevie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and develop his skill in business engagements. 

Jevie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes. Now, Jevie is requesting another loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of his existing business. He wants to buy more inventory for his store to sell.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lilianita

texts.en: Lilianita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Lilianita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to renovate and expand her house for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. Recently, Loida requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion. Someday Loida hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Engled

texts.en:
Engled is a very happy, smiling woman. She is blessed with one lovely child. She is known for her good availability and friendliness to her neighbours. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Nyamira, in Nyanza region of Kenya. 

Engled passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past seven years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family.

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. The main challenge that Engled faces is that her cows stray to her neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to her, because she has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. 

She is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire and also increase her breeds of poultry from the five she currently has. Through the loan, she will be able to control her animals, and this will help her a great deal. She will save more money. This loan will also help her sell eggs to her neighbours and to the local market. 

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going child. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a barbed wire and more poultry birds

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Emmy, a farmer from Kuserwo, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. She defies the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is only for the older generation. Emmy is happily married, and, together with her husband, has been blessed with a lovely family. Her primary source of income is milk, but she also cultivates maize on her farm. Emmy also engages in other personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit. She practices agriculture with a difference – employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge from the agricultural trainings that she has attended. Emmy sells vegetables, eggs, and milk in the nearby market. She finds that milking and feeding her own cow are the most enjoyable parts about farming. Emmy is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family. Emmy has always yearned to have more dairy cows. 

Emmy is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk per day that is known as “the ideal drinking milk” because it has all the required quantities of fat and protein. Emmy’s cow will certainly boost milk production on her farm which will translate into more sales and better income for her family. Because of the potential for high milk production, Emmy will be able to save money to fully repay her loan. She also believes that, through the careful selection and application of strict standards of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a perceptive woman. She takes advantage of and develops the opportunities that arise. She has always stood out for being an independent person. Emily is happily married and, together with her husband, blessed with a lovely family. 

Emily Is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes and also, she keeps dairy cows. Emily has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family," she said. Emily mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. 

Emily is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan, Emily is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Emily feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Emily will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and hence increase her income level. 

Emily is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Emily will improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

Lenders kindly lend to this hardworking woman who hopes to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 29 years old and has a mixed farm in Kipsaiya, Kapsowar, Kenya, where she lives with her family. On the farm, she grows various crops and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. For the last six years, Sarah has made money selling her farm's produce and engaging in other side businesses. She feels passionate about farming but her business is facing challenges such as the high cost of inputs and occasional drought. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase poultry. The upside, to her, of focusing on her poultry business, is that it is not very much affected by her major business challenges. Poultry feed is readily available and hens lay eggs regardless of the season of the year. Her loan investment will provide a certain source of year-round income. The money Sarah will make with her loan will provide for family expenses such as food and school fees. Sarah wants her family to enjoy a balanced diet so they will grow strong and healthy to be more productive with generating income for the family.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is a widow who runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income to adequately support her family. Martina has expertise in selling and is a full-fledged member of PMPC. She has borrowed several previous loans and her membership is in good standing without record of default. 

Martina is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities which is proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities and consumable items

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 65 years old and lives in East Poblacion, Rizal, ZDN, Philippines. She is married with two children. For the past five years, Nellie has run a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Nellie is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her flower garden so that it can become another source of income. She will also buy materials to make a fence for her flower garden. In the future, Nellie hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and build a fence for her flower garden

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is hardworking mother of two school-aged children. Her congenital disability is not a hindrance supporting her family. Vergie manages a small parcel of agricultural land where she plants a variety of root crops.  

Vergie is requesting a loan to pay labor costs to plow and plant potatoes and peanuts. She is very thankful because she has a supportive and loving husband. Vergie hopes to apply for other loans through Paglaum to improve the future of her children.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to plow and plant potatoes and peanuts

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma earns a living through agriculture. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she has been able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she has applied for a loan to pay for labor, fertilizer and seedlings. She wants to make use of a small parcel of land for her agricultural activities. Gemma hopes to live comfortably with her children while they finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for labor, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby, 30 years old, is married and a resident of Sindangan, in the Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, Ruby has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. Last February of 2014, both Ruby and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to apply for a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. Ruby has now applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she will be a successful vendor some day and own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a good income. Lourdes is 54 years old, married and has three children. She is from Sindanagn, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines, Lourdes joined Kiva's partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), to gain access to business capital. Lourdes has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Recently, she requested a loan that will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila has a coconut farm in El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines that is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to grow root crops. Mila makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing her land and planting seedlings. She borrowed from Kiva's partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Mila wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to buy labor for her farm

loans.name: Analene

texts.en:
Analene, 35 years old, is single. She lives with her parents in Mandih, Sindangan, in the Philippines. In order to earn and survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying a few inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo and soap. 

Analene joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store, in January of 2014. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for additional merchandise for her store in order to draw more customers to her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 47 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables as their primary source of income. In need of additional working capital, Merly joined Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to buy cacao seedlings to maximize the space of her land. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cacao seedlings

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en: Casiana is managing her food vending business in Sindangan, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Casiana has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business in order to cook more dishes for her customers and be able to earn more income. This will help her in sustaining the needs of the family and help support her grandchildren's education. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small eatery at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a smiling, happy, hardworking, and honest mother. Although she never advanced her education, she is an accomplished farmer who has experience in farming. She is happily married, and together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with three children. 

For the past 18 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Flora also does a "side hustle" motorbike business. 

Flora has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully use this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up. Flora, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Flora said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Flora hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. 

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. Lenders, Kindly help this woman who works tirelessly to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very charismatic, cheerful person from the Nyamira area of Kenya. Elizabeth has a husband, and at home they have six children. 

For the last 25 years, Elizabeth has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and crops. 

Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Elizabeth to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. 

Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus increase sales volume. Elizabeth needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She knocked on many doors looking for a job, just to hear “no.” She is a strong woman and confident in her decisions. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu in the central region of Kenya. She has been doing this for 16 years. 

Her primary source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes and raising poultry. Cicilia has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. Cicilia mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy another motorbike. 

Cicilia is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge resulting in many losses. Perishable products such as vegetables require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Cicilia feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo that help women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. 

The benefits of this loan are enormous because Cicilia will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and earn an increased income. With this loan, Cicilia will improve her living conditions and assure her children a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, a 56-year-old farmer from Chebiemit, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, keeping sheep and  dairy cows. Christina has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Christina is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Christina is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family a secure future. 

By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Christina believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of people living in poverty would be reduced.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma operates a motorbike transportation business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. In order to continue her business, she has applied for a loan to pay for motorbike spare parts and repair. She dreams of owning motorbikes and of being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorbike spare parts and repair

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie, after learning about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and hearing about all the benefits and financial services, never hesitated to become a member. She has tried her luck by operating a business focused on her farming activities. Elvie feels that she owes her luck to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She is now requesting another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Elvie is seeking better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María tiene 1 hijo, es soltera, vive en casa familiar en el sector de San Antonio que pertenece a la ciudad de Ibarra, la ciudad donde vive es conocido como la ciudad azul y también por el sector ellos viven realizan artesanías hechas a manos en madera es un lugar de arte y cultura hay muchas personas vienen a visitar el sector de San Antonio.
María se dedica al a brindar servicio de maquilado de prendas de vestir desde hace años atrás ella trabajaba en un taller de confecciones de donde aprendió la experiencia que hoy en día viene manejando, María es una persona trabajadora, luchadora  a pesar de ser madre soltera ha seguido luchando para brindar todo lo bueno para su hijo que está empezando a estudiar y quiere seguir ofreciendo más bienestar y seguridad en el hogar que ella vive. Los padres le están apoyando en todo lo que ella necesita  ha tenido momentos malos en su vida pero ella ha demostrado ser una persona capaz de sobresalir de todo los problemas que ella tiene y es por eso que la familia la estima bastante y quieren que siga adelante en todo los proyectos que ella tiene en su hogar y en la familia.
El crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de una máquina de coser e incrementar más servicio a más clientes del sector.
texts.en:
María is single and has one child. She lives in the family house in the San Antonio area which belongs to the city of Ibarra. This city she lives in is known as the Blue City (Ciudad Azul) and the area she lives in is known for the hand-crafted articles of wood. It is a place of art and culture. Many people come to visit the San Antonio area.

María works offer her services sewing clothing. Many years ago she worked in a clothing workshop where she gained the experience that she uses today. María is a hard-working person, struggling in spite of being a single mother and she has struggled to provide everything good for her child who is starting to study. She wants to continue to offer more well-being and security in the house where she lives. Her parents support her in all that she needs.

She has had bad times in her life but she has demonstrated herself to be a person capable of getting past any problem that she has. So her family holds her in esteem and hope that she continues ahead with all the projects she has for the household and her family. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy a sewing machine to increase the services she offers to her clients of the area.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and increase her service to her clients.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is a smiling, extroverted, happy, responsible, and energetic woman. She is a mother with a deep passion for dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 20 years. 

She owns a small farm in Kuserwo village, which is situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her large family. As a result, Albina has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her handsome husband, Albina also rears sheep and grows maize, amongst other crops. 

Albina is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favorable environment for the cows. 

With your loan, Albina has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labor in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. 

The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agribusiness. Support this hardworking woman who wants to always put smiles on her family’s faces.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit (cowshed).

loans.name: 031704010001.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 29 years old, married, and has one child. Liên is the group leader of the 031704010001.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for two years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Mushamukadzi Group

texts.en:
Tabeth is a strong member of the Mushamukadzi group. She is a married woman, aged 36, and has three children in school. She survives by selling windscreens at a local complex well known as a good market for motorcycle spare parts. Her major objective in life is to attain financial security. At the age of 20, she established her own business with a very small amount of capital. Gradually, over the years, she has built her business up from her savings and financial discipline. She reckons that she earns more than $700 profit per month from the shop.

Her husband actually struggled in the past when he was just a self-employed mechanic repairing motorcycles and vehicles and could not earn enough. Now he is working with Tabeth as a windscreen fitter, and this is attracting more customers due to their supply and repair service, not offered by many in the industry. Tabeth wants to contribute income to sustain the daily needs of her family. 

She has received a loan worth $1200 that will be used to acquire large quantities of windscreens to benefit from economies of scale. She plans to hire a regular staff member that she can train as a salesperson, who will be able to assist her with everyday activities. She is hoping to save enough funds to open a shop in the central business district as well as to support the educational needs of her children. The Mushamukadzi group intends to repay the loan over a period of six months and hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy windscreens in bulk for her motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp.
