Dung is 24 years old, married, and has two children. She supports two dependents with her business. Her business is located in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for four years.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main harship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: 030913090003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shrimp to resell.

Tâm is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 030913090003.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more shrimp to resell

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera tiene 22 años, no tiene hijos, vive en casa familiar, vive en natabuela  que pertenece a la ciudad de Atuntaqui, sector que hay muchas fábricas de producción de prendas de vestir  personas que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio por la zona, son personas amables, respetuosas que brindan solidaridad en el sector.
Rosa ha venido desde los 18 años manejando su local de comida rápida en el sector de Atuntaqui el aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia con la ayuda de los familiares el negocio que maneja ha tenido sus bajas que cuando cumplió el año de funcionamiento cerraron por 15 días por no tener clientes a pesar de eso abrieron otra vez el negocio y volvieron a incrementar más clientes y desde esa temporada hasta el día de hoy sigue con su actividad.
Con el crédito que solicita va incrementar más sillas, mesas y también va comprar pintura para remodelar el local donde está el negocio y así brindar una buena imagen y seguir atrayendo más clientes, ella es una persona optimista quiere incrementar el negocio tener una sucursal después de un tiempo y brindar trabajo a los demás eso piensa ella en el futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old, is single and has no children, and lives with her family.  She lives in Natabuela belonging to the city of Atuntaqui.  In this sector there are many factories producing garments and people engaged in agriculture and trade.  They are friendly, respectful people providing solidarity in the sector.

Rosa has been managing her fast food stall in the Atuntaqui sector since she was 18 years old.  She learned this activity from her own initiative with the help of family.  The business that she handles has had its lows.  After operating for one year it had to close for 15 days because there were no customers.  Nevertheless, they opened again and were able to increase business and more customers, and from that season on until today it is very active.

With the loan that she is requesting she will have more chairs, tables and will also buy paint to remodel the premises where the business is and thus provide a good image and continue to attract more customers.  She is a very optimistic person who wants to increase business and have a branch after sometime, thus providing work for others.  That is what she sees in her future.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and paint to remodel the premises

loans.name: Jeanielou

texts.en:
Jeanielou is 33 years old; she and her husband have not yet been blessed with a child. She supports her parents, who live with them. She and her husband are the ones operating their general merchandise business. Her business started when her husband, who used to work as cell phone repairman, decided to accept repair work in their house to increase their income and help in their daily expenses. Over time, with more customers coming to him for repairs, he decided to quit his job, do his business full-time, and build a stall in front of their house. The business earns him a net of PHP 300–500 daily. With a good head for business, Jeanielou helps her husband by selling prepaid cell-phone credits at their stall, and they earn a net of PHP 1,000–2,000 daily. She also put some personal accessories, groceries and school supplies in the store, and so it has become a small general store.

Jeanielou saves most of their income. She wants to expand their business and rent a place in the market, where they will have a greater chance of gaining more customers.

Jeanielou is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy cell phone accessories, toys, and personal accessories (ponytail holders, headbands, bracelets and other accessories) to further increase her income with new items she will add to her store. 

Jeanielou wants to expand her store into a wholesale general merchandise store in the future and add employees to help them in their expenses and savings for their future family.

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories, toys, and personal accessories to further increase her income with new items she will add to her store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt: O Senhor Carlos vive numa casa propria com a esposa e três filhos.  É militar, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir materiais de contrução tais como chapas de zinco, cimento e jogo sanitário para concluir a sua obra na casa onde reside. Tem sonho de ser cientista, investigar o que se passa para além do planeta terra. Tem como maior desafio formar se cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He works in the military and with this loan he would like to buy construction materials like zinc plates, cement and a toilet in order to finish his home construction project.

Carlos' dream is to become a scientist and have the chance to investigate things that happen outside planet earth. His biggest challenge is to continue with his education.

loans.use: acquire construction materials like zinc plates, cement, and a toilet.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Nhung is 36 years old and is married with two children.
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhung first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nhung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine .She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her family, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

texts.en:
Nhân operates a food stall selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Nhân is 32 years old, and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06- Thôn Đông-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main harship that Nhân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhân hopes that her business will do well and that she will make enough money to provide for her kids and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

texts.en:
Thanh has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

Thanh is the group leader of the 030918170002.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make wood furniture to sell.

Nhi works in agriculture growning vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

Nhi is the group leader of the 030703130001.Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nhi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nhi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nhi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhi hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her family.

texts.en:
Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Dung is 32 years old and is married with two children.
Dung lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Dung has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

Hiền is 33 years old and is married with three children.
Hiền lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having money to build a latrine .She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes to maintain a successful business and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

Khoảng is 52 years old and married with two children.
Khoảng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Khoảng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khoảng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Khoảng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Khoảng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet..

Huyền works in agriculture raising livestock. He is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Huyền is 45 years old and married with three children.
Huyền is the group leader of the Nhóm 3 thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2014, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Huyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Huyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Huyền faces in his business is the lack of capital.

With his business profit, Huyền hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to travel on vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Tùng works in agriculture farming food.

Tùng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tùng's first loan withThanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tùng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 
The main hardship that Tùng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Tùng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his family, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 19 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture raising cattle and other livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Minh is 32 years old and married with three children..
Minh is the group leader of the Nhóm 19 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2014, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Minh Nguyễn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel on vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sylvain Daniel

texts.fr:
Sylvain est un homme de 52 ans qui vit avec sa sœur dans la commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe. Cela fait 17 ans qu’il est loueur de pousse-pousse. Depuis le démarrage de sn activité, il a fabriqué lui-même 16 poussepousses qui circulent aujourd’hui en ville.

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis un an. Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter du matériel (pneu, roulement, pièces mécaniques diverses…) nécessaire à la fabrication de 2 nouveaux poussepousses.

Son objectif est de continuer à développer son activité et de monter un grand garage de pousse-pousses. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il a déjà réussi à acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
Sylvain is a 52-year-old man who lives with his sister in Commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe. For seventeen years, he has been leasing pousse-pousse [rickshaws]. Since he started in this business, he has himself made sixteen pousse-pousses, which operate today in traffic in town. 

He has been a partner of Vahatra for a years. With this new loan, he intends to purchase some supplies and equipment (inner tubes, ball bearings, various mechanical parts…) necessary to make two new pousse-pousses.

His goal is to continue developing his business and to rig up a pousse-pousse garage. With the profits from his business, he has already succeeded in buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintaining his rickshaws

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro was able to acquire a 30,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan from Kiva. With the loan, Floro was able to buy bulk pork, spices and other ingredients needed to cook various food items for his catering business. His business is doing well, and with his income he has been able to pay for the continuing education of his child, support their daily expenses, and start to repair his house to set up rooms to rent. 

Floro is requesting his sixth loan, for 30,000 PHP. This time he wants to buy tables, chairs, plates and utensils to accommodate customers who want to eat in. His eatery is continuously operating and now has regular customers. 

Floro hopes to maintain his growing business (store and eatery), finish his rooms for renting to help him in his expenses, continue the education of his child, and save up for his old age.

loans.use: To  buy tables, chairs, plates and utensils to accommodate customers who want to eat in.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang works in agriculture farming food.

Giang is 28 years old and married with three children.
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Giang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Giang has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Giang has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Giang faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Giang hopes to maintain  a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thêu

texts.en:
Thêu works in agriculture farming food.

Thêu is 33 years old and married with two children.
Thêu lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Thêu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thêu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thêu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thêu faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Thêu hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Harvest Group

texts.en:
Women are ambitious, hard working, and skilled in many trades, among other attributes that are often overlooked. In the ancient world, men moved from one country to another looking for employment. In modern days, women are moving into different neighboring countries for the sole purpose of buying and selling.
 
Shushai a member of the Harvest group consisting of three women. Shushai restocks her business from Mozambique, selling shoes, clothes, and socks among other things. She reports good profits in her hometown of Dzivaresekwa Extension. 

Shushai experiences challenges from people who take her goods on credit and fail to repay, resulting in bad debts. She also points to the local tax authorities who sometimes take some of her stock for lacking proper papers, which do not always apply in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale.

loans.name: Hope Of Life Group

texts.en:
Alice is a member of Hope of Life group based in Budiriro 1. Alice has a flea market business at nearby shops, selling blankets and clothing which she acquired from her town and South Africa. Alice and her group members joined Thrive microfinance in February 2015 and benefited a lot from the training they received. Group members wish to continue getting help from Thrive. 

Alice and her friends have applied for a combined loan amounting to (USD) $1,240 to boost their businesses. Alice wants to use her portion of the loan to restock with more blankets since she is facing an increase in demand during the approaching winter season. 
Asked about her future plans, Alice said she has a good savings plan which will enable her to open a large clothing shop in the Harare Central Business District.

loans.use: To increase her stock of blankets to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her grocery business.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijoa de 17, 14, 9 y 6 años y un bebé de 1 mes, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por el gran crecimiento del comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas y por los orígenes de su población proveniente de tribus ‘Ayoreas’ nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país, de clima tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Beatriz es de piel morena, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es a la moda, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste pantalón beige y chompa lila). Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos; los 4 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor de todos aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con energía eléctrica, recibe agua de un estanque cercano y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de carteras, librería, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de chuño, servicio de limpieza y jardinería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, sardinas, mantequilla, detergente y otros, sus hijos le ayudan con la atención de la tienda porque conocen los precios y saben reconocer el dinero. “inicie mi negocio por la necesidad que existía en el barrio, mis hijos me colaboran con la atención y proveo casi a todo el barrio de alimentos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar, la desventaja son los largos viajes que debe realizar para abastecer su tienda. Su sueño es tener un almacén grande y surtido, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad por mayor para bastecer su negocio y pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad por mayor para bastecer su negocio y pagar los gastos de sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 32 years old and lives with her spouse. She has 5 children aged 17, 14, 9 and 6 years old and a 1 month old baby. Her business is selling basic need foods in her neighborhood store. She is a good mother, enterprising, friendly, generous comprehensive, responsible and hard-working.

Her business takes place in the Plan 3000 neighborhood which is known for it's great growth in commerce and manufacturing of all kinds. It's inhabitants came from the Ayoreas indigenous people of the area and miners relocated from the west of the country. The climate is tropical with a daily temperature that varies between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Beatriz is dark-skinned, dark-eyed, low in stature, long black hair that she wears tied back and medium in build. She dresses fashionably. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (She is seated in the center of the photo wearing beige pants and a lily colored sweater).

She lives her life with her partner who works in transportation and with her children. The oldest 4 study at school and the youngest is not yet school age. They live in a rented brick and cement house that has electricity, receives water from a near-by tank but has no sewage. The desire to improve her quality of living led her to form a group of people with businesses like: making wallets, a bookstore, selling vegetables, selling food, selling dried potatoes a cleaning and gardening service in order to improve their businesses.

Her business is selling food and basic use items like bread, rice, sugar, sweets, drinks, soft drinks, sardines, margarine, detergent and others. Her children help her taking care of the store as they know the prices and can handle money. “I started my business out of the need that existed in the neighborhood. My children work with me looking after the customers and I provide pretty much the whole neighborhood with food” she commented. Her advantage is the lack of competition in the area, her disadvantage is the long trips she takes to stock her store.

Her dream is to have a large and well-stocked store. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of food and basic use items wholesale to stock her store and pay for the expenses of her children. This is her 2nd loan with the institution in the 2 years she has had her business. For these reasons Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy food and basic use items to stock her store and pay for the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy food and basic need items to stock her business and pay the expenses of her 5 children.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Thảo is 41 years old and married with three children.
Thảo lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thảo first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thức

texts.en:
Thức works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture.

Thức is 58 years old and married with eight children.
Thức lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thức first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thức has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thức faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thức hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Lolita is a farmer who raises vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and and materials for pig pens. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lolita hopes to harvest more vegetable crops and supply her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials for pig pens

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, comparte su vida con su esposa y dos hijos, todos viven juntos, para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar José se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres y como fuente de ingresos lo hace desde hace 15 años, tiene un horario de trabajo de seis de la mañana una de la tarde, hasta la fecha no tiene dificultades para trabajar.
Comprará semilla, insecticidas, herbicidas y abono así tendrá todo listo para la siembra de la próxima temporada, pretende mejorar la productividad de su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la vivienda y ahorrar para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar y convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
José shares his life with his wife and two sons. They all live together. To support his household José grows staple grains, a trade that he learned from his parents. He has been earning his income this way for 15 years. His work schedule is from six in the morning until one in the afternoon. To date he has no difficulties working.

He will buy seed, insecticide, herbicide and fertilizer so that everything will be ready for planting the next season. He intends to improve productivity in his business in order to cover his family’s needs.

His hopes are to better his home and save money in order to provide his sons with the opportunity to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, herbicide and fertilizer so that everything will be ready for planting the next season.

loans.name: Unstoppable Group

texts.en:
"To move mountains, first move little stones." This has been the motivating statement for Edina to step forward in her business. She started her flea market business with (USD) $50 capital, selling second-hand clothes at rural areas near Harare. Within a period of six months, she was able to restock new clothes from neighboring South Africa. Her business is her main source of income for her family. She has also managed to build a house in Glen Norah, a suburb of Harare. Edina is a mother of four girls and three boys and happily married to her husband. 
As a group of women from the same neighborhood, they all share the same objective of growing their businesses. Therefore, they combined their efforts, managed to save money and got support from Thrive Microfinance in the form of training. To date, they have managed to complete training, managed their savings and agreed on their individual obligations to the group.
Edina is therefore looking for a financial support of (USD) $400 to expand her business with a continuous variety of clothing, mostly targeting the winter season.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vakundi Group

texts.en:
Because they are living below the poverty line and their small businesses require financing, these women formed a group called Vakundi. The group name is derived from a Shona word meaning, “We are victors.” They attended a four-week training course at Thrive Microfinance and learned about keeping business records, managing group dynamics and the importance of savings. The group is made up of four women, three tailors and a tuck shop owner.
Judith is the group treasurer, a fashion designer by profession trained at a reputable tertiary institution called Christian College. After completing her course, she worked at Edgars, a giant in the clothing industry, as a fashion designer. In 2012, she decided to start her own business designing and sewing African attire. She bought a heavy-duty sewing machine to increase her operations. Over those years, demand for her clothes has been increasing. Her major challenge was lack of funding to meet the demand from individuals running boutiques in the town. 
The group received a combined loan of (USD) $1,300 which will be invested in their businesses. Vakundi group members are grateful to everyone who is going to fund them. Judith hopes to open a boutique in the town to sell her clothing line.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 37-year-old housewife with 4 children. 

Her husband is helping her with their business of running a sari-sari store (small grocery store) and making puto (rice cakes). One of her children has renal failure and has dialysis every two weeks. Julie is working double hard to pay for the treatment of her child. Aside from her grocery store, she also sells ice cream and chilled fruit drinks, and her first loan amounting to 10,000 PHP bought her a coffee vending machine. 

Julie is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 1 bag of coffee powder, and 3 bags of fruit-drink powder as added items to sell in her store. 

Julie hopes to expand her business to help support her child's treatment and to save for the education of her other children.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 1 bag of coffee powder, and 3 bags of fruit-drink powder as added items to sell in her store

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a widow from Sindangan, Philippines. She is managing her fishing activities and owns a fishing boat. She hired two fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy fish nets, foams and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, Felicisima has to have all the needed fishing accessories to maximize chances of a good catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, Felicisima dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her family enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy operates a motor transport business and her husband is the driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day, from which she supports her family's needs. 

To continue her business, Mercy availed herself of a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repairs. 

She dreams to own motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Motibot, Sindangan. Ma. Victoria operates a fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs her family especially her children's education until they graduate and get their own jobs. 

Ma. Victoria requested a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to repair her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, she hopes to concrete her house.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and maintain other fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 58, married, and living in Sindangan, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never gets tired of tending her store. 

Maria is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations, without records of default. 

Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and canned goods to sell. Having enough inventory would create income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a grocery store, which she has been doing for a number of years. She earns a good return, in addition to her husband's income. 

Jesusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. She requested her fourth loan for 5,000 PHP which she will use to buy more inventory to sell. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Artillery

texts.en:
Artillery is a restaurant chain and health food business that works directly with its suppliers - farmers in Cambodia - to build a healthy ecosystem and support local economies, particularly in rural agricultural communities.

Artillery began as a small arts cafe three years ago, and by the end of 2015 will have expanded to three locations in two cities and approximately 50 Cambodian staff - with more than half of its employees are young women, and many who are also young students studying at university.

The focus of the restaurant is to serve healthy food to customers at cafes in Phnom Penh and Siem Reap.  The mission of business is to work with local farms and food enterprises to develop organic food production, create market demand for chemical free products, and raise health awareness among consumers.

The first farming project Artillery undertook since 2013 is with a group of families in Kampong Thom, a farming cooperative of 4,000 farmers who raise and harvest Organic certified cashew nuts. Their local production partner, Mekong Rain, supports their organic farming practices then purchases the raw cashew kernals and processes the nuts at a facility in the village. 

Check out this video which depicts Artillery supply chain to get organic cashew nuts: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXpMETuglUE

This creates local jobs particularly for women to stay in their community and work closely to home and their families  - and at the same time those farming families can avoid the dangerous health impacts of industrial chemicals used in agriculture.

The processed nuts are sold to Artillery, which helps to create the local market demand for organic products in the restaurants and other shops.  

This loan allows us to advance money to the farming cooperative to invest in raw materials and employ the people to begin processing this season's cashew harvest.  After the harvest and processing, Artillery will use and retail the organic products in shops and markets across Cambodia. 

The loan also allows us to go beyond just cashew nuts, and begin these organic farming projects in other rural communities with other locally grown crops - such as palm sugar, avocados, and wild raw honey. 

How the loan will perform:

The first tranche (“Tranche 1”) of USD 10,000 will be loaned to Artillery Cafe to purchase Cashew nuts from Mekong Rain on behalf of Artillery. The remaining USD 20,000 will be reserved for 2 tranches of USD 10,000 each to be employed in the same way for other supplies to be determined. The loan will be repaid in 3 years because Artillery needs USD 30,000 for 3 consecutive seasons as a pledge for suppliers.

loans.use: To invest in raw materials and employ people to process this season's organic cashew harvest.

loans.name: Julia

texts.pt: A Senhora Julia vive numa casa propria com dois filhos, é militar. Com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir materiais de contrução tais como cimento, areia e blocos. Tem sonho por a sua casa com melhores condições habitacionais e progredir na sua carreira profissional. Tem como desafio estudar bastante e ter mais financiamentos.
texts.en: Julia, who lives in her own house with two children, is in the military. With this loan she will buy construction materials, such as cement, gravel, and cinder blocks. She dreams of having a house with better living conditions and advancing in her career. Her main challenges are to study enough and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, gravel, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a businesswoman from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 43 years old, married, and has an expertise for sales.  

Regina runs a little sari-sari store, and she is also engaged in buying and selling dried fish. She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.  

Regina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for stock of dried fish to sell in the local community. 

Regina continues to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items and to pay for stock of dried fish to sell in the local community

loans.name: Haziel

texts.en:
Haziel is 40 years old; she is married and living in Sindangan, in the Philippines. Haziel and her husband earn a living through farming, supporting her children's education and their family needs. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in February of 2013. She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. Haziel wants to provide her family with comfortable living quarters, for which she requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, sticks, and nipa thatch for her house. 

Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agribusiness to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, sticks, and nipa thatch for her house

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Keudin Vidal

texts.es: Keudin Vidal, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al terreno antes de realizar la siembra de la semilla del frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y también una semilla de frijol ue se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona, además pagar mano de obra principalmente en hacer curvas a nivel para evitar la erosión del suelo por la agua de lluvia y asi conservar mas la fertilidad del suelo y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la propiedad para el cultivo de granos básicos , y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha  que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Keudin Vidal is 22 years old. married and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. With this loan he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his land before planting beans so that he will have good germination and have a bean seed that adapts well to the local conditions. He will also pay labor to mainly make terraces to avoid soil erosion from the rain water and conserve the fertile soil and to apply the products and assist the plants once they have started to grow. In this way he will ensure good work. What he wants to do is take advantage of the climatic and soil conditions of his land for the production of basic grains and put into practice the experience of several years in producing basic grains.

Besides being able to buy the best product of best quality so that his plantation develops well and healthily as well as reap a good harvest, and in the short term he can have large production. With the income from the harvest he hopes to use for the well-being and education of his family and fulfill some family goals and continue to invest in his crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had a loan from a state bank and FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, table oil, salt and yeast

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es:
Coralia, de 48 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, todos viven con ella y estudian, además su mamá vive con ella.

Coralia, tiene negocio de venta de medicina natural desde hace 10 años, comenzó comprando cantidades pequeñas y ofreciendolas en su comunidad.- Antes, solo le ayudaba a sus padres en la casa, su negocio está a 20 minutos de distancia desde su casa y viaja en autobús para llegar hasta ese lugar; su hija mayor se involucra en este negocio, Coralia, comienza a vender desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta que termina la venta a las 2:00 p.m.

Coralia, necesita el crédito para comprar dos cajas de medicina, en donde viene de toda clase de medicamento, el préstamo le ayudará a mejorar su venta.

Su sueño a futuro es colocar una venta de mariscos y ampliar su venta de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Coralia is 48 years old. She never went to school. She is a single mother and has three children. They all live with her and go to school. Her mother also lives with her.

Coralia has had a business selling natural medicines for the past ten years. She started out buying small amounts and offering them to her community. Before, she only helped her parents out at home. Her business is 20 minutes from her home, and she travels by bus to get there. Her oldest daughter is also involved in the business. Coralia starts work at 7:00a.m. until she finishes selling at 2:00p.m.

Coralia needs the loan to buy boxes of medicine that contain all kinds of medications. The loan will help her to improve her sales.

Her dream for the future is to have a business selling shellfish, and to grow her natural medicines business.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and tiles to improve and complete his house.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
O senhor Adriano tem 48 anos de idade,casado e pai de 3 filhos, todos menores de idade, mas só vive com a filha mais nova na sua  casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, ferros e estribos para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são abrir uma oficina mecânica e ter uma criação de pintos.
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação recorre ao trabalho e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Adriano is 48 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still minors, though only the youngest lives with him in his own house. He says that with this loan he will buy cement, sheet metal, rebar, and boards to continue with his home improvement project. His dreams for the future are to open an auto shop and raise chickens. His main challenge is a lack of funds, but to overcome this he works and plans to take out future loans to realize his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, rebar, and boards.

loans.name: Cidalia

texts.pt:
A senhora Cidália tem 38 anos de idade, é solteira, mãe de 2 filhos,1 ja maior de idade e é casada, o outro  menor  a estudar no nivel primario e vive com ele na sua casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar sanita, banheira e material de canalização.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são construir uma garagem e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação recorre ao trabalho e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Cidália is 38 years old, single, and the mother of two children, of whom one is grown and married and the other is in elementary school and lives with her in her own house. She says that with this loan she will buy a toilet, bathtub, and plumbing materials. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build a garage and buy a car for her personal use. Her main challenges are a lack of funds, but to overcome this she relies on her work and plans to take out future loans to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, bathtub, and plumbing materials.

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.pt:
A senhora Ana Paula tem 43 anos de idade,viúva e é  mãe de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais maiores de idade e 3 menores, vive com todos eles na sua casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar portas, janelas, ferros e cimento para construcao de sua casa. 
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são reabilitar a sua casa e mobilar, para dar conforto a sua família fazer uma dependencia para arrendar reforcando assim a renda familiar..
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassa-los recorre ao trabalho e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Ana Paula is a 43-year-old widow with five children, of whom two are adults and three are children. She lives together with all of them in her own house. She says that with this loan she will buy doors, windows, rebar, and cement to make improvements to her house. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to renovate her house in order to make her family more comfortable and to have a room that she can rent out to increase her household income. Her main challenge is a lack of funds, but to overcome this she works and also plans to take out future loans in order to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, rebar, and cement.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending.  Elvira is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fishing net, to pay for maintenance for her boat, and to buy other supplies for her business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, to pay for maintenance for her boat, and to buy other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 38-year-old single woman.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, eggs, cooking oil, spices and other personal care products.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Jenelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, eggs, cooking oil, spices and other personal care products

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raya is 33 years old and all of her children are in school.

Raya has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts.

Raya has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 34 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maricris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Maricris would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Belen is 38 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Belen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Belen has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. Josefina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as flour, meat, spices, bread, cooking oil, and other materials for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Josefina has been in this business for 30 years now, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, meat, spices, bread, cooking oil, and other materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand and tile flooring to remodel her space.

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
La socia Cerafina pertenece al  banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir  trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de gallinas.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Cerafina is a member of the communal bank ''REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS''.
She continues to work in the business of breeding animals such as hens, pigs and guinea pigs. She is a responsible and persevering person. She wants to be able to continue working and continue to support her family.
She is asking for a loan to buy hens.
This member is happy for this loan and is committed to complying with the payments.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero y tienen 4 hijos.

Juana, trabaja en la agricultura desde los 14 años de edad, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores, ahora siembra maíz y yuca y sus cultivos están a 1 kilómetro desde su casa y llega en bicicleta hasta sus cultivos.- Además, recibe la ayuda de su pareja para realizar la siembra.

El crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler del terreno.

Juana, sueña con continuar estudiando hasta bachillerato y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, has a second grade education.  She is married and has 4 children, and her husband is a day laborer. 

Juana has worked in agriculture since she was 14 years old, because her parents were farmers.  Now she cultivates corn and cassava. Her fields are 1 kilometer from her house, and she travels there by bicycle.  In addition, she receives help from her husband to plant the crops. 

This loan will be invested in agricultural supplies and to pay for rent on her land.  

Juana dreams of continuing to study and obtaining a high school degree.  She also wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to rent some land

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jeany works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Jeany is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business.

Jeany has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Carla Alejandra

texts.es:
Carla tiene 19 años nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz perteneciente a  la República del Ecuador, es soltera vive en casa del papá ya que sus padres son divorciados, está estudiando en la universidad  y para solventar sus gastos tiene un pequeño negocio de confites en casa de su padre que queda ubicada en las rieles del tren  
Su mayor  obstáculo en su vida ha sido tener que superar la separación de sus padres, pues fue cuando era niña y fue muy duro para ella y sus hermanos tener que pasar por este proceso doloroso. 
Este negocio fue heredado por su abuelo quien al no poder seguir atendiendo lo dejo y Carla atiende desde las cuatro de la tarde hasta la noche, ya que su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada en este horario. Carla es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Por el momento está solicitando  un crédito paralelo al que tiene con Fundacion Alternativa,  para poder  incrementar su mercadería   quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Carla, 19, was born in the city of Latacunga in La Matriz parish in the Republic of Ecuador.  She is single and lives in her father's house, because her parents are divorced.  She is studying at the university.  To cover her expenses she has a small confectionery store in her father's house, which is located near the railroad tracks.

Carla's main obstacle in life has been the separation of her parents, because when she was a child it was very hard for her and her siblings to have to go through this painful process.

Carla inherited her business from her grandmother, who left it to her when she could no longer manage it.  Carla tends to the store from 4pm until nighttime, because her store is located in an area that is very busy during those hours.  Carla is a youth who is very hardworking and enterprising.

At this time, Carla is requesting another loan from Fundacion Alternativa in addition to one she already has with them.  She will use this loan to increase her merchandise.  She wants to extend sincere thanks and compliments to the Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for her to grow both in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Helisoa

texts.fr:
Helisoa est une femme originaire de la campagne. Elle a 34 ans et élève ses 2 enfants avec son mari dans la commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe. Elle est vendeuse de bananes depuis 7 ans.

Cela fait déjà 5 ans qu’elle est partenaire de Vahatra. Les prêts successifs qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis d’augmenter régulièrement son stock de marchandises. Aujourd’hui, avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des bananes en gros (plusieurs tonnes).

Avec son activité, Helisoa a déjà réussi à accéder à un certain niveau d’épargne. Elle espère pouvoir, à moyen terme, construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Helisoa is a woman originally from the countryside. She is 34 years old and is raising two children with her husband in Commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe. She has been a vendor of bananas for seven years.

For five years, she has been a Vahatra partner. The successive loans she has obtained have enabled her to increase her inventory of merchandise regularly. Today, with her new loan, she is going to purchase some bananas wholesale (several tonnes). 

With her business, Helisoa has already succeeded in reaching a certain level of savings. She hopes to be able to build, in the medium term, her own house .

loans.use: to purchase a stock of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Sheila works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Sheila is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
L a socia Lidia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS.
La socia continua dedicándose a la  agricultura ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua sembrando diferentes tipos de verduras como zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito  para comprar semillas y abono. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Lidia is part of the communal bank 'Reyna de Los Angeles De Urquillos'.

This partner continues to earn a living from agriculture, she spends a lot of time on her business which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She continues to plant different types of vegetables such as carrots and onions, this is how she looks after her family. 

Lidia is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertiliser. She is happy for the the loan and agrees to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds an fertiliser

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”.
La socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita  el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is part of the communal bank 'Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos' 

She continues to earn a living from raising young animals such as chickens, she is a responsible and persevering person. This partner wishes to continue working in order to continue providing for her family.
 
She is asking for the loan in order to buy chickens and nourishment, she is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and nourishment

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of PHP 3,000. Lilian is 52 years old, married, and has four children. The family lives in Sindangan. 

Lilian joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. 

Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store, to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store, to increase stock.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, who are both currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who buy and sells personal care products in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more personal care products such as body lotion, perfume, cosmetics, beauty soap and other products to sell.

Cheryll has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products such as body lotion, perfume, cosmetics, beauty soap and other products

loans.name: Oscar Alirio

texts.es:
Oscar, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja es secretaria y tiene dos hijas.
Oscar, es agricultor y desde la edad de 14 años se ha dedicado a esta actividad, aparte de trabajar como jornalero.- Actualmente, siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz, de esta actividad dependen todos sus ingresos. 

El crédito será invertido para sembrar una área de 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y con el crédito podrá comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios.

Oscar, sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 53 years old, he studied until second grade. His partner is a secretary and they have two daughters. 

Oscar has earned a living as a farmer since 14 years old, apart from working as a journalist. At the moment he is sowing 14,000 meters squared in order to cultivate maize, he relies on this activity for all of his income. The loan will be used to help sow this area and to purchase all of the necessary agricultural equipment.

Oscar dreams of improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to sow an area of 14,000 meters squared to cultivate maize, and to be able to buy all of the necessary agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Cristituta

texts.en:
Cristituta is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Cristituta has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rexileen Marie

texts.en:
Rexileen Marie is 22 years old and single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries (like canned goods, spices, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, and noodles) and personal care products to sell.

Rexileen Marie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries (like canned goods, spices, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, and noodles) and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 54-year-old widow and the mother of six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lolita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Anelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anelyn has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is unmarried and lives in Kampala, Uganda. She has five children and takes care of an additional family member. The family lives in a rented house and has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

For the past ten years Harriet is a tailor and works seven days a week on retail basis. Seasonality and transportation are her major challenges in this business.

Harriet is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through MCDT–SACCO to buy material for making clothes and a new sewing machine. Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothes and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as noodles, chicken, sausages, twisties, lolly, tinned fish, etc. She has been doing this for three years.

Aliitasi needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, salt, sugar, boxes of noodles, chickens, sausages, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her store. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, salt, sugar, boxes of noodles, chickens, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Timenata

texts.en: Timenata is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes, as well as selling Samoan oil, chips, and coconuts in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Timenata has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, material, thread, scissors, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her flea market. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, material, thread, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, eggs, cooking oil, spices, and other personal care products.

Victoria has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, eggs, cooking oil, spices, and other personal care products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 54 years old and a married mother. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Aida has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store and from raising livestock. Lolita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is widowed and works hard to support her family. She is in the business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Diana has been in this business for three years now. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru:
Гулжан, 40 лет, замужем, образование средне-специальное, у нее 4 детей. Гулжан много лет проработала в России поваром. Затем в 2013 году она родила младшего сына, с тех пор занималась домом, детьми и животноводством. Сейчас ей удалось устроить сына в садик, появилось много свободного времени, и Гулжан решила начать свое собственное дело. Она тщательно анализировала рынок и пришла к выводу, что откроет магазин по продаже ковров, пледов, подушек, постельного белья. Со слов Гулжан в поселке, в котором она живет, спрос на этот товар большой, остатков товара практически не будет.
Гулжан безусловно продолжит заниматься и животноводством, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 4 коровы, 5 овец и 5 коз, корм для скота Гулжан выращивает на собственном приусадебном участке, летом скот отдают на выпас на пастбище пастуху. Супруг будет помогать Гулжан в ее животноводческом деле. 
Старшая дочь Гулжан по профессии дизайнер, Гулжан с мужем купили ей швейную машинку, они планируют, что дочь будет шить постельное белье, которое Гулжан тоже будет продавать в своем новом магазине, остальной товар она собирается покупать на крупном оптовом центральном рынке региона. 
Гулжан очень хочет по-быстрее начать свое дело и стать более независимой и самостоятельной, содержать семью и ни в чем не отказывать своим детям, она уже арендовала магазин на рынке в центре поселка за 5,000 сом (KGS)в месяц, однако ей нужны средства на приобретение товара, поэтому Гулжан и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на стартовый бизнес в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), на эту сумму она купит ковры, постельное белье, пледы и подушки. На сегодняшний день ее прибыль от животноводства составляет 19,958 сом (KGS), ожидаемая прогнозная прибыль Гулжан от ее стартового бизнеса будет составлять свыше 50,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса Гулжан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие, также в образование и воспитание ее детей.
texts.en:
Gulzhan is 40, married and has four children. She has a vocational education and worked for many years as a cook in Russia. In 2013 she gave birth to her youngest son, and ever since she has been taking care of the home, children and livestock. Now that her son is in kindergarten, she has more free time and decided to start her own business. She carefully analyzed the market and decided to open a shop selling carpets, rugs, pillows and linens. Gulzhan says that these kinds of goods are in demand in her village and that there will be practically no inventory left over. 

Gulzhan currently has four cows, five sheep and five goats and will certainly continue to raise livestock. She grows feed on her own plot of land and the animals graze in the summer. Her spouse will help her with the livestock business.

Gulzhan's eldest daughter is a designer by profession. Gulzhan and her husband bought her a sewing machine and plan to have her sew linens for Gulzhan to sell in her new store. She will buy the rest of the goods at the region's wholesale market. 

Gulzhan really wants to start her business soon and become more independent and self-sufficient, to support her family and not have to deny her children anything. She has already rented a storefront at the market in the center of the village for 5,000 som (KGS) per month, but she still needs the funds to obtain inventory. This is why Gulzhan applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to start her business. She will use the loan to buy carpets, linens, blankets and pillows. So far she has earned 19,958 som (KGS) from the livestock business and expects profits of more than 50,000 som (KGS) from the new business. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in expanding her business and to educate and raise her children.

loans.use: to start her own business selling carpets, blankets, pillows and linens in order to be more independent and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Aminata.  She is divorced and has two children, aged 22 yrs and 20 yrs. In 2008, Aminata established her clothing, textiles and cosmetics business. 

She began her business because she wanted to improve her life, assist her children's education, and take good care of her parent. Her business is located at city centre, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more textiles, cosmetics and clothing to sell. 

She hopes that this loan will help her to gain additional income. In the future, Aminata plans to build her  house and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more textiles, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.For the past three years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces challenges of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Chhengleang's Group

texts.en: Living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Chhengleang is 34 years old and a married mother of two children. Both of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She struggles to earn a living; growing rice is the main source of her income. This is Chhengleang's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her past loan. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers, and to plow the field. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers, and to plow the rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Shukurani Group

texts.en: Shukurani is a group with five members. They are a part of the Wezesha Project from Bukavu in eastern part of Democratic Republic of Congo. Mauwa (first on the right) is a 29 years old and a married mother of three children. Her husband has no job. Mauwa has been operating her business selling clothes for four years. The group is requesting loans of 400 USD each, for a group total of 2000 USD. Mauwa's loan will be used to purchase more stock of clothing to sell. This will be her sixth loan from Wezesha Project, and the group has a strong repayment record.
