She wants to use the profits she will earn to open a retail shop to give her more income to support her family. Her dream is to educate and feed her children well.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Kokou est un homme marié qui habite à Adidogomé. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Kokou vend du maïs en gros afin de réaliser son revenu. Kokou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Kokou demande ce fonds pour favoriser son achat et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille
texts.en: Kokou is 40 years old, married, and he lives in Adidogomé.  Eager to see his family prosper, he makes a living selling maize in bulk quantities.  He stocks up at the market twice a month.  He is taking this loan to buy several bags of maize and to make a profit margin which will help him to better meet his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy six bags of maize.

loans.name: Ulumba Group

texts.en:
Christina thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her; she used the loan to purchase more fish. This helped her to successfully increase her profits, and she used the profits obtained to pay school fees for her children and provide them with other basic needs.

Christina would like to obtain another loan in order to diversify her business, because she wants to open a grocery store. She hopes to send her children to better school and plans of further increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy salt,soap and other assorted items for her grocery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Titukulane Group

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and has three children. Farming is her main source of income. She cultivates different types of crops, but she mainly relies on Irish potatoes, as they are greatly demanded in her area.

She started this business in order to financially support her family by providing them with needed resources. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides in order to increase her harvest.

She plans to increase her business to meet the people’s demand, and she hopes to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertlizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The man raising his hand on the photo is called Joseph. He is 27 years old and a father of two children who are in school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about enterprise development, record keeping, and financial management.

Joseph operates a retail shop and is borrowing a loan to buy food stuffs like sugar, maize flour and salt to add stock to his retail shop to increase sales for more income and be able to meet his customers' needs. He says that this loan will help him in enhancing his business.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like sugar, maize flour and salt to add stock to his retail shop to increase sales for more income and be able to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Kangeche

texts.en: The man in the photograph is Kangeche. He is 80 years old, married and has 10 children. He does maize and bean farming as his economic activity. He has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his business. He is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He hopes this will enable him to boost his proceeds and hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family, which include quality education, good diet, proper clothing and modern housing. Kangeche is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds that will improve crop yield.

loans.name: Marius

texts.fr:
Marius est un jeune homme ambitieux et passionné de son affaire. Il vend des téléphones portables et accessoires (chargeurs, batteries, lecteurs cartes, etc..) comme nous pouvons voir sur la photo. 
Il travaille dure pour soutenir sa petite famille, il cherche toujours à améliorer son activité depuis le début il y a 4 ans. Il veut se distinguer des autres qui ont la même activité pour attirer beaucoup de clients.
37 ans, marié, Marius a 3 enfants de 11, 9 et 4ans qui vont tous à l'école. Sa femme est gargotière ambulante.
La famille vient d'acheter un bout de terrain à la campagne et projette d'y construire une petite maison, c'est pourquoi Marius veut davantage gagner de revenu et épargner afin de parvenir à son projet.
texts.en:
Marius is an ambitious young man who is passionate about his job.  As you can see on the photo, he sells cellular phones and accessories (chargers, batteries, memory cards etc..).  He works hard to support his family and he is always trying to improve his business, which he started four years ago.  He wants to be different from his competitors and attract many customers.

Marius is 37 years old, married, and his has three children ages 11, 9 and 4, who all go to school.  His wife works as an itinerant food seller.  Marius and his family have just bought a plot of land in the countryside and they are planning to build a small house.  For this reason, Marius wants to increase his income and save some money in order to achieve his project.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones, batteries, chargers, memory cards, headphones...

loans.name: Ese

texts.en:
Ese is a 34-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Ese has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, frying pans, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ese will hope to support her poor family financially.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Aguilas De Cotoca Group

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ un área rural localizada al este de la ciudad, famosa por sus comidas tradicionales y por la fabricación de jalea y melao (derivados de la caña de azúcar), también por sus tradicionales horneados de maíz y yuca, como; el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos, los pobladores son herederos de una cultura artesanal; especialmente de cerámicas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados Centígrados.
Karina  es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la izquierda, viste solera y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en el comercio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la impulsó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de cama, agricultura, venta de fruta, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de empanadas, venta de refrescos, venta de perfumes, venta de verduras y venta de poleras, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisas, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, visitando ferias, comercios y mercados, todos los días de la semana por la mañana y por la tarde. “vendo continuamente toda la ropa porque los precios son más accesibles que la ropa nueva…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mercadería que vende es por temporada y la desventaja es que no cuenta con puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de ropa de segunda mano, como; camisetas, chamarras, pantalones, etc., para aumentar sus ingresos y pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Karina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano para ofertar mayor variedad y pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karina is a 30 year old, married woman.  She has three children, ages 15, 11, and 3 and she sells second hand clothing.

She is a good, optimistic, generous, friendly, and hardworking, responsible mother who runs her business in ‘Cotoca,’ a rural area in the eastern part of the city, known for its traditional dishes and making of jelly and molasses (made from cane sugar) and for its traditional corn and yucca baked goods, such as sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés and bizcochos.  The people here have learned the artesian culture, especially in ceramics.  The climate is warm and tropical with temperatures that vary between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Karina has brown skin, long black hair that she ties back, dark eyes, is short in stature and of medium skin complexion.  Her native tongue is Guarani and she speaks it at home.  She speaks Spanish culturally and in her business. (She is standing to the left and wearing a black top and pants.)  She shares her life with her husband, who is a merchant, and her children.  The two oldest ones attend school and the youngest is still too young.  They live in a wooden home with a corrugated metal roof.  It has potable water, electricity, and sewage.

Her need to improve her income led her to form a group with other merchants such as bed clothing sellers, farmers, fruit sellers, cleaning product sellers, empanada sellers, soft drink vendors, perfume sellers, vegetable sellers, and t-shirt sellers.  This way she can request a loan and improve her business.  She sells second hand clothing like pants, t-shirts, shirts, etc. on foot, visiting fairs businesses, and markets every day of the week in the mornings and evenings.  “I sell the clothing continuously because the process are more affordable than new clothing,” she says.

The advantage to her business is that she sells seasonally and the disadvantage is that she doesn’t have a fixed location to sell from.  Her dream is to have a clothing store.  She wants to expand her business by buying a variety of second hand clothing such as t-shirts, jackets, pants, etc. in order to improve her income and be able to pay her children’s school expenses.  This is her first loan through the institution in 10 years.  She works on her own.

This is the reason that Karina is requesting this loan, so she can buy second hand clothing to offer a better variety and be able to pay her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Maamora

texts.en:
Maamora is 35 years old and a married woman with three children.

Maamora runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, and yeast, and also cooking oil, fry pan, etc.

She joined SPBD in March 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maamora hopes to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, and yeast, and fry pans.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in a village in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Chanthou earns her income from the fish-selling business. She has been in this business since 2009. Two of her four children work as workers, and two others attend school. Her husband is 52 years old and a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Chanthou, her husband and the two children can earn around USD 14 each day.

Chanthou would like to improve the family’s income. Therefore, she has decided to take out a loan to buy roasted pork to sell. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and help her two children to earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy roasted pork to sell

loans.name: Peia

texts.en:
Peia is 38 years old and a married woman with five children.

She runs a small business selling beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Peia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, fertilizer, seeds, bush knives, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Peia hopes to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, rake, spade, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Ее зовут Мухаббат. Ей 42 года. Она родом из района Бохтар. Мухаббат вежливая и дружелюбная женщина. Мухаббат замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее муж работает сварщиком, а она сама занимается земледелием. Мухаббат в этом году посеяла семена сельскохозяйственных культур и ей только остается обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Из-за того, что ей не хватило средств на приобретения минеральных удобрений, она обратилась за кредитом. Если она не сможет купить минеральные удобрения, но не сможет сохранить посеянный урожай, подержите Мухаббат. Спасибо!
texts.en: Her name is Muhabbat. She is 42 years old, and was born in the Bohtar region. Muhabbat is a cheerful and friendly woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a welder, and Muhabbat grows crops. This year, Muhabbat has planted seeds for her crops, and all that remains is for her to cultivate her crops with mineral fertilizer so that she will have a plentiful and high-quality harvest. Because she does not have the money to purchase mineral fertilizer, she has applied for a loan. If she can't buy mineral fertilizer, she will not be able to guarantee her harvest. Support Muhabbat! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Жительница района Носири Хусрав 33 лет ее зовут Ситора. Ей всего 33 лет. Ситора замужем и имеет троих детей. Детям 16, 12 и 8 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. Муж занимается таксистом в районе. Сама Ситора домохозяйка и во дворе занимается  выращиванием  скота. Она 6 лет продвигает эту деятельность. Ей в работе помогает муж. Ситора так много трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь мужу обеспечить семьи. Она сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей сохранить деятельность и не потерять источник дохода.
texts.en: Sitora is 33 years old and lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region. She is only 33 years old. Sitora is married and has three children, who are 16, 12, and 8 years old and go to secondary school. Her husband works in their region as a taxi driver, and Sitora is a housewife and raises livestock in their yard. She has been doing this for 6 years, and her husband helps her in her work. She works so hard so that she can make some money and help her husband provide for the family. Now she wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand her business, so she has applied for a loan. The loan will help her maintain her business and not lose the source of income.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to expand her business.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN JOSE”;  el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
 La socia es la Sra. Cirila, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de flores como calas, margaritas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de claveles, rosas entre otros.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características
texts.en:
These members belong to the “San José” communal bank, located in the department of Cusco. 

One member is Cirila, who continues to make a living selling flowers. She is very responsible and determined. She continues to sell various types of flowers, including calla lilies and daisies, to her customers. This work allows Cirila to move forward with her family.

Cirila is applying for a loan in order to buy carnations, roses and more.

People over the age of 65 are excluded from the formal financial market but, thanks to Kiva investors, they can take out a loan. Cirila promises to make her repayments on time.

The members of the communal bank are grateful for this loan and have committed to paying it back.

This loan is part of the “Credi Yapa” line at Asociación Arariwa. These loans are granted to borrowers with a good credit rating, such as the members of this group.

loans.use: to buy carnations, roses and more.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental plant business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her plants, she is also a tricycle operator.

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and net she needs to grow healthy ornamental plants and also to pay for her jeepney maintenance. Her income from her businesses will definitely help cover her family’s everyday personal and household needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for her beautiful ornamental plants and for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Editha dreams to be more successful in her ornamental plant farm and to buy another jeepney. She prays for God to bless her with good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other materials for her ornamental-plant-growing business and also to pay for her jeepney maintenance.

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús, es un joven estudiante que vive con 6 personas (padres, hermanos y 2 sobrinos). Él es la primera persona en su familia que puede continuar sus estudios superiores después de colegio, gracias al apoyo de KIVA.
Él vive en uno de los distritos más pobres de Lima. Su padre trabaja como operario de almacén y su madre solo es ama de casa, por lo que sus ingresos familiares son mínimos. Él requiere el apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar estudiando, ya que no cuenta con los medios económicos que le permitan culminar su carrera de Redes de Comunicación.
A él, le gusta mucho su carrera porque es una carrera moderna, con alta demanda de trabajo y le beneficiaría ya que es una buena profesión para sacar adelante a su familia.
Él piensa que el programa de KIVA es de gran apoyo para los estudiantes, que tienen ganas de salir adelante pero no cuentan con la posibilidad de pagar su carrera y muchas veces tienen que truncar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jesús is a young student. He lives with six other people – his parents, siblings, and two nephews. Jesús is the first one in his family who has been able to move on to further education following high school; this is thanks to Kiva.

Jesús lives in one of the poorest districts in Lima. His father works as a warehouse operative while his mother is a housewife. The family’s income is very low. Jesús needs Kiva’s support in order to continue studying as he does not have the financial means that will allow him to finish his degree in computer networking systems.

Jesús really likes his degree as it a modern subject and there is a high demand for people with his skills. This degree will be good for Jesús as it is a good profession and he can help his family to move forward.

Jesús thinks that the Kiva programme is a great support for students who want to do better but who cannot pay for their studies and often have to give up their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in computer networking systems and data communication.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, a farmer living in Santok district of Kampong Thom province, is a mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her. For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. To supplement income, she grows cassava. She has been involved in her jobs for 25 years, and she can earn about 22,200 KHR per day.

This is Sokha's ninth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. As a group leader of five members, she will spend her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that she can provide family members with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Henry Danilo

texts.es:
Henry Danilo es un joven de 29 años de edad, casado con Suyapa con quien tiene 4 hermosos hijos. Danilo sueña con poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Henry se dedica a la producción de miel orgánica bajo de dirección técnica de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio. La comercialización de la miel no es un reto ya que los mercados tanto nacionales como internaciones tienen pocas existencias de miel, además COCAFCAL de encarga de buscar mercado a las mieles en los mercados extranjeros.Los apiarios orgánicos son un éxito novedoso en la región ya  permiten a las personas tener ingresos extras al café, principal actividad de la zona u ayuda a la polinización de toda la flora.
Henry Danilo solicita un crédito para ampliar su apiario para lo que necesita comprar: cajas para colmenas, trajes para trabajo en el apiario, compra de alimentos orgánicos para las colmenas y excluidores.
 Un crédito ayudara a Henry a incrementar el número de colmenas que ahora posee y tener mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades, alimento y una vida de calidad.
texts.en:
Henry Danilo is 29 years old and married to Suyapa, with whom he has four beautiful children. Henry dreams of giving his children a good education so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Henry makes a living producing organic honey with technical support from COCAFCAL, where he is a member. Selling the honey is not a challenge as both domestic and international markets have little honey. In addition, COCAFCAL takes care of looking for international markets to sell the honey.

Organic apiaries are a new success here in Honduras. This work allows people to earn more money than just from growing coffee, the main trade in the local area. The apiaries also help with the pollination of all the flowers.

Henry is applying for a loan in order to expand his apiary. He needs to buy boxes for beehives and suits for working with the bees. He also needs organic feed and other items for the beehives.

This loan will help Henry to increase the number of beehives that he has. It will give him a higher income, allowing him to give his children the best possible opportunities, and to give them food and a quality life.

loans.use: to buy new beehives to expand his apiary, suits for his work, and organic feed for the bees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is thankful that she accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and accessories for her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for tire replacement, fuel, oil and maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the safe service of her tricycle and the financial help that will be extended to her, since it will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.

Virginia plans to buy another tricycle unit to improve her income. She trusts that God will bless her with good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tire replacement, fuel, oil and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Tapa

texts.en:
Tapa is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cabbages, beans, and eggplant in her community. She has been doing this for three years.

Tapa has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tapa will hope to extend her garden to increase her income earned and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, a rake, a spade, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Amanda

texts.es:
Jesús Amanda a sus  61 años, ella tiene que trabajar duro para vivir y alimentar a su hijo que padece que condiciones especiales de salud, además debe comprar medicinas ara ella y su hijo.  Amanda está casada con Juan quien se dedica a la producción de Café Orgánico. En los últimos años la producción de las fincas ha disminuido ya que el hongo de la roya a afectado los cafetales es por eso que Amanda a emprendido desde hace 2 años un apiario donde produce miel Orgánica que vende en COCAFCAL de la cual es socia. Con las ganancias de su apiario Amanda Compra medicinas para ella su esposo y su hijo además ayuda con algunos otros gastos de la casa que Juan no puede cubrir.
Amanda pone todo de sí en el bienestar de su apiario y aunque a pesar de su edad las tareas que puede realizar son pocas, ha sabido sobrellevarlo y mantener una buena producción de miel de manera que el negocio se hace sostenible.
Amanda está solicitando un crédito para poder pagar trabajadores en su apiario y comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta tales como: Trajes para trabajar en el apiario, Excluidores, Alimentos orgánicos para las colmenas, cajas para nuevas colmenas. 
El crédito ayudara a Amanda a poder sostener su apiario y expandirlo un poco y hacer posible obtener una ganancia para comprarse lo que le haga falta a su hijo, a su esposo y a ella.
texts.en:
Jesus Amanda is 61 years old and has to work hard to earn a living and feed her son who suffers from special health conditions.  She also needs to buy medicine for herself and her son.  Amanda is married to Juan, who raises organic coffee.  Coffee production has decreased in recent years because a fungus has affected the coffee plants, so Amanda set up beehives two years ago, where she produces organic honey that she sells in COCAFCAL, where she is from.  Amanda buys medicine for herself, her husband, and her son with her earnings from the hive.  She also helps with some of the household expenses that Juan is not able to cover.

Amanda gives her all for her hives and because of her age she is only able to do a few things, but despite this she has been able to maintain a good production of honey to the extent that the business is sustainable. 

Amanda is asking for a loan to be able to pay her hive workers and buy some things she needs, such as: work clothing, excluders, organic food for the hives, and new hive boxes.

The loan will help Amanda maintain her and expand her hives a bit and make it possible to earn enough to buy what her she, her husband, and her son need.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anilia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Anilia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients such as meat, fish, flour, spices, chicken and other materials for her food production business.

Anilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients such as meat, fish, flour, spices, chicken and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Vengel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Vengel works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and earns additional income from house rental.  Vengel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation business.

Vengel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation business

loans.name: Ma. Leddie

texts.en:
Ma. Leddie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Leddie is 32 years old and her child is still in school.

Ma. Leddie has a buy and sell of personal care products business in the Philippines. Ma. Leddie requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Ma. Leddie has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Annalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and house rental.  Annalyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices and other materials for her food vending business.

Annalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices and other materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: A resident living in the Sambour district of Kratie province, Ith is 31 years old and a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in high school. She struggles for a living via growing cassava as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she sometimes works as a paid worker. She has been involved in her job for 10 years and she can earn about 32,500 KHR per day. For Ith, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and a motorbike to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a motorbike

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Anecita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Anecita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thieu

texts.en: Mrs. Thieu is 42 years old. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Her income is mainly from animal husbandry and small business. She is interested to improve the living standard of her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Joriza

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Joriza works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Joriza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional utensils, kitchenware, and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Joriza has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils, kitchenware, and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She lives in a small village where people are very kind and peaceful. She is married and has five children. They are poor and live in their small house near mountains. They have a big family, and in order to feed them Mukaddas and her husband need to work hard. She is goal-oriented, hardworking, and a nice person.

In order to earn some money to feed their family, her husband needs to go to Russia. But they do not have enough money yet to buy a ticket to Russia. Mukaddas helps her husband to feed their family.  She plants wheat and potatoes in her yard. Now she is asking for a loan to buy a ticket for her husband. Her husband will fly to Russia and earn money to feed their family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a ticket for the flight to Russia and earn some money

loans.name: Mosoc Killa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanelit ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a ejercer su carrera de docente, la socia lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su carrera la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de zapatos, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su casa como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los socios agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Mosoc Killa.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member Yanelit is 37 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily chores and working at her career as a teacher.  She has spent a good amount of time in her career which is going well thanks to the determined effort which she puts every day into her work.  She also works selling shoes and in this way moves her family forward.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy supplies for her house, such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.

The members are grateful for the loans given and commit to making their payments on schedule.  The member in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because he was working.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her house such as rice, sugar, milk and other items

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: From Oroquieta City, Alice earns a living through her clothing sales. She makes sure to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Alice hopes to live comfortably with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, 45 years old, is a married mother of five children, who are all dependent, and two of them are in school. She lives in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from being a construction worker and a motorcycle driver for 17 years. She could earn around KHR 45,000 per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is Yen's fourth loan with VisionFund Cambodia, while the other members are applying for their first and second loans. The previous loan helped Yen to improve her standard of living. 

As a group leader, Yen wants to use her portion to buy a motorcycle to support her current business. She hopes that she could earn more income to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amelou

texts.en:
Amelou is a married woman, 53 years old.  She has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Amelou has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net and other fishing materials.

Amelou has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 45 years old and has five children.  She is married and has one child still in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. Delia has been doing this for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clippers for cutting hair.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Mrs. Tien is 53 years old. She is a hardworking woman so that she can cover her family’s daily costs and education.  She earns income from small business and animal husbandry. With this loan, she can build a sanitation latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is a generous woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has two children. She has been doing business about one year. She sews national modern women's dresses and has permanent clients every day. Sewing is good but it needs hard work and patience. Saida is a goal-oriented, patient and kind person. Her family is poor.   Saida tries her best to work and save up money too. She has a dream to renovate her apartment because they live in bad conditions. She requested a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders to renovate her house. She hopes to renovate her house and live better with her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house and live better with her family

loans.name: Mohsafar

texts.en: Mohsafar is a bright woman. She was born in the beautiful mountainous country of Tajikistan in 1971. She lives in a small town with her parents; she is divorced. She has four years' practice sewing traditional women clothes. Mohsafar attracts a lot of customers to her modern and pretty clothes. She is well known among neighbors and friends. She loves to do business sewing dresses. Mohsafar wants her business to be more productive and needs to buy a new sewing machine. It would help her to earn more money and get more orders. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in a rural area where the life is simple and everyone lives in peace. Shoira is new in business and has one year experience doing business. She does a business of buying and selling sweets and candies. She likes her business and attracts a lot of clients. She is divorced and lives with her parents. They live poor. In order to help her parents she needs to work hard and earn money for living. She has a plan to buy a new assortment of sweets and candies to enlarge her turnover capital. Shoira hopes to have a profitable business and help her family to live better. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy sweets and candies. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sweets and candies

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Mrs. Bich is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house without a hygienic latrine. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. She has daily income from pig raising activity and a small business so she is able to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a hardworking woman, 36 years old. There are six people in her family. Fishing and animal husbandry are the main income source of her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  They are in school.  She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine. Husbandry and fishing are main income sources of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly from husbandry and selling fish which her husband caught.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Chuan

texts.en: Chuan is 32 years old, married and has one child. Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family. She sells fish and has been in this business for 8 years. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 58 years old. She lives with her son. She would like to improve the health of her family. The Kiva loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from farming and selling chickens, ducks, pigs, and vegetables in the garden.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hảo

texts.en:
Hảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. Hảo has been involved in this business for 2 years.

Hảo is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hảo's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hảo faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to a build toilet

In the future, Hảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Pule

texts.en: Pule is a 45-year-old married woman with one child. She has a plantation where she grows tomatoes, cucumbers and eggplant to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Pule has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, a rake, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pule hopes to extend her house and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, a rake, etc.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan where people have their own traditions and culture. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an emigrant and tries to earn money to feed his family. Two years ago Gulsara started to do business to assist her husband in feeding their family. Gulsara has a business buying and selling women's and kid’s clothes. Her business is going well and is enough for everyday life expenditures. They live in an apartment where conditions are not so good. Because of crisis her husband can not send money to Gulsara so she could renovate their home. Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to renovate her apartment to live better. She hopes to renovate her home and have good living conditions for her children and family. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her home and have good living conditions for her children and family.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a 22-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Itagia has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, yeast, sugar, a fry pan, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Itagia hopes to earn more money from her business and to save it for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, a fry pan, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Srg-Dok-15/16809 Group

texts.en:
Yin was selected to be group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Yin (pictured on the right) is 43 years old. She lives in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1993 and has two sons and one daughter. One is married. The other two are garment factory workers.

Yin is a garment factory worker with ten years experience, while her husband is a tuk tuk driver with ten years experience. Yin is requesting a loan to repair the tuk tuk.

The other group member is Sitha, a garment factory worker.
Photo: The one on the left is Sitha.

loans.use: to repair the tuk tuk.

loans.name: Faatoa

texts.en: Faatoa is a 53-year-old woman with two children. She has a small plantation that grows beans, eggplants, and tomatoes to earn a living, and she has been doing this for three years. Faatoa has requested a loan to buy supplies such as chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, and a rake. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faatoa hopes to extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, and a rake.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a conscientious woman. She was born in the mountainous country of Tajikistan in 1967, and she is living in a village with her parents. She is divorced and has one child. 

Hanifa has 15 years practice of working as a teacher and teaches students at a secondary school. She knows her job well and tries to educate her students attentively. 

Hanifa knows about IMON very well and has a good credit history. This time she has requested a loan to pay for her sister-in-law’s medical treatment in a medical clinic. Hanifa is kind and wants to help her sister-in-law who is sick and needs to be treated. The loan would help Hanifa to treat her sister-in-law.

Hanifa hopes her sister-in-law will be safe and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her sister-in-law’s medical treatment

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is a hardworking woman. She was born in a small village in 1974, and she lives in the southern part of the country where the weather is likely good. She is divorced and has two children. 

In order to raise her children, she needs to work and earn money. Sabohat has six years experience doing business as a seamstress. She sews traditional women's dresses. She loves her activity and has permanent clients. Her business is profitable and earns enough to pay for family expenditures like food and clothing. 

Sabohat wants to renovate her house because her house's condition is not good for living. Unfortunately she cannot save up money from her business. She knows well about Kiva and IMON. 

She has requested a loan to renovate her house and have better conditions for living.

loans.use: To renovate her house and have better living conditions

loans.name: Manuel Guillermo

texts.es:
Manuel  es un hombre  ecuatoriano casado. Su esposa es quien le ayuda a la economía del hogar  y solamente tienen un hijo pequeño,  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy joven  para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, el se  dedica a trabajar como chofer profesional medio tiempo en una camioneta  con su suegro.  Ahora  Manuel vive  en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijo , la misma que está ubicada en la parroquia Belisario Quevedo del Cantón Latacunga   ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Manuel desea emprender con su propio negocio el mismo que se trata de un galpón de pollos, siempre  ha tenido la ilusión de ponerse  este negocio, ya que tiene experiencia en esta actividad, le gusta este negocio  porque dice que  puede tener mayor utilidad, su esposa  es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, trabaja ayudando a una hermana en una tienda , hoy  solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en el emprendimiento de su negocio y para esto  tendrá la ayuda de su esposa.
Manuel  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Manuel is an Ecuadorian married man. His wife helps him with the expenses of the house and they only have one young son. Thanks to the effort of his parents he was able to complete his secondary education. After that, due to the lack of economic resources he had to start working from a young age to support himself. Despite having a job that takes a lot of his time and effort, he works as a part-time professional bus driver with his father in law. Manuel currently lives in his own house with his wife and son. The house is located in the Belisario Quevedo parish of the Cantón Latacunga, in the Cotopaxi province of the Republic of Ecuador.  Even thought this place is far from the city, there are families that have started all kinds of businesses to meet their needs and those of their community. Manuel would like to start his own business, a chicken barn. He has always wanted to get into this business because he has experience and because it could be very useful.  His wife is a hardworking woman and an entrepreneur. She works in a store helping one of her sisters.  

Today he requests the loan to start his business and he counts with the support of his wife. Manuel is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for him to grow professionally and personally.

loans.use: to start a chicken barn.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is a hardworking woman who is 40 years old. There are four people in her family. With support from her husband, she can cover the family’s daily costs and education from her food service. With this loan, she is able to build a sanitation latrine to improve her family's living standard as well as protect the environment.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Mrs. Dung is 41 years old, married and has a son. The loan can help her to build a latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from food service. With more than 10 years of experience and support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mau

texts.en:
Mau is 52 years old and a married woman with seven children. She has a plantation that grows beans, tomatoes, cabbages, and so on, to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. 

Mau has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, rakes, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Mau will hope to extend her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 23 years old and a partner woman with no child. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Makerita has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, tanks, Chinese candy, plastic cups, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Makerita hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, tanks, Chinese candy, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en: Meripa is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation that grows cabbages, beans, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Meripa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, a rake, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meripa hopes to support her family's development.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, seeds, a rake, etc.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en: Bahriniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is married and has four children. She lives in a small village where women are skillful and talented. She has been busy doing business for almost four years. She is a seamstress and sews traditional women's dresses. Bahriniso sews attractive dresses and has permanent clients. Her house is old and needs to be renovated or reconstructed. She could not save up money to renovate her house because what she earns is spent only for everyday life expenditures. She hopes to have a good place to live and better conditions in her house. Bahriniso will have a good condition to live in when she renovates her house. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders now and hopes to be supported. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house because the conditions where she lives are too bad.

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Mrs. Rini has a family of six and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Rini heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held safe-water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Rini who is also a leader of her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This loan will allow her to sell about 20 filters on credit to her neighbors, making safe drinking water available to 100 people

loans.use: to provide safe drinking water to her village

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 32 years old and married with five children. With three children who are still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Robelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Robelyn has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Mrs. Yohana has a family of five and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. 

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Yohana heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe-water training course in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, and without using fuel or electricity. 

Mrs. Yohana, who is also a leader of her neighbourhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative for Nazava in her area. This loan will allow Mrs. Yohana to sell about 20 filters on credit to her neighbours making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to provide her community with clean drinking water by selling her neighbours water filters

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and manure to cultivate the land and to buy a fixed stall in the market.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food and polvoron (a type of heavy, soft and very crumbly Spanish shortbread made of flour, sugar, milk, and nuts). She is a 66-year-old married woman with seven grown dependents. Aside from that, she also goes fishing. She catches and sells fish. 

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other supplies needed. These are very essential in the preparation of polvoron.  She will now be able to cater to the needs of her customers.  She can slowly balance her finances and do some expansion to her both of her businesses to become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other supplies needed

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat, 61 years old, is a resident of Kratie province. She is a married mother of three independent children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming; feeding cows is the secondary source of income. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

Her group consists of four members, and this is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading her group of four to apply for this loan with her portion used to buy seeds and fertilizer to do farming. She hopes that she can get more yields and more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ipung

texts.en: Ipung has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Ipung heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Ipung, who is also a leader of her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This loan will allow her to sell about 40 filters on credit to her neighbors, making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: to provide her community with clean drinking water

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. Jovita is widowed and has a buy-and-sell dried-fish business in the Philippines.

Jovita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Jovita has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 29 years old, married and has three children. She would like to improve the health of her family but lacks the capital so the loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan from her salary and husbandry.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Margarita Del Pilar

texts.es:
Margarita del Pilar vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad de clima variado donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y cerveza, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes que la conocen por la buena sazón de sus platos y dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos para preparación de sus alimentos y de una mayor cantidad de cerveza, de esta manera ella espera seguir preparando sus platos y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita del Pilar lives in the Zana district, a community with a varied climate and whose population works in agriculture, business and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province which is in the Lambayeque region in Peru's northern coast.

She works selling cooked meals and beer, and is well experienced in this type of business and is renowned amongst her customers for the good taste of her dishes and give good personal and labor references for her.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for the preparation of her food and a greater amount of beer.  As such she hopes to continue making her dishes and bring better service to her customers which will in turn enable her to increase her income and the quality of life of her and her family.

loans.use: Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos para preparación de sus alimentos y de una mayor cantidad de cerveza.

loans.name: Yani

texts.en:
Mrs. Yani has a family of four and lives in a town in the Malang Regency on Java, which is Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Yani heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava Water Filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. 

Nazava Water Filters filter well water, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, and without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Yani who is also a leader in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This loan will allow Mrs. Yani to sell about 20 filters on credit to her neighbors, making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to provide safe drinking water to her network of peers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 46 years old and her two children are presently in school.

Elena raises cattle in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle. She has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 65 years old and married with six children.

Enriqueta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Enriqueta has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Enriqueta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For eye treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Stella has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Stella has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase new smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business.

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is 59 years old and married with nine children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Fotu needs a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a rake, weed sprayer, etc.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Fotu will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy seed, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, a rake, weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Sitorai

texts.en:
Sitorai is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for her first loan.  Now she and her husband sell fruits. Her husband brings fruits from Dushanbe city wholesale, and with Sitorai, sells in the local market of Kulob. This kind of business is the main source of income for them. 

Now they want to buy fruits for selling and support their children. They do not have enough money and for this reason Sitorai decided to obtain a loan and expand her business. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to increase her business and improve their life conditions again. Maybe in future she will continue to sell children’s clothes, but now she spends all of her time in selling fruits.

loans.use: to buy wholsale fruits and expand her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Leticia; la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de molinera, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua moliendo granos como habas, trigo entre otros productos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, habas  entre otros.
texts.en:
Leticia continues with her milling business.  She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.  

She continues grinding grains like beans and wheat, among other products.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.  Being this way, she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and beans, among others.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans, among others.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1987.  She is living in a small town of a beautiful scene of skies at night. She is married and has one child. Her husband works abroad in order to feed their family. Nigora has many years experience of sewing traditional women’s dresses. She loved to help her aunt in sewing when she was younger. 

Recently, she has had her own business serving Tajik women with modern national dresses and clothing. She likes to sew and decorate her clothes, and she attracts a lot of clients around her town. As she works hard each year, she needs to repair her sewing machine. The sewing machine is old now and Nigora needs to buy a new one. She used the service of IMON and asked for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. A new sewing machine will provide her more dresses, and more clients. She hopes to have more orders and gain money to feed her family. Kiva lenders support will help Nigora to have a good business and life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 6 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elio, age 24, live in the Pomahuaca district.  It is a community where life is peaceful, and the inhabitants work in agriculture, in commerce, and with livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He works in agriculture, especially with coffee crops.  He has been engaged in this business activity for six years.  Therefore, he has experience in this business.  He has fixed customers who provide him with very good personal and work references in the area.

He has requested a loan to buy compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his crops.  This way he will generate greater earnings for his family, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera, por el momento se encuentra incapacitada laboralmente debido a que le era imposible trabajar por los intensos dolores de cabeza que sufría a consecuencia de desgarros en la retina de su ojo izquierdo, por lo que tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente con urgencia ya que corría el riesgo de perder la vista  debido a antecedentes de familiares diabéticos que perdieron la vista.
texts.en: This woman, age 35, is a single mother.  At this time she is incapacitated workwise because it was impossible for her to work with the intense headaches she experienced from the tears in the retina of her left eye.  She had to have urgent surgical intervention because she ran the risk of losing her sight.  This is because there is a family history of diabetics who lost their sight.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Geralyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Geralyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell in her food stall.

Geralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor tiene 53 años de edad es casado trabaja como supervisor en una agencia de seguridad privada, desde que tenía 11 años de edad le diagnosticaron miopía y desde entonces utiliza gafas. Estas gafas debido a la alta graduación que tienen son muy costosas, además de que tiene que cambiarlas incluso dos veces al año, lo cual impacta en su economía. Para el señor existe la posibilidad de que pueda ser intervenido quirúrgicamente y dejar definitivamente las gafas, lo cual le ayudaría mucho en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The borrower is 53 years old, married, and works as a supervisor in a private security agency. At the age of 11, he was diagnosed with myopia, and has used glasses since then. Because the glasses he has are highly graduated, they are very costly, besides the fact that he has to replace them as often as twice per year, which affects his finances.

He has a chance to be operated upon and stop wearing glasses, which will help him greatly in his work.

loans.use: For eye treatment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal AMAUTA, la socia Josefina continua con su negocio de venta de productos balanceados para animales como afrecho, conejita entre otros, la socia se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de afrecho, conejina entre otros.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the AMAUTA communal bank. Josefina is continuing with her business selling nutritionally balanced products for animals, including bran and rabbit feed. She is committed to meeting her established payments. She is a responsible and earnest person and, for that, she supports her family.

This member requests a loan to buy bran and bunnies among others.

loans.use: to buy bran and rabbit feed among others.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат замужем и мать троих детей. Ей 53 лет. У нее 2 сына и 1 дочка. Она проживает в районе Носири Хусрав. Сыновья находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать денег, и помогают родителям обеспечить семью.  Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности в районе. Шарофат работает уборщицей в школе, и свободное время занимается животноводством. 3 года назад Шарофат  начала заниматься животноводством. У нее есть коровник, где она выращивает скота. Она покупает скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Шарофат обратилась за кредитом, чтоб купить скота, и продвигаться зарабатывать дальше. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести скота и улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en: Sharofat is married and a mother of three kids. She is 53 years old. She has two sons and a daughter and lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region. Her sons are working in Russia, in order to earn money and help their parents support the family. Her husband is a farmer. Sharofat works as a cleaning lady at the local school and in her spare time raises livestock. She started her livestock business three years ago. She owns a barn where she keeps her cattle. Sharofat purchases calves and fattens them for resale at the meat market. Sharofat has turned to KIVA for a loan in order to buy more cattle and expand her business. This loan will hep her purchase more livestock and in the future improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand her business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which he used to buy fertilizers and tools for maintenance of his farm. His earnings helped support his family and meet their daily basic needs and fund his children's school needs. 

He would like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan to buy more fertilizers for a productive pineapple and banana harvest. Pineapples and bananas are among the fruits that have many health benefits and are the favorites of Filipinos. He trusts and thanks God in advance that his farm will produce a healthy and bountiful harvest.  He is also thanking you for the financial help. His earnings from his farm will surely help cover his family’s daily sustenance and fund his children's education.

Felix aims to sustain and grow his farm to improve their quality of life. He aims to give his two children a college education, to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 39 years old and both of her children are presently in school.

Elvira has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, cooking oil and materials for her food production business.

Elvira has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and  ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, cooking oil and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase wooden planks, nails, glue, chipboards, etc. to continue his business.

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda is 42 years old and married with one child who is still in school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, sugar, spices, bread, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Jurenda has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, sugar, spices, bread, cooking oil, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора молодая замужняя девушка. Ей всего 21 лет. Она жительница района Шохмансур. Нигора живет со свекровью и ребенком. Она активная и шустрая девушка. Нигора на все успевает.
