Она ведет домашнее хозяйство, ухаживает о ребенке и параллельно занимается шитьем женской одежды. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Нигора 2.5 года  назад научила кроить и шить женскую одежду. Сейчас она зарабатывает, чтобы  улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. На данный момент Нигоре необходимо поменять машинку, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. Нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Она просит кредит для купли швейной машинки. Также на оставшуюся часть денег Нигора купить швейные принадлежности.
texts.en: Nigora is a young woman. She is only 21 years old. She lives in Shohmansur region with her mother-in-law and her child. She is an active and energetic woman, and is always on the go. She takes care of the whole household, raises her child and also sews women's clothes. Her husband is away, working in Russian Federation. Nigora learned to cut and sew women's clothes 2.5 years ago. Now she works as a seamstress to improve her family's living conditions. Currently Nigora needs to change her sewing machine, so that she does not loose her source of income. Her current sewing machine doesn't work well anymore. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She will use the rest of the money to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Женщину на фотографии зовут Мехринисо. Ей 28 лет. Мехринисо замужем, но ее муж на данный момент находится заграницей на заработках. Мехринисо дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она утверждает, что для нее работать на дому очень удобно. Мехринисо может работать и делать домашние дела. Мехринисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Ее накопленные сбережения не позволяют ей совершить покупку самостоятельно, и Мехринисо обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой на то, что Вы сможете ей предоставить такую возможность.
texts.en: The woman in the photograph is Mehriniso. She is 28 year old, married, but her husband is away, working abroad. Mehriniso makes women's clothes at home. She says that working from home is very convenient, as she can work and take care of her household. Mehriniso has turned to us for a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine. Her savings are insufficient to make the purchase on her own, so Mehriniso has turned to KIVA for a loan, in hopes that You can help her make this important purchase.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en: Meleseke is a 33-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business making bricks and selling them to her community. She has been four years in this business. Meleseke needs a loan to buy cement, sand, and a new brick machine. She will use her profits to extend her business and to pay for her kids' education. Meleseke joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and a new brick machine

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак добрая и ответственная девушка из городка под названием Курган-Тюбе. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем имеет сыночка. Муборак с мужем занимается продажей колбасы и других мясных продуктов. Муборак решила расширить деятельность, принести больше товара и увеличить ассортимент товара. С какими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом. Хумо больше поддерживает женщин клиентов и создает новые и новые продукты для них. Муборак сама обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Муборак.
texts.en: Muborak is a kind and responsible young woman from a small town of Qurgan-Tube. She is 26 years old, married and has one son. Muborak sells sausages and other meat product with her husband. She wants to develop her business, buy more inventory and expand the variety of meat products she can offer to her customers. With this plan in mind she has turned to MLO Humo for a loan. MLO Humo primarily supports female clients and provides new opportunities for them. Muborak turned for a loan herself. Please support her.

loans.use: To expand the meat inventory and develop her business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a small village where doing business is the most common activity in order to hep her family. Nasiba is a goal oriented, kind and honest person. She is married and has four children. She has been doing business for almost 14 years. She is busy buying and selling every day’s needed products like sugar, candies, tea, butter, oil, etc. She likes her activity and does her best in order to earn money and feed her children. Nasiba is asking a loan from KIVA lenders to buy new nutrition products and flour for selling in her small store. She hopes to gain more profit to help raise her children. Nasiba awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy new nutrition products and flour for selling in her small store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, no tiene hijos, vive en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de fruta especialmente de piñas, desde hace 10 años se dedica a este negocio por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de una mayor cantidad de frutas para incrementar el stock de su negocio, invirtiendo en frutas logrará mayores ingresos y con ello sus ganancias serán mayores, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old and has no children. She lives in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. Her community works mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Rosa works selling fruit, especially pineapples. She has been in the business for 10 years so she has experience and good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the district. She needs the loan to buy a greater quantity of fruit to increase the stock of her business. Investing in fruit will yield greater income and doing this her profits will be greater which will allow her to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fruit to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
Ma.fe  is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma.fe is 33 years old and has three children still in school.

Ma.fe has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Ma.fe has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Ma.jojie

texts.en:
Ma.jojie is 41 years old, married and and has four children who are still in school.

Ma.jojie is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cow.

Ma.jojie has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cow.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee and personal care products.

Emma has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, spices, cooking oil, milk, coffee and personal care products

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 55 years old, married, and has six children. She is in the agricultural business of raising cattle in the Philippines. Leonora has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Leonora has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Nargis in purchasing a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new spray gun and paint to carry on her husband's business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: HELLO! Meet Beatrice, 37 years of age. She is very ambitious, enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and has been doing mixed farming for the past four years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Beatrice loves farming. She has even nicknamed her cow and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Nyamira area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; that is, good soil, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Beatrice wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. She intends to buy good vegetable and fruits seeds that she will use in horticultural farming.  With more income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Beatrice will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: help her husband in purchasing new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. for providing white wash services.

loans.name: Mrs. On ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
On was selected to be group leader for a loan that requested from Maxima. There are three members in the group and they are in a village in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

On (pictured) is 50 years old and a widow, She lives at Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two daughters and two sons. They are all married.

On is a beverage seller for 11 years. On is requesting a loan to purchase beverage to sell in during Khmer New Year.

The other group members include Mrs. Thay, a garment factory worker and Sarin, a tire seller.

Photo: On is on the far right.

loans.use: To buy beverage to sell during Khmer New Year and repair her house.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Martha se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the “Habaspata” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Martha has her own restaurant. She makes different dishes, such as roast chicken, soups, and meat stir-fries. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has already had this business for eight years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting the loan in order to buy ingredients, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is happy to get this loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Jorge Washington  se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, el socio es un hombre trabajador que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant grande. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jorge Washington is an industrious restaurateur who belongs to the “HABASPATA” communal bank in Vilcabamba District, La Convencion Province in Cusco Department. The motivation for Jorge Washington's great dedication to his business is to provide for his children's education and see them graduate. 

Jorge Washington hopes to expand the restaurant, and is applying for a loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. He is pleased to have the opportunity to obtain a loan and is committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Jesus  se dedica al negocio de ganaderia, el socio los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesús belongs to the “Habaspata” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Jesús makes a living by raising livestock. He raises the cattle and fattens them up before selling them at different fairs. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He wants to get ahead in life by doing this work. His dream is to expand his cattle-selling business. He is requesting the loan in order to buy cattle.

He is happy to get this loan and is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Yanet  se dedica negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yanet belongs to the “Habaspata” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Yanet makes a living by growing fruit. She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, mandarins, and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to acquire more land for growing her crops. She is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilisers. 

She is happy to get this loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Это Дилбар. Ей 35 лет. Она жительница города Душанбе. Дилбар замужем и мать четверых детей. Детям 14, 9, 4 и 2 лет. Дети учатся в средней школе. Муж находится загранице, он там зарабатывает и отправляет деньги домой. Дилбар в городе живет с мамой, папой и детьми. Она честная и ответственная женщина.  Дилбар  на рынке продает полотенце и одеяло. Она начала заниматься этой бизнесом в 2008 году. Дилбар хорошо знает свою работу. Она хочет расширить деятельность и ежедневный доход. Дилбар берет кредит для перевоза больше товаров. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку. Дилбар заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Dilbar is 35 years old and a resident of Dushanbe. Dilbar is married and has four children (14,9,4 and 2 years old). Her older children are attending school. Her husband works abroad, and send money back to his family. Dilbar lives in the city with her mother, father and the kids. She is an honest and responsible woman. Dilbar sells towels and comforters at the local market. She has been managing her business since 2008. Dilbar knows her work well. She wants to expand her activities and daily profits. She is taking out this loan, which will allow her to bring in more inventory for her store. She need your help. Dilbar is thanking everyone in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to bring in more inventory and expand her business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia hails in Talibon, Bohol. She is a 37-year-old married woman with an 11 year old son. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like coffee, biscuits, powdered milk, seasonings, toiletries and other basic commodities. In addition to that, she also goes farming. She grows rice, vegetables and fruits.

She is asking a loan to buy stocks for the store like soft drinks, liquor and farm supplies like fertilizers and sprayers. These materials are very essentials in running her store. It will also improve the yield of her farm.  With these, she will be able to earn higher earnings and start to balance her finances. 

Claudia is determined to manage her business to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store like soft drinks, liquor and farm supplies like fertilizers and sprayers.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Meet Carolyne. She is a 22-year-old woman who has been a farmer for five years. She is based in Kangema village, where she has a half-acre farm and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. On the farm, she grows vegetables that she uses for both consumption and sale. This business has enabled her to raise one child. Carolyne's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending good private schools. Carolyne is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. The money from the investment will enable Carolyne to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way in empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz works hard to support her family. Maria Luz is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell to her customers.

Maria Luz has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Saolengchry

texts.en: Saolengchry is a 19-year-old single freshman and he lives with his parents in the Takeo province in Cambodia. His father is a construction worker and his mother is a rice farmer. Saolengchry is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in agriculture at a university in the province. Currently, he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees for his second semester, so he would like to request a loan. With the loan, he will be able to finish the second semester of the first year successfully. For his future dreams, he wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for his second semester

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una persona que se está esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo para poder ser una buena profesional. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Comenta que cuando termine la universidad quiere poder seguir capacitándose para poder crecer. Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a person who is striving to become somebody in life. For this reason, she puts all her efforts into becoming a good professional. She says that she used the previous loan to pay her university fees, which meant she was able to continue with her studies.

She says that when she finishes university, she wants to be able to continue training so she can grow in her profession.

She is requesting a new loan so she can pay her university fees again.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 65 years old and a widow with six children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Marieta needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, a rake, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Marieta will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, a rake, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay tuition for university studies.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene una hija trabaja como empleada doméstica y a la vez estudia la carrera de radiología porque le gusta y comenta que quiere tener un puesto para poder ayudar a su familia.
Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora y pone todo de sí para poder crecer. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Marta is 38 years old, is married, and has a daughter. She works as a maid as well as studying radiology because she likes it and she comments that she wants to have a position and help her family.  

She is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working woman who does everything to be able to grow.  She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the payment of her school tuition for radiology.  She is thankful for this opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: To pay university tuition in the field of radiology.

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Chantha was selected to be group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they live in a village in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Chantha (pictured) is 56 years old, and a widow. She lives in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two daughters. They are married.

Chantha is a garment-factory worker with two years of experience. Chantha is applying for a loan to purchase groceries to sell during Khmer New Year.

The other group member is Mrs. Hay, a construction worker.

Photo: Chantha is the one on the right-hand-side of Hay.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell during Khmer New Year.

loans.name: Musulmon

texts.en:
Musulmon is a gentle man, and he lives in the southern part of Tajikistan. He was born into the family of agrarians in 1992. He is married and has one child. His wife is a housekeeper. He lives with his parents and has a big family.

Recently, Musulmon became a student and now studies at a university. He is interested in history and wants to be a specialist in his major. This year he is graduating, but he does not have the money to pay the tuition fee for his education. He asked for a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders to pay his tuition fee for his studies. He hopes to graduate with excellence and be a specialist in history. Musulmon awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for university.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years, and she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, cooking oil and other personal care products.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marietta is 40 years old and her children are presently in school.

Marietta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish netting and bamboo, and maintain her boat.

Marietta has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish netting and bamboo, and maintain her boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open his own business, which is a sewing workshop

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 31 летняя леди из маленького населенного пункта под названием Яван. Она мать четверо прекрасных маленьких девочек. Старшая дочка учится в школе, а трое еще маленькие. Муж Шахло часто ездит на заработках в Российскую Федерацию. Шахло сама занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи. Она не один год не пропускает посев, ведь за счет этой деятельности они покрывают расходы. Шахло просит кредит для приобретения семян овощей и минеральных удобрений. Поддежите Шахло.
texts.en: Shahlo is a 31-year-old lady from a small village called Javan. She is the mother of four beautiful little girls. The oldest daughter is in school and the other three are younger still. Shahlo’s husband frequently travels to work in Russia, while Shahlo plants crops. She grows vegetables. She has never missed a planting season because this is how they support themselves. Shahlo asked for a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer. Support Shahlo.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: El Progreso De Ricardo Palma Group

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 47 años de edad, conviviente con hijos independientes. Ella trabaja desde  muy pequeña años atrás vendía queso, leche es así donde decide tener su propio negocio. Actualmente ella se dedica a la elaboraciòn y venta de canastas hechas de bejuco para  la cosecha de café. Con los ingresos de sus ventas apoya  a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.  Su sueño es expandirse más en este tipo de negocio en la zona donde vive. Solicito el crédito para comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus canastas. Yolanda viste polo color blanco.
Está muy agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva por confiar en ella.
texts.en: Yolanda is 47 years old and lives with her life partner and grown children.  She has worked from the time she was young selling cheese and milk.  She decided to begin her own business.  Currently she works making and selling baskets made up of reeds for the harvesting of coffee.  With her income she supports her husband by helping to pay for household expenses.  Her dream is to expand her business in the zone where she lives.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy materials for the making of baskets.  Yolando can be seen in the picture wearing a white polo shirt.  She is very thankful for the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making reed baskets.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Monica is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Monica has a food vending business in the Philippines. Monica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients such as flour, meat, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Monica has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients such as flour, meat, cooking oil, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Ancelmo

texts.es:
Don Anselmo es un hombre de cuarenta y tres años de edad, que inicia su jornada de trabajo cada día a las cuatro de la mañana. Él se dedica en cuerpo y corazón a sacar adelante sus siembras desde hace veinticinco años de ser agricultor. Antes él ya había sido beneficiado con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, está muy agradecido ya que con este primer financiamiento pudo adquirir más tierras y así sembrar más frijoles, maíz y trigo. 
Ahora Anselmo vuelve a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para un segundo préstamo, esta vez para empezar a trabajar, contratar mano de obra, labrar la tierra, comprar cajas de pesticida, abono, urea y sacar adelante su cosecha. Él vela por el bienestar de sus tres hijos y su esposa, es por eso que se esfuerza tanto al trabajar.
texts.en: Anselmo is 43 years old and begins his work every day at 4am.  He is dedicated heart and soul to raising his crops and has been in this field for 25 years.  He has received a previous loan from Kiva's field partner MiCrédito.  He is thankful since this first loan allowed him to buy land and plant more beans, corn and wheat.  Now Anselmo is asking for another loan from Kiva's partner MiCrédito in order to begin a new crop, to contract manual labor, till the earth, buy bags of pesticide, fertilizers, and to grow his crop.  He works hard for the well-being of his three children and his wife.  For this reason he pushes himself so hard in his work.

loans.use: To buy bags of pesticide, fertilizers, and to hire manual labor to help in his fields.

loans.name: Ijozatkhon

texts.en: Ijozatkhon is 27 years old. She is married and has two children who are 2 and 8 years old. She lives in Nosiri Khusrav district with her mother-in-law, father-in-law, husband and two children. Ijozatkhon has been engaged in agriculture for six years. This kind of activity is their source of income. Ijozatkhon sows vegetables and sells them. Now she wants to sow watermelon, but unfortunately she does not have money to buy watermelon seeds. For this reason Ijozatkhon applied for a loan. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Mrs. Rany ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Rany was selected to be group leader for a loan that her group requested from MAXIMA. In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

1. Rany is 30 years old. She lives at Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 2000, has one son and two daughters. They are still young.

Rany is a housewife with three years of experience, while her husband is a Tuk Tuk [rickshaw] driver with four years of experience. Rany would like to request a loan to repair their motorcycle.

2. Yum is 65 years old, and a widow. She lives at Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Yum is a seller from her home with twenty-five years of experience.

Photo: Rany is on the right hand of Yum.

loans.use: to repair their motorcycle and buy groceries to sell at home.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is grateful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan which she used to purchase a sewing machine and textiles for her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.  Mercy has to meet the demands of her customers for new curtains, bed sheets and other home trappings. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP a day. Her earnings will surely help cover their daily sustenance. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Mercy hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a bright future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, needles, and oil for sewing.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Rael, 48 years of age, a very hardworking, progressive and honest farmer from a very remote village in Karachine in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Rael is happily married and the proud mother of seven children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and a variety of food crops that she grows on her farm. She also works in transportation and does some small business transactions in order to make ends meet.

Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs such as good fertilizer and good-quality seeds. Through this loan, she will double her production and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming.

This loan will help Rael to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ana May has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to resell.

Ana May has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ana May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to resell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of dried fish to sell.

Norma has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives on a hilltop in Kapsowar, Kenya with her husband and children. She earns her income through practicing mixed farming. Salome passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows. However, the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. 

She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. Salome is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting the life of her family and children. Please consider lending to Salome.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sandra works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Sandra is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to resell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 39 years old and widowed with two children. With her children currently in school, Marlina works very hard to provide for them.

Marlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, and personal care products.

Marlina has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, milk, coffee, noodles, and personal care products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 37-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is tea farming and selling, plus selling cattle and owning rentals that earn him more income. He is faced with challenges of prolonged drought and inadequate capital that hinder his business development. His dream is to become a lead green leaf tea producer in his area. Peter has asked for a loan to buy green leaf tea to sell.

loans.use: to buy green leaf tea to sell

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Divinah, a 28-year-old youthful mum. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Divinah passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 10 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family. 

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. The main challenge that Divinah faces is that her cows stray to her neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to her, because she has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. She is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire. Through the loan she will be able to control her animals, and this will help her a great deal. She will save more money. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy barbed wire

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 38 years old, married with three children and living in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers that helped him to maintain the soil productivity. He still deals in commercial farming, growing crops like cotton and vegetables for income generation to sustain his family and earn a living. He also runs a salon for men and motorcycle transport to make ends meet. He meets a hardship of floods that affect his farming output. Emmanuel will use the loan to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru: Рита, 41 год, замужем, есть дочь. Рита имеет среднее образование. По характеру она: доброжелательная, честная и пунктуальная. Она на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 7 овец, на 2,09 Га земли выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить нетель для увеличения поголовья скота. Это позволит ей развивать бизнес и накопить на образование дочери.
texts.en: Rita is 41, married, and has a daughter. She has a high school education and is friendly, honest and punctual by nature. She has been raising livestock and planting crops for 15 years and currently has a cow, seven sheep, and a 2.09 hectare plot of land where she grows beans to sell. Her monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). She applied for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank in order to buy a calf to increase her livestock headcount. This will help her expand her business and save for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy a calf in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Jean Martin

texts.fr:
Jean Martin est un homme de 30 ans qui a déjà eu 5 enfants de 2 unions différentes. Il s’est toujours montré très responsable et participe pleinement à l’éducation de ses 5 enfants. Il exerce une activité de vente de charbon à son domicile mais propose également la livraison aux clients intéressés.

Il a débuté cette activité il y a 3 ans, en même temps que le démarrage du partenariat avec Vahatra. Il ne vendait au départ que du charbon en petite quantité mais les prêts successifs lui ont permis d’augmenter significativement son stock. Aujourd’hui, avec ce nouveau prêt il va acheter plus de 200 sacs de charbon.

Son objectif actuel reste d’augmenter encore son capital pour continuer à sécuriser l’avenir de ses enfants et pouvoir projeter d’acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
Jean Martin is a thirty-year-old man with five children from two different relations. He always behaved very responsibly and participates fully to the education of his five children. He retails charcoal from home, but also offers deliveries to interested clients.

He started this business three years ago, at the same time as his partnership with Vahatra. In the early days, he only sold small quantities of charcoal, but successive loans allowed him to significantly increase his stock. Today, with this new loan, he will purchase over 200 bags of charcoal.

His current goal is to further increase his capital to continue building a safer future for his children and to be able to consider buying some land.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Zhyldysai

texts.ru: Жылдысай, 52 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Жылдысай средне-специальное бухгалтерское образование, она очень жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый человек, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве дополнительного дохода Жылдысай на протяжении 21 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также есть 2,10 ГА поливной земли, где Жылдысай выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль в хороший сезон составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коровы и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Жылдысай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни ее семьи и построить дополнительные сараи.
texts.en: Zhyldysai is 52, married, and the mother of five children. She has a vocational education in accounting. She is a very cheerful and hardworking person and is now retired. In order to earn additional income for her family Zyldysai has been raising livestock and planting crops for 21 years. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and ten sheep, along with a 2.1 hectare plot of land where she grows beans to sell and to use on the farm. In a good season she earns up to 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business she applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to increase her herd by purchasing a cow and ten sheep. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock in order to improve her family’s living conditions and to build additional barns.

loans.use: to buy a cow and ten sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Mrs. Sinarth’S Group Leader

texts.en: Sinarth was selected to be group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Sinarth (pictured) is 45 years old , She lives in the Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1995, and has one son and one daughter. They are attending school. Sinarth is a farm worker with two years of experience, while her husband is a policeman who has 20 years experience. Sinarth would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to take to their work. The other group member included is Mrs. Sina, who is also a farm worker. Photo: Sinarth is on the right hand of Sina.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take to their work.

loans.name: Mrs. Sinet’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Sinet was selected to be group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they are in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Sinet (pictured) is 29 years old. She lives at Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 2007, and has one son and one daughter. One is attending school and other is still young.

Sinet is a garment factory worker with two years of experience, while her husband is a construction worker with five years of experience. Sinet is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to take to their work. The other group member included is Mrs. Ath, who is also a construction worker. Photo: Sinet is on the left of Ath.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take to their work.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 26-year-old married woman from a village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother of one small son. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. 

Ayat started her own business which is a sewing workshop. She makes very nice pieces of clothes. Ayat received a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. Ayat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 25-year-old single woman from Khan Younis city. She lives with her family in a very simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. Hiba started her own business, a sewing workshop, one year ago. She makes very nice pieces of clothes. Hiba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. Hiba appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael operates a tricycle transportation service. He transports passengers from one place to another. He is a 39-year-old married man with two young children who are 4 and 6 years old. He has been engaged in this kind of business for six years already. To be able to continue to operate his business he decided to request a loan.

He is asking for a loan to pay for a franchise fee. With this, he could continue to operate his transportation service. Thus, his earnings will improve. He could now afford to buy nutritious diets for the whole family. With this, he could now start to set aside some savings for emergency use. 

Micheal is hoping that someday his livelihood status will improve.

loans.use: to pay for a franchise fee

loans.name: Carlos Salgado

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo de 17 años de edad en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old, lives with his wife and 17 year old son in their own rustic home, in the district of Pomahuaca, a farming and agricultural community found in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca Region of the northern highlands of Perú.

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, having 4 years of experience in the field The requested loan will be used for labor, application and incorporation of fertilizing products and harvesting labor. This will help with the physiological, morphological and productive improvement of his crops, as well as to have a timely harvest and therefore an increased production and better quality of product, making it easy to sell such product and generate higher revenue that will allow him to increase his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: pay for labor, application and incorporation of fertilizing products and harvesting labor for his crops.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a young woman from Kapsowar who has had to overcome many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to come out ahead and continue progressing with her family. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. 

Janet is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed them. Janet wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Janet will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Janet is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Janet dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 44 years old and has four children. Hilaria is married and three of her children are in school.
Hilaria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Hilaria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
Hilaria has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Hilaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, in search of a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, decided to start farming. According to her, farming will give her everything she has always dreamed of. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Jane is married, and blessed with lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. 

Deciding to practice poultry farming for Jane was not difficult. For the past ten years, Jane has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates a business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Jane is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Jane is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is 29 years old and married, She has four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in the cocoa business, mainly growing, buying and selling in markets. She started the business to raise income for the family and school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital to buy more cocoa during the season for increased profits. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children up to University and support other family members. Scovia has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to  buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 40-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He practices the rearing of goats as well as owning a bar and a salon to earn extra income. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. He hopes to expand his goat farm, however his main challenges are competition and diseases that attack his animals. He is requesting a loan to buy more goats for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats for his farm.

loans.name: Marx

texts.en:
Marx is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a shop where he sells fuel and also practices farming where he mainly grows bananas for both commercial and home consumption. He hopes to finish up his house. His vision is hindered by bad weather that affects his business from where he expects to raise income to support his dream project.

Marx intends to use the loan to buy more construction materials to finish up his house.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to finish up his house.

loans.name: Riqui

texts.es:
Riqui está estudiando la carrera de Odontología, está cursando el 4to. Año, su meta es terminar su carrera,  tener un buen trabajo que le permita ser alguien en la vida  y así poder llegar a mejorar su calidad de vida y de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Riqui is studying for a career in dentistry and is in his fourth year.  His goal is to finish his studies, and get a good job that will allow him to be somebody in life, and thus, to be able to achieve a better quality of life for himself and his loved ones.  He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition, and with it, he'll be able to continue his studies as he has been doing.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he's been given.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs at his university.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 5 y 10 años y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos.
Ella es buena madre, amable, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pedro Domingo Murillo’ un área residencial, donde se realizan ferias semanales en diferentes zonas. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Mery es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que administra. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de electrodomésticos; diariamente visita las diferentes ferias de la zona para, debajo de una sombrilla, abrir su puesto de venta, donde podemos encontrar; licuadoras, sumidoras, exprimidoras, termos, planchas, ollas, y otros artículos de línea blanca. “inicie mi negocio con un capital mínimo para la venta de licuadoras y planchas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede vender a crédito, la desventaja es que debe transportarse largos tramos con su mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de línea blanca, ella desea realizar la compra de artículos de línea blanca por mayor, para incrementar sus ingresos y pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos de línea blanca por mayor para aumentar sus ventas, abrir una tienda y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mery is a 28 year old single mother of two sons, of 5 and 10 years of age. She works selling home appliances. She is a good mother, kind, generous, patient, responsible and very hard working. She conducts her business in the “Pedro Domingo Murillo” zone, a residential area where weekly fairs are held in different neighborhoods. With a cold and dry climate and a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 grades centigrade.

Mery is of dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair, usually tied back, short in stature and of robust physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks around family; she speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business she manages. She shares her life with her children, who attend school, and they all live in a brick and cement room that has a tin roof, electricity, drinking water, gas and sewage. Her business is selling appliances at the various neighborhood fairs in her zone; under an umbrella, she sets up shop where one can find: blenders, juicers, thermos, irons, pots and other home appliances.

“I started my business with a small capital for the sale of blenders and irons”, she mentions. The advantage of her business is that she can sell on credit; the disadvantage is that she must travel long distances with her merchandise. Her dream is to open up an appliance store. She wishes to purchase wholesale home appliances to increase her revenue and be able to pay for her children expenses. This is the second series of loans with this institution in the two years she’s been working in this business. This being the reason Mery is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale home appliances to increase her sales, open up a shop and pay for her children expenses.

loans.use: purchase wholesale home appliances to increase her sales, open up a shop and pay for her children expenses

loans.name: Salomathon

texts.en:
Salomathon is a hardworking woman. She was born into a family of agrarians in 1971. She lives in a small village in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is a widow and has four children.

She has 25 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She works seasonally and plants vegetables each year. Salomathon is a responsible, goal-oriented and honest person. She tries to work hard in order to gain a good harvest and earn money to feed her family. It is not easy to feed and grow her children alone.

She is asking a loan from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizers and warmer items that cover vegetables during the winter. She hopes to have a good harvest and sell her vegetables to customers. It would help her to feed and grow her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and warmer items that cover vegetables during the winter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an energetic mother. She is from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Mary is very hardworking and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a very young age, and now I am independent.”

Mary works in mixed farming and has some small businesses to supplement her income. She makes sure that she gives the best to her family so that they can be productive in the future and support themselves. Mary enjoys farming, especially milking and grazing her dairy cows. Mary has farmed for 10 years and is recognized as one of the best farmers in her village. Because of this, most villagers want products from her farm. This has increased her profits. Although she enjoys selling her products to the nearby market and to neighbors, her income is not sufficient to enable her to comfortably take care of her family. Therefore, she plans to start a poultry farm.

Mary requests 20,000 KES to start a poultry farm to improve her income. The Kapsowar area is a populated area, and there is a market for eggs and poultry products but the supply is low. Mary plans to take advantage of this and reap more profits. Mary has been trained by Juhudi Kilimo and is financially disciplined. She believes that she will be able to repay the loan and open other business ventures.

If you are a mother from Africa, getting your hands on financial services is difficult, but Mary is sure that through your kindness, she will be able to acquire the loan, help her family, and improve her living conditions. Support the project of a young, enterprising Kenyan!

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 38 лет, замужем, многодетная счастливая мама 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 1997 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Динара на сегодняшний день имеет лошадь, 5 коров, 10 овец, на 3,0 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, бычка и 15 овец. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем вкладывать в образование и воспитание ее детей.
texts.en: Dinara is 38 years old, married, and the happy mother of six children. She has a secondary education. Since 1997 she has earned additional income for her family by raising livestock and farming. Thanks to tireless work, Dinara today owns five cows, 10 sheep, and three hectares of land where she grows beans. The whole business produces a monthly profit of around 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business she is asking Bai Tushum bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a cow, calf, and 15 sheep. Dinara plans to invest earnings from use of the loan into further developing her business so that she can put more into educating and raising her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy one cow, one calf and 15 sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el caserío de Naranjitos una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima cálido, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 13 años, es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza junto a su familia, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para proteger de la plaga a su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia y por ende mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benito is 36 years old. He lives with his children in the village of Naranjitos, Pomahuaca rural district, a community that is characterized by warm weather. Most of the villagers work in agriculture, trade and livestock. This community is located in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.
Benito works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee. He's worked in this field for 13 years. He is an entrepreneurial father who works hard alongside his family. He has experience in this business and good references in his district. He is asking for a loan to buy compost and fertilizer to protect his coffee crops from plagues and have a timely production to offer to his customers, which will generate more income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to protect his coffee crops from plagues

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. 1 сын и 3 дочерей. Дети ходят в школу. Ее муж занимается ремонтом дома. Адолат 38 лет. Она добрая и гостеприимная женщина. Адолат в районе занимается животноводством уже более 2 лет. Она продвигает деятельность отца. Ее отец тоже занимался этой деятельности.  Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью.  Адолат обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en:
Adolat lives in the Shahrituz region. She is married and has four children: one son and three daughters. Her daughters are in secondary school. Her husband works as a home contractor. Adolat is 38 years old. She is a kind and hospitable person. Adolat has been raising livestock locally for over two years. She continues her father's business. Her father also used to raise livestock. This is Adolat's main line of work because she supports her family thanks to the income from this business. 

Adolat has applied for a loan because  her livestock headcount is  too low at present to continue her work. She is requesting a loan to buy livestock and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock and maintain her business.

loans.name: Marie Pascaline

texts.fr:
Marie Pascaline est une femme de 34 ans. Elle vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe avec ses 3 enfants qu’elle élève avec son mari. Elle y est vendeuse ambulante de téléphone portable mais elle se  déplace également dans les communes environnantes et part quelquefois dans des régions plus éloignées où le marché y est propice.

Le partenariat entre Vahatra et Marie a commencé il y a 2 ans lorsqu’elle a décidé de démarrer sa propre activité. Elle s’est toujours montrée très sérieuse et fait une demande aujourd’hui pour obtenir son 7ème prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter de nouveaux téléphones tactiles et ainsi de proposer une plus large gamme de produits à sa clientèle.

Elle espère pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison mais se préoccupe actuellement de garantir l’éducation de ses enfants encore en bas âge.
texts.en:
Marie Pascaline is a 34-year old woman. She lives in the urban community of Antsirabe with her three children she raises with her husband. She sells mobile phones as a street vendor locally as well as traveling to nearby communities and sometimes to  more distant regions with better market conditions.

Marie started her collaboration with Vahatra two years ago, when she first decided to launch her proper business. She has always taken her obligations seriously. At present she is applying for her seventh loan, which will allow her to buy new touch-screen phones and offer a greater selection of goods to her customers. She hopes to be able to build her own house one day, but at present her concern is providing for the education of her children, who are still young.

loans.use: to stock up on mobile phones.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Her name is Jeana, 46, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Andres, a tricycle driver and she has one child who is still a high school student. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her child to school. 

Jeana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a tricycle unit for a transportation service, which her husband drives for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to pay for her tricycle maintenance and partly to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her child to high school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Jeana hopes to maintain and grow her business and dreams for a better life. She strives to hard to give her child a college education. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for her tricycle maintenance and partly to pay for grocery items to sell at her small store as well

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia thought she was in the right place when she joined the micro-finance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself financial assistance for her chosen business. Lydia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Lydia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 48-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and two children in a very simple house. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs. 

Iman started her own business ten years ago which is a sewing workshop. She makes very nice pieces of clothes. Iman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 

Iman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She is 62 years old, married and lives in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and hopes to be able to save from it. Her services is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 3000 per month.  

Antonieta  is seeking a Php 5,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for foot spa services. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months.  In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Antonieta is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for foot spa services.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from her service, she also has a house rental business.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is important that her unit is always is a good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her earnings from her transport service will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estelita hopes to maintain and grow her business. She dreams that her children will go to college and see them become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her tricycle (three-wheeled transport vehicle).

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur. She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merly dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakimu is 57 years old and is married with six children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Hakimu practices commercial farming, growing crops such as maize, beans and cotton for sale. Hakimu started the business to get a daily source of income to support his family. He is hard-working, with a future dream of constructing his residential house. Hakim is faced with a challenge of weather changes that affect his products, and he is also struggling with pests and diseases. Hakimu wants money to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers to apply to his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers to apply to his farm.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is married and has two children.  She has a tailoring business sewing clothes every day.

An $800 loan is offered to Agusta to improve her business. She will buy sewing machines, fabric and sewing thread. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2006. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Agusta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, fabric and sewing thread.

loans.name: Tayyaba

texts.en:
Tayyaba is a 47-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons, who are studying. 

Tayyaba's husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 10 years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Tayyaba is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan wo that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Tayyaba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to purchase clothes to sell in his business.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 29-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a very simple house. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income which is barely enough to cover all the family needs. 

Layla started her own business four years ago which is a sewing workshop. She makes very nice pieces of clothes. Layla took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her income. Layla appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Gift Keko Flat Group

texts.en:
Imelda, who is in her early 30s, is married with four children; three of them are still in school and one is still small. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from 9am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Imelda's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing and buying different types of clothes and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She will use this loan to buy clothes to meet her customers' demand for Easter celebration. She dreams of building her house and also to become an international businesswoman.
