Imelda will share this loan with her loan group Gift Keko Flat which consists of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to meet her customers' demand for Easter celebration.

loans.name: Arzel

texts.en:
Arzel is 49 years old and currently lives with her husband and four children. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. 

For a living, Arzel and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, root crops and beans. Arzel wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house. In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and sticks, for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Marie Jeanne est une femme courageuse de 49 ans. Elle est aujourd’hui veuve de son mari avec lequel elle a eu 4 enfants. Cela fait 13 ans qu’elle exerce une activité de vente de sandales. Elle vend ses produits au grand marché de la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années et compte avec ce nouveau prêt renouveler son stock de marchandises (sandales, ballerines) et s’orienter également vers la vente de baskets.

Grâce à une bonne gestion de son budget, elle a réussi à acheter un bœuf et construire une petite maison. Elle espère un jour pouvoir acheter un autre terrain sur lequel ses enfants pourront également construire leur maison.
texts.en:
Mary Jane is a courageous 49-year-old woman. She is now a widow but had four children with her deceased husband. She has been selling sandals for the past thirteen years, and sells her products at the main market in the urban district of Antsirabe.

She has been a partner of Vahatra for over a decade, and will use this new loan to renew her stock of goods (sandals, ballerinas) and also begin selling sneakers.

Through good budget management, she managed to buy an ox and build a small house. She hopes one day to buy another plot of land where her children can also build their home.

loans.use: buy a stock of shoes

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 60 years old, and is married with five children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for four years, and also earns an income from tailoring. Wilma has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, noodles, spice, soft-drinks, spices and other personal care products.

She has borrowed and successfully repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Wilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, noodles, spice, soft-drinks, spices and other personal care products.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and one daughter. Osama works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Osama took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Osama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Mansor

texts.en:
Mansor is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and two daughters. Mansor works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Mansor took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Mansor appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Aissata Amadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été mis en place en 2009,il regroupe les membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Aissata qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette ,elle est âgée de 37 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 filles.

Elle vend des arachides,elle s'approvisionne dans son village pour revendre vers le centre du pays où elle dispose d'une clientéle fidèle.

Avec ce prêt,elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 50kg d'arachide à 20500f l'unité. 

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et d'assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was set up in 2009. It includes members living in the same village and who are active as small retail merchants.

Aissata, who is on the right of the photo raising her arm, is our featured borrower. She is a 37-year-old married mother of six children including four girls.

She sells groundnuts, and restocks in her village to sell towards the center of the country where she has a loyal clientele.

With this loan she intends to buy fifteen 50-kilo bags of groundnuts at 20,500 francs a unit.

Her aim is to increase her savings and ensure her family's basic needs.

loans.use: buy groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 39-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and two daughters. Khaled works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old, married and has four children. One of her children is still schooling.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Charity, a very skilled farmer with experience in diverse areas of agriculture, with an innate talent for teamwork and with a great business mind. She is a wise farmer who neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. 

She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, in the Central region of Kenya. Charity is happily married, and together with her husband, blessed with one lovely child. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, milk, cabbage, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Charity has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Charity mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Charity is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge; hence, she has been suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan, Charity is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Charity feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are enormous because Charity will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market, and also because she will increase her sales volume, as she will be able to transport more goods to the market and hence increase her income level. 

Charity is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Charity will improve her living conditions and assure her child's future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for timely delivery of her products to the market.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Jeannette est une femme dynamique de 35 ans. Elle élève 2 enfants avec son mari dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe. Elle s’est lancée dans sa propre activité il y a 9 ans juste avant la naissance de son premier enfant. Depuis, elle continue à vendre des biscuits et des bonbons de manière ambulante. Elle se déplace dans toute la ville selon les opportunités (évènements ou manifestations  particulières, sorties d’école…) et propose la livraison à ses clients. Son sens de la communication lui a permis de fidéliser une certaine clientèle qui apprécie spécialement sa disponibilité et son accueil chaleureux.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 7 ans et compte utiliser l’argent de ce nouveau prêt pour acheter un nouveau stock de marchandises (biscuits, gâteaux, chocolat et diverses sucreries.

Avec les bénéfices de son activité et une bonne gestion de son budget, Jeannette a réussi à acheter des équipements et du mobilier pour son foyer (armoire, bicyclette). Elle espère, un jour pouvoir construire sa propre maison et nous a fait part de son rêve que ses enfants puissent accéder à des études universitaires.
texts.en:
Jeannette is a dynamic 35-year-old woman. She is raising two children with her husband in the urban district of Antsirabe. She launched her own business  nine years ago just before the birth of her first child. Since then, she continues to sell cookies and candy as an itinerant vendor.

She travels throughout the city as opportunities arise (special events and demonstrations, school outings, ...) and offers a delivery service to her customers. Her communication skills allowed her to retain a clientele that especially appreciates her availability and welcoming attitude.

She has been a partner of Vahatra for the past seven years and plans to use money from the new loan to renew her stock of goods (cookies, cakes, chocolates and various candies).

With profits from her business and good budget management, Jeannette was able to buy equipment and furniture for her home (cupboard, bicycle). She hopes one day to be able to build her own house and expressed her dream to give her children access to university education.

loans.use: buy a supply of cookies, chocolates and candies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 45 years old, and one of her children is being sent to school.

Helen has a nail art business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her nail art business.

Helen has been in this business for 13 years. Furthermore, Helen would like to save extra money to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure business.

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en:
Capistrana raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for almost 11 years now. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling items like canned goods, sugar, spices, soap, noodles and beverages. She is a 36-year-old married woman with three young dependents. 

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed and fertilizer for the farm and stock like soft drinks and liquor. These will be of great help for Capistrana and her family to improve their livelihood. She could raise and sell healthy hogs in the coming months. Her farm will also harvest more yield. Thus, she could now provide her children with healthy diets and continue to send them to school.

In the future, she is hoping that she could manage her sources of income successfully for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fertilizer for the farm and stock like soft drinks and liquor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a business selling clothes in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothes to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Janet dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, skirts and children's wear for selling.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 57-year-old, married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sophia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sophia requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Sophia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Sophia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr:
Joseph est un homme marié de 53 ans. Il est originaire de la commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe où il a élévé ses 7 enfants avec sa femme. Ce chef de famille responsable tient un stand de boucherie au grand marché de la ville depuis 13 ans.

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 6 ans. Avec le bénéfice du dernier prêt, il a pu racheter 3 bœufs et ainsi renforcer son capital. Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter de nouvelles bêtes, notamment des zébus et des cochons.

Son rêve est d’avoir une ferme et de pouvoir developper son propre élevage. Mais sa priorité actuelle reste encore de veiller à garantir l’éducation et l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Joseph is a 53-year-old married man. He is from the Antsirabe urban district where he raised seven children with his wife. This responsible head of family has been holding a butcher's stand at the city's main market for the past 13 years.

He has been is a partner of Vahatra for the past six years. With profits from the last loan, he was able to buy three oxen and thus bolster his operating capital. With this new loan he intends to buy new livestock, including zebus and pigs.

Her dream is to own a farm so he can raise his own livestock. His current priorities are however to ensure his children's education and future.

loans.use: buy three oxen

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and three daughters. Her children are doing their studies.. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for five years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Nageena is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan. 
 
Nageena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Mrs. Leang ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Leang was selected to be the group leader for a loan they requested from Maxima. In the group, there are three members and they are from a village in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Leang (pictured) is 49 years old and a widow. She lives in Dong Ko district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has three daughters. Two of them are attending school and one is married.

Leang has been making Khmer noodles for her neighbor and has 15 years of experience.  Leang is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to take her to work.

The other group members include Lyna, a garment factory worker, and Lyda, who is also employed in a garment factory. Their portion of this group loan will help them to purchase motorcycles to take them to work.

Note : The oldest woman is Leang’s mother.

In the photo, Leang is on the left side of Lyda.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take her to work.

loans.name: Maqsood Bibi

texts.en:
Maqsood Bibi is a 52-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four daughters and two sons, and her husband has been doing his own business of milk sales for past 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Maqsood Bibi's husband wants to purchase milk for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase this milk.

Therefore, Maqsood Bibi has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy milk to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Maqsood Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Here is Gelita. She is 46 years old now, and for seven years she has engaged in cooking and selling foods for snacks in her community in Pasay City. Blessed with three children, she works hard to provide for the daily needs of the household.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Gelita plans to cook and sell more snack recipes, but financial insufficiency becomes a barrier. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her business. In advance, she would like to extend her deepest thanks to those who will support her.

Gelita dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw products like pork and chicken and seasonings that are needed for her business

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis comenta que una de sus metas es terminar sus estudios y con ello poder abrirse al mundo profesional.
Él está estudiando para poder ser abogado, y con ello quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en todo lo que pueda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y con ello poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Derlis says that one of his goals is to finish his studies and enter the professional labour market.

Derlis is studying to be a lawyer. He wants to be able to help other people however he can.

Derlis is applying for this loan in order to pay university tuition fees, and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Marijha

texts.en:
Marijha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marijha is 39-year-old and all of her children go to school.

Marijha has an internet café business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

Marijha has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Iris Lisset

texts.es:
Iris siempre se vio viajando por el mundo representando a su país de manera diga, por lo que no dudo en seleccionar la carrea de Relaciones Internacionales desde un principio. Esta joven apasionada por la política y Nicaragua, estudia el quinto año de la carrera universitaria a sus 24 años de edad. Además es comerciante desde hace diez años, por lo que no ha sido un obstáculo en salir adelante con sus estudios. 
Iris cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes poseen una pulpería que ha servido de mucho para salir adelante con su familia. Actualmente está futura viajera del mundo está a un paso para culminar sus estudios, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y al terminar el título, ambos con el fin de convertirse oficialmente en Licenciada en Relaciones Internacionales.  En sus planes está conseguir un empleo acorde a su carrera e invertir más en el negocio familia para crecer profesional y personalmente.
texts.en:
Iris has always wanted to travel the world and represent her country. She therefore did not doubt for a second when she chose to study for a degree in international relations. Young Iris is passionate about politics and about Nicaragua. She is 24 years old and in her fifth year of her studies. She has also been a trader for ten years, allowing her to move forward with her education.

Iris has the support of her parents, who have a grocery shop that has helped the family to get ahead. Iris, a future world-traveller, is just one step away from finishing her studies. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to pay for a course to finish her studies and pay for her degree certificate. By doing this, she can become a graduate in international relations.

In the future, Iris plans to find a job related to her studies and invest more in the family business in order to grow both personally and professionally.

loans.use: to pay for a course to finish her studies and pay for her degree certificate.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 32 года, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе учителем математики, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Нургул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова, лошади и 5 овец, также выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 2,934 сом (KGS), доход от бизнеса- около 10,000 сом (KGS). Нургул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки нетели. Нургул намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала ее семьи.
texts.en: Nurgul is 32 years old, married, and she has two sons.  She has a college degree and works in a school as a math teacher.  In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started in this field 15 years ago.  Thanks to her perseverance, dedication and hard work, she now has one cow, a few horses and five sheep.  She also grows beans for resale.  She receives a monthly salary of 2,934 som (KGS) and makes an additional income of approximately 10,000 som (KGS).  Nurgul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy one heifer.  She is planning to expand her business, which will directly lead to an increase of her family's capital.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy humilde de 45 años de edad, quien luego de haber trabajado por muchos años en una empresa del gobierno, decidió emprender en su propio negocio. Ahora lleva 22 años de tener una pulpería que ha ayudado a sus tres hijos estudiar sin ningún obstáculo. Esta comerciante cuenta con el apoyo de su familia completa, especialmente de sus hijos mayores que aportan económicamente en el hogar. 
El sueño de esta mujer emprendedora es seguir creciendo personal y profesionalmente con su negocio, por lo tanto solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico, sodas, café en polvo, jugos, entre otros productos de gran demanda. Con esta inversión podrá asistir sin ningún problema a todos sus clientes y hasta captar nuevos, de manera que sus ingresos incrementaran rápidamente. En sus planes está mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y de su negocio.
texts.en:
45-year old María is a simple woman who, after working for many years for the government, decided to start her own business. Now she has had her grocery story for 22 years, and the income has helped her three children get through school without a problem.

María's whole family helps her, especially her adult children who contribute financially to the household. Her dream is to continue growing both personally and professionally in her business. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy goods such as rice, beans, toilet paper, soft drinks, powdered coffee, juices, and other products that are in high demand. With this investment, she will be able to serve her customers without difficulty and even get new ones. This will help her to grow her income quickly.

María plans to make improvements to both her house and her store.

loans.use: buy goods such as rice, beans, toilet paper, soft drinks, powdered coffee, juices etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco proviene de una familia humilde, es un docente y se está capacitando para ir mejorando cada día.
Está estudiando la licenciatura en ciencias de la educación, y comenta que su meta es terminar su carrera y poder ayudar a las demás personas que como él quiere mejorar sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de la universidad y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Francisco comes from a simple family. He is a teacher and is taking further courses to improve his situation. Currently he is studying for a degree in Educational Science. His goal is to complete his professional training so he can help other people who, like him, wish to further their knowledge.

Francisco is seeking a loan to cover the costs of university so that he can continue his studies and achieve his goals.

loans.use: cover university expenses

loans.name: Jesus Genoveva

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como pollos, gallos, gallinas, etc; en su corral el cual esta ubicado en la parte posterior de su casa, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales y para arreglos de su corral ya que se encuentra en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Jesus espera tener mejor productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará sus ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
55-year old Jesus is a single mother with a son. She lives with her family in Oyotún District, a rural area where agriculture, commerce, and animal raising are the main activities. The area is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast.

Jesus earns her living raising and selling animals such as chickens, hens, and other poultry in the pen that is located in the back part of her house. She's had this business for more than ten years. She is seeking a loan to buy more animals and to repair the pen since it is in a poor condition. The investment will help Jesus to have a greater diversity and variety of animals and thus improve her business. She hopes to have greater productivity so she can serve her customers' various needs and wishes. Then her income will increase enabling her to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to repair their pen since it is in a poor condition

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans et mère de six enfants. Adjo vit à Avédji pour entreprendre son activité. Adjo vend des chaussures en se promenant dans le quartier. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Adjo demande ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures et réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille. Adjo souhaite permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants par son profit tiré dans son activité
texts.en:
Adjo is a 36-year-old, married woman with six children.  She lives in Avédji where she operates her business selling shoes on foot.  She buys new supplies three times a month at the market.

Adjo has requested this loan to buy more stocks of shoes and increase her profits.  This will allow her to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.

Adjo hopes that her profits will ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen pairs of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Kholmoma

texts.ru: Холмома 48 лет. Она жительница района Рудаки. Холмома замужем и мать троих сыновей. Она серьезная и честная женщина. Холмома любить сшить и кроит, по этой причине она выбрала эту деятельность. Она 3.5 года занимается шитьем женской одежды. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход, и сшить национальное платье. Холмома сейчас хочет заниматься шитьем штора. Ей необходимо купить больше ткани и швейные принадлежности. Поэтому Холмома обратилась за кредитом. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку. Только Вы можете ей помочь с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: Kholmoma is 48 years old.  She is a resident of the Rudaki district.  She is married and the mother of three sons.  She is a serious and honest woman.  Kholmoma loves to sew and design clothes, which is the reason why she chose to sew women's clothes, an activity she's been involved in for 3.5 years.  She enjoys her work for the daily income that she makes and because she likes to sew traditional dresses.  She would now like to start sewing curtains.  For this reason, she needs to buy large quantities of fabrics and some sewing supplies.  She needs your support.  Thank you for being there for her at a time when she's experiencing financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a large selection of fabrics and some sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kouya  Dora

texts.fr: Dora est femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Dora est âgée de 40 ans et vit à Avédji avec sa famille. Pour contribuer à leurs besoins quotidiens, Dora de la pate de maïs et du riz pour trouver son revenu. Pour s’approvisionner, Dora achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché. Afin d’avoir un bénéfice favorable et augmenter son épargne, Dora demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs et des sacs de riz et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Kouya Dora is a 40-year-old, married woman with four children.  She lives in Avédji with her family.  In order to contribute to their daily needs, Kouya Dora prepares and sells maize paste and rice.  She buys new supplies once a month at the market.

Kouya Dora has requested this loan to buy bowls of maize and sacks of rice to produce food for her customers.  This will increase her profits and allow her to save some money.

loans.use: to buy 113 bowls of maize and 2 sacks of rice for her restaurant business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from being a dealer of personal goods, she also sells mineral water for additional income.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 loan, which she will use to pay for gallons of water and partly to pay for footwear, undergarments, skin products and cosmetics to meet the orders of her customers.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and a good return on her investment for it will surely fund their everyday needs and her children's education as well.

Jocelyn dreams of having a store of her own to display her products and attract more customers. She aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and  personal products merchandise and to pay for mineral water as well.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est un homme marié qui a trois enfants. Koffi est âgée de 37 ans et vit à Adidogomé pour exercer ses activités. Menuisier, Koffi fabrique des bancs et des chaises pour vendre et réaliser son bénéfice par le revenu tiré de son activité. Koffi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un village pour acheter ses planches. Afin de réaliser d’autres styles de chaises et bancs, Koffi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des planches et tirer un bon profit afin de promouvoir l’épanouissement de sa famille
texts.en: Koffi is married, with three children.  He is 37 years old and lives and works in Adidogomé.  Koffi is a carpenter.  He earns a living making and selling benches and chairs.  He buys his raw materials (wooden boards) twice a month in a village.  Koffi is taking this loan to buy wooden boards and to start making a new type of benches and chairs.  He is hoping for a good profit and he looks forward to seeing his family thrive.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 32 years old, hardworking, and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Moses has been running a bar since 2012 and supplements his income with a video library. He has hopes of constructing a commercial house, which will add to his income. However, his challenge is restrictions on bar openings, which limits him from making sales during the day. Moses is requesting money to buy beer, sodas, water and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, water and spirits  to sell.

loans.name: Munduzkan

texts.ru: Мундузкан 55 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет работала в школе учителем начальных классов, занималась торговлей. Сейчас работает уборщицей, и в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, и 1,20 Га земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Благодаря упорному труду Мундузкан, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 10,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Мундузкан в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 9 овец. Доходы от кредита Мундузкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Munduzkan is 55 years old and the widowed mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and for many years she used to work as a primary school teacher and as a retailer.  Today, she works as a cleaning lady and she also raises livestock and grows crops to provide another source of income for her family.  She has three cows on her farm as well as 1.2 hectares of land on which she grows beans.  Thanks to her very hard work, she makes 10,000 som (KGS) every month from her activity, which roughly covers the family's food expenses and their other day-to-day needs.  However, this amount of money is not enough for a decent life.  Eager to further develop her business, Munduzkan has therefore turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow and nine sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business, which will help her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and 9 sheep in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 43 ans, Jeanne est une femme qui a trois enfants à sa charge. Jeanne habite à Adidogomé et vend des charbons de bois dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Jeanne s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois chez un fournisseur du quartier. Pour commander des sacs de charbons, Jeanne demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Jeanne is 43 years old and married.  She has three children in her care.  She lives in  Adidogomé and sells charcoal in her neighborhood.  Thanks to this activity, she makes enough profits to see her family thrive.  Jeanne stocks up four times per month from a local supplier in the neighborhood.  She is taking this loan to buy some bags of charcoal.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to make this purchase and will receive an income which will allow her to help her husband take care of the children's education.

loans.use: to buy 17 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Djodjina

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 50 ans, Djodjina est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants. Au marché, Djodjina vend du charbon de bois à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Djodjina s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Djodjina demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
Married and 50 years old, Djodjina lives in Adidogome with her four children. At the market, she sells charcoal to her customers and earns enough thanks to this commerce. 

To respond efficiently to her needs, Djodjina procures her goods three times a month from suppliers. She is seeking a loan to order sacs of charcoal so that she can earn more revenue and help her husband support their family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy seven sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Dzhenbubu

texts.ru: Дженбубу, 61 год, замужем, есть сын. Дженбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 4 лошади, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 3,30 ГА фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дженбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Dzhenbubu is 61 years old, married, and she has one son.  She is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, two activities which she started 20 years ago and which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows and four horses on her farm.  She also grows beans on 3.3 hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Dzhenbubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Turavyiyemeje Group

texts.fr:
Gaspard  fait partie du groupe  Turavyiyemeje et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Justine, une  commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 13 ans, dont  3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de bananes mûres   depuis  13 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bananes mûres à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  faire un élevage de gros bétail comme une vache, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gaspard is a member of the Turavyiyemeje Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 35 years old and married to Justine, a trader.  Together they have five children, aged between three and thirteen years old, three of their children attend school.  He has been selling ripe bananas for thirteen years. 

This will be the second loan for Gaspard with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase his working capital and allow him to buy many ripe bananas for resale.

In the coming years, Gaspard would like to raise large animals (eg cows) and see his children attend school and be educated.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many ripe bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Zulpiyahan

texts.ru: Зулпияхан 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Зулпияхан - высшее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зулпияхан работает в школе учителем, получает пенсию. Она занимается и животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Зулпияхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 лошадей, 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,60 Га собственной земли. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зулпияхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для лошадей. Доходы от кредита Зулпияхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство сараев.
texts.en: Zulpiyahan is 59 years old and the widowed mother of three children.  She has a college education.  She knows exactly what she wants and she achieves everything through her own efforts. She receives a pension and also works as a school teacher, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  In addition, she raises livestock and grows crops.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has seven horses on her farm, as well as one hectare of leased land and 0.6 hectares of her own land.  She makes a total monthly income of approximately 15,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent life.  In order to further develop her farming activity, Zulpiyahan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay for her horses.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.  She also wants to save some money to build barns.

loans.use: to buy feed and hay for her livestock, which will allow her to invest in her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Débi

texts.fr: Débi  est une femme mariée âgée de 54 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants. Débi vend des beignets préparés à base de la farine de blé pour gagner son revenu et aider ses enfants. Grâce à ce commerce Débi arrive à faire une bonne épargne et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois chez un grossiste du quartier. Pour commander de l farine de blé et préparer ses beignets, Débi demande ce microcrédit pour favoriser son achat et réaliser une bonne rentabilité pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Débi is a married woman who is 54 years old and lives in Adidogomé with her four children. She works selling beignets made from wheat flour so that she can earn money and help her children. Thanks to this business, Débie is able to save money. 

She procures her ingredients four times a month from local wholesalers. 

She is seeking a loan so that she can order flour and make her beignets. This loan will help her support her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of wheat flour

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui est une femme de 47 ans et vit à Vakpossito. Kafui est mariée et s’occupe de la charge de ses deux enfants. Elle est une commerçante qui vend des pagnes dans sa boutique au marché en livrant ses tissus à ses clients. Son activité lui procure un résultat qu’elle ménage pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Kafui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Kafui demande ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de pagnes et faire encore plus de bénéfices et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Kafui is 47 years old and lives in Vakpossito.  She is married and takes care of her two children.  She is a trader and sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in her shop at the market.  Her business is profitable and allows her to cover the expenses of her family.

Kafui buys new supplies twice a month from the market.  She has requested this loan to place a new order for pagnes to generate a profit which will provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 12 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Manavi

texts.fr: Manavi est âgée de 46 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Mariée, Manavi a un enfant à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari dans leur épanouissement. Manavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Manavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour acheter des cartons de poissons et des paniers tomates, Manavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour favoriser l’éducation de son enfant
texts.en:
Manavi is 46 years old and lives in Adidogomé. Married, she has one child under her care and she works actively to support her husband with their [family's] development.

Manavi works selling general food products in her shop in order to earn a good profit. She procures her goods three times a month from the Grand Market in Lomé. 

She is seeking this loan to buy boxes of fish and trays of tomatoes. Profits will go towards her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 12 trays of tomatoes and seven boxes of fish

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Afi vit avec ses six enfants. Afi une femme mariée et âgée de 46 ans. Afi est revendeuse de tubercules et de l’huile rouge qui gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Grâce à son bénéfice, Afi s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Pour acheter des calebasses d’ignames et des bidons d’huile, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour  contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi lives in the Adidogomé district with her six children.  She is 46 years old and married.

Afi earns a living selling root vegetables and red oil.  She uses her profits to buy further supplies twice a month at the market.  She has requested this loan to buy yams and oil.  Her profits will improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 quantities of yams and 4 drums of oil for resale.

loans.name: Dagan

texts.fr: Dagan est une femme mariée  âgée de 23 ans. Dagan vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Dagan est très dynamique et vend des biscuits et des sucettes dans le quartier. Cette activité l’aide à réaliser une bonne épargne et à soutenir son mari pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Pour disposer ses marchandises, Dagan s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché. Dagan demande ce crédit pour acheter des biscuits et des sucettes pour alimenter son étalage afin d’avoir encore plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Dagan is a married woman who is 23 years old. She lives in Adidogomé with her two children. She is very dynamic and works selling cookies and lollipops in the area. 

This business helps her to save money and supports her husband with covering the family expenses.

Dagan procures her goods once a week at the market. She is seeking a loan to buy cookies and lollipops to stock her kiosk and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of cookies and lollipops

loans.name: Primavera 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA 2015” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de polleras, venta de queso. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria Elena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de internet; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, por iniciativa de su hijo, quien dio a conocer que en su zona no existía un servicio de internet y el abrir este negocio sería muy lucrativo para la familia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra equipo de computación) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene ses hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The credit group “PRIMAVERA 2015” is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Maria Elena is president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied and include: food sales, fish sales, clothes sales, skirt sales and cheese sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Maria Elena. This is the first time that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently runs an internet service business. She says that she started this business some years ago on the initiative of her son, who made her aware that in her area there was no internet service and that opening this business would be very lucrative for the family.  

The loan that she is now taking out is to improve capital by buying computer equipment, which she will get in the shops in the city of El Alto and will then install in her service space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married and has six children.  

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment

loans.name: Las Kantutas De Jp Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTAS DE JP” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vania es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de chapas, venta de joyeros de madera, venta de juguetes, venta de comida, venta de carne de cordero, venta de medias.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vania es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le ayudaron a comercializar sus productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tienes cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Kantutas de JP” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer (a women’s development organization), as part of the focus of Juan Pablo II.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Vania is the secretary.  The business that the members of the communal bank carry out is diverse, including selling woven blankets, metal plating, wooden jewelry boxes, toys, food, lamb meat, and stockings.

The loan they will take out will benefit micro businesses where Vania is a member.  She points out that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer, entering via an invitation from a mass promotion that the institution carried out in her area.  Currently, she has a business selling woven blankets.  She shares that she started this business many years ago with help of her parents, who helped her to sell her products.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (buying woven blankets in bulk) that she will obtain from wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and afterwards she will sell them in her sales space.  This work method allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health and training areas that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy woven blankets in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monina is 40 years old and all of her children are sent to school.

Monina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Monina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old, and married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Agnes operates a human drug shop with a license, and also earns a salary as an additional source of income. 

She has a dream of having a well stocked pharmacy with all medicines that will enable her meet her customers' demands, and to buy land to build a house. However, she is limited by the delayed salary payments. 

Agnes wants money to purchase land to construct a family house.

loans.use: to purchase land to construct a family house.

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally is 36 years old and has four children.  She is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Shally is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Shally has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Semereta

texts.en:
Semereta is a 39-year-old hard working married woman with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a general merchandise shop; she also earns a salary for additional income in order to earn a living. 

She has a dream of educating her children and building her dream house, though she is faced with a challenge of market competition. 

Semereta intends to use the loan for roofing and plastering her residential house.

loans.use: to buy roofing and plastering for her residential house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She catches and sells fish to earn a living. She is a 53-year-old married woman with two grown children. To improve her current source of income, she decided to get a loan.
 
She is asking a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing net. 

With this, her on-going catch will slowly improve and her earnings as well. She could now handle her finances and start to expand her business.    

Evelyn hopes that with the capital she borrows, she will do her best to handle her livelihood properly and go down the road of prosperity in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 45 years old and all of her children are sent to school.

Rosemarie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 68 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Margaret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Angeline, a 57-year-old wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Thika, in the central region of Kenya. 

Angeline always says, “I eat from my sweat.” She is based in Gatundu, a rural village. She has four children and has been practicing farming for the past 45 years, and has never looked back. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Gatundu village own approximately one acre per household and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. 

Angeline has been practicing mixed farming and she enjoys the income she gets, but she has been facing challenges of irrigating her crops on her farm. She has been facing loses because of drought, and she wants to turn around this. 

She respectfully seeks a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the rain water goes to waste, but through this loan she will be able to harvest water and store it for both home and farm use. Through this loan she will also save time that she used to spend searching for this precious commodity called water. 

This loan will bring untold joy to Angeline and her family because her production will increase. Kindly help her realize her dream.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more CDs, VCDs and to buy a new machine which records faster to avoid long cues.

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson, 39 years old, is married and has four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Neckson is a salary earner. He also has a coffee plantation where he gets additional income. He has a dream of educating his children and having land below the mountain where the soil is very fertile to enable him go for agriculture production, which is very marketable. 

He is faced with a challenge of high transport costs to deliver his goods and services, which reduces his profit margin. 

He is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than 14 years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Imelda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also use her loan to pay the maintenance cost of her PisoNet (Internet cafe) business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Imelda hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Imaculate's Group

texts.en:
Imaculate is 35 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Imaculate has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Imaculate also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Imaculate's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old, married, and has six children who all go to school. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. 

Julius owns a butcher shop and he has been in that business for six years. He gets additional income from motorcycle transport and crop production. 

Julius has a dream of  being the best supplier of quality meat. However limited capital is a challenge.  

Julius wants a loan to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering.

loans.name: Cliff's Group

texts.en:
Cliff is 45 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Cliff has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Cliff also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Cliff's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lakshmi Mahila Samiti Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, 45, (at center) is a vegetable vendor from rural Jhabua in the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. Madhya Pradesh is one of India's underdeveloped states, and Jamuna's family is one of the many in the state that scrapes together a living on a monthly income of INR 10,500. 

With three children, including two teenagers, to raise and put through school, Jamuna realizes she has to save a lot more than the meager INR 1,500 she sets aside each month, which is most of the INR 2,000 she earns by selling vegetables in her neighborhood. 

With the goal of improving her income, Jamuna formed a group with Sunita, Radha, Bhagwati, and Maya, who also sell vegetables, to keep their families financially afloat. Together, they seek a loan of INR 55,000, which they will invest in boosting their inventories of vegetables and growing their respective microenterprises. 

With her share of the loan, Jamuna will buy larger quantities of onions, garlic, carrots, cabbages, and potatoes, which are in great demand in her locality. Buying in bulk will help her negotiate better rates from the suppliers in the main market, and the resulting profits and increased sales will help Jamuna earn an extra INR 2,500 each month. This will more than double her monthly income and boost her savings by 67%, which is a big deal for someone of Jamuna's impoverished background. 

Over time, she hopes to further grow her income and savings, eventually saving enough for at least her youngest child to attend public college, and guaranteeing at least a high school education for her two older children. Having missed out on an education due to her family's poverty, the hope of putting her children through school is what drives Jamuna's ambition and goals as a microentrepreneur. 

Jamuna and her group are thankful for this loan, which is a timely opportunity to provide better for their children and families.

loans.use: To boost her vegetable selling microenterprise by stocking up on popular vegetables like onions, garlic, carrots, cabbages, and potatoes.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Anita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Anita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 49 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maribeth has a general store business in the Philippines. Maribeth has been in this business for eight years.

Maribeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Harrfry's Group

texts.en:
Harrfry, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Harrfry will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Harrfry plans to use the profits he gains this year to save more money for the future.

Harrfry’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 44 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons. Her husband has been doing his own butcher shop business for the past 15 years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Razia's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these animals or meat.

Therefore, Razia has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these animals for the meat to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also enable him to earn maximum profitable income from his business.

For this financial assistance Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase animals for her husband's butchery business.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano tiene 63 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 9 años en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 13 años por lo que tiene clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha lo cual lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 63 years old and lives in his own home, made of rustic material, along with his life partner and his 9 year old son.  They live in the district of Pomahuaca, a rural community with a population dedicated principally to agriculture and livestock.  It is located in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

He works in agriculture, specifically raising coffee.  He has 13 years of experience in this field and he counts on fixed customers who offer good personal and work references.  He is requesting a loan in order to support agricultural labors, including application and incorporation of fertilizers and insecticides, as well as manual labor which will help him to improve his harvest.  This assistance, both physical and chemical, will help him have better production, a better quality product, and thus be able to sell more which will generate more income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and manual labor to help in growing and harvesting his coffee crop.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, día a día busca la manera de atraer a sus clientes por las diversas variedades de productos, es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas.
Dominga comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar insumos varios para surtir su despensa y continuar con su trabajo. Ella pide este préstamo nuevo para poder comprar verduras, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Dominga is a very responsible person and dedicated to her work.  Day after day she looks to attract customers through her diverse products.  She is very hard working and has a store where she works every day from the early morning hours.  

Dominga comments that her previous loan was used to purchase various foods to stock her store and to continue her work.  She is asking for a new loan in 
order to buy vegetables, meat, breads, and other items.  In this way she will be able to continue her sales as she is doing now.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, breads, and other items.

loans.name: Eva Lucia

texts.es:
Eva es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo sacrificada, que esta ganándose la vida de una manera digna y honrada, la cual es su peluquería, que pudo montar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar insumos para su salón de belleza.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en la compra de insumos como ser cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Eva is from the city of Paraguarí. She is a person who is really a fighter and above all, selfless. She is earning a living in a respectable and honorable way, which is is hair salon. She was able to open it with much hard work and sacrifice. She says that she used the previous loan to buy materials for her beauty salon.  

She is asking for this new loan to invest again in buying materials such as creams, shampoo, rinses, dyes and more. This way, she can keep offering a good service.

loans.use: to buy materials such as creams, shampoo, rinses, dyes, and more.

loans.name: 6 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Anselma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de ropa, venta de polleras, venta de queso. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Anselma es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, con un pequeño capital para emprender su negocio, menciona que este negocio lo implemento al observar la carencia de este negocio en su calle. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra abarrotes por mayo y una heladera) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará e instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The 6 De Junio communal bank will begin its 12th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Anselma is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are in engaged in are varied and include selling food, selling fish, selling clothes, selling traditional skirts, and selling cheese.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Anselma is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, and she joined by invitation from a member who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a neighborhood store.  She says that she started this business several years ago with a small amount of capital to undertake her business.  She mentioned that she set up her business upon observing the lack of this type of business on her street.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy groceries wholesale and a cooler).  She will get the items from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and she will set them up and sell them at her sale’s space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to financially support her family.  She is married and has four children.
